Reviews.Title: “beautiful with attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: walkswithafriend
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying at the Fairmont QE in Montreal, at a conference. My room is a single and is not overly large but is big enough. The location of the hotel is very good and you can get a bus here from the airport (stop #5) and is $8. It is right by the subway and above a shopping mall. The conference rooms were large and we used all of them - about 20. The staff were exceptional and we hardly noticed them going to and from our rooms but they were very courteous. The maid service in the room was excellent and I received a nice welcome note and my things in the bathroom were nicely laid out for me. The bathroom was small but very nice. Front desk staff were welcoming. Bed is super comfortable and I rarely sleep through the night when away from home but did here. FOOD FANTASTIC! Sorry, did not visit the swimming pool, although I meant to.

Reviews.Title: “Queen Elizabeth Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Heather54
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Queen E over the weekend. The location is great, close to Saint Catherine Street for shopping. The hotel is spotless, however, the room was very, very small, if we had been stayed longer I would have requested a larger room. The beds and pillows are wonderful. Had dinner at the Montrealais in the hotel, food was excellent, we had rack of lamb and prime rib, both meals were cooked to perfection. The service was very good. The chef even came out after dinner to ask how our food was. The food was reasonably priced, lamb and prime rib both $30. which is good for quality meat. The only negative thing I can say about this restaurant is the wine is very over priced. A bottle of chardonnay which sells for $13. at SAQ is $45. in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: IbnBututta
Reviews.Content: This place is truly a sight to see. Very conveniently located with excellent service. The gym is just amazing very huge with excellent equipment. Rooms themselves are great. I stayed in a 1 bedroom suite. Kid's loved the place. It can be pricey though.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: strtchrst
Reviews.Content: I went there on business. The room was very good, but nothing spectacular. Some of my colleagues had better and bigger rooms, although we all paid the same rate. The room and bathroom were clean, I loved the Miller Harris toiletries. The hotel is in a perfect location, just above the train and underground station. There was a swimming pool and a gym but did not use those. The food at the Beaver Club restaurant was excellent. I thoroughly recommend this hotel if you can get it for a reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Pleaseeeeed”
Reviews.Author: RonaS_11
Reviews.Content: I started my adventure by arriving at this hotel just above the Amtrack station which was a big plus. I received a warm greating by the Hotel staff and my accomidations were wonderful. I used the gym and pool everyday that I was there and I was never disappointed. I lked the accomidations so much that I will be returning again in June

Reviews.Title: “Royal treatment”
Reviews.Author: Helene T
Reviews.Content: As a birthday gift, my husband treated me to an overnight stay at the QE where we received royal treatment from the moment we walked in. In our room was a birthday card with a small gift, courtesy of the hotel. We had an excellent dinner at the Beaver Club restaurant which was highly recommended by the concierge desk. Though very pricy, the food and service was worth the one time event. Location of this hotel makes it easy to walk around or travel by plane, train, or automobile. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: NikoPoulos
Reviews.Content: This is not my first time checking in at a Fairmont Hotel. However, the customer service I received from Cesar at the front desk was horrible. I felt like he was Belittling me during the check in. He requested to see 3 forms of ID during my check in. That's a little overboard if you ask me. He also left my sight for an extended period of time with my ID. I understand that people must do their job, but there is a proper way of approaching the situation and ensuring customer service is not marginalized at the expense of security. Maybe Fairmont should address these issues. I will be sending an email to head office as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great for business traveler”
Reviews.Author: belha
Reviews.Content: Extremely effective check-in process. Service is great and attentive to the needs of business travelers. Comfortable beds with good linen. Some rooms have very small bathrooms. Very quiet. This hotel is located in the center of the city, above the train station and close to the airport shuttle. Walking distance from Ste-Catherine Street (major shopping area). Close to very good restaurants. Great "old-fashion" bar with piano. Excellent buffet breakfast.Free wi-fi if you are part of their club.

Reviews.Title: “relaxation in the city”
Reviews.Author: cotimes2
Reviews.Content: The fairmont is perfect for touring montreal--in the center of town, right over metro lines, access to airport shuttle. Service is top notch and the food very good. Bartenders at their bar were great. Rooms were very spacious which is unusual for a city hotel. A terrific stay.

Reviews.Title: “definitely geared to the business crowd but still pleasant for a mini-holiday”
Reviews.Author: CWiebe
Reviews.Content: we recently spent 4 nights in Montreal on a mini holiday. The staff at the QE are consumate professionals - our check in was very welcoming and swift which is always appreciated. we had a decent sized room with a wonderful view directly north to McGill University and Mount Royal. The king size bed was extremly comfortable - I have always loved the beds at Le Germaine and this was just as good! The decor was nothing spectacular but I did appreciate that the window opened to let in fresh air. the bathoom was fairly small but updated and adequate for us. This was a birthday gift for my husband so were greeted with a lovely tray of chocolate covered strawberries and hand written birthday greeting. the location is terrific for wandering around the downtown and only a short stroll to old Montreal. we took advantage of the unusually warm weather and strolled the streets all day - the concierge was very helpful in providing directions to several specialty stores for specific shopping needs. we enjoyed the piano bar/lounge off the main lobby for late night drinks - great atmosphere. breakfasts were in the bistro - a large restaurant but broken into smaller areas so it was more initmate. the only ' complaint' we had was the cost of the items on the menu - the cheapest breakfast was about $22.00. the breakfast buffet was $26.00 - there was a good selection of items however the fruit was not particularly ripe and the egg dishes were frequently over cooked from sitting on hot plates. we ordered cappucinos the first morning and were part way through our breakfast before it finally arrived. the rest of the time we opted for the regular coffee which was tasteless. so I would say that the breakfasts were disapointing, especially given the cost. however, the aspect we really noticed the most was how friendly and professional all the staff were. I have to say this was what set the hotel apart from many others we have stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Canada”
Reviews.Author: frenchquarter2011
Reviews.Content: First time in Canada but not first time Fairmont. Service in terms of check in and restaurant all excellent. The room was fine and clean with a view of downtown Montreal. The only complaint I have was the elevator. I was in a room opposite and during the day it is ok until your head touches the pillow and all you can here is the elevator going up and down most of the night which really does impact on your sleep quality. For me not really acceptable for a hotel of this quality. Great location and I love Fairmont. Would I stay here again....... probably (:

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont always the best!”
Reviews.Author: MuffinsinTO
Reviews.Content: I am a full fledged Fairmont addict and the Queen Elizabeth lives up to their high standard. We stayed in a Gold floor large King room very nice room with a beautiful bathroom Service from the gold floor staff was top notch as always. It is literally ON TOP of the train station for ease of location once you get of the via!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: silvervexcebo
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a club room, gorgeous hotel. Lovely bathroom and comfy bed. Would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Central location in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: elliegirlFredericton
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Fairmont Mar 18-23/12. Nice hotel, very french of course but no problem getting assistance en anglais. Hotel is not what I expected, I thought it would be very grand and imposing , it is upscale but not uncomfortable. Rooms are a decent size, I had a single room with a king size bed. Everything very comfortable and clean, bathrooms are nice but small if you had two people trying to get ready in there. I did not eat there preferring to try the local bars and restaurants, there are some very good ones off and on St Catherines Street. It was a very warm week and downtown was packed with people so if this is the case when you visit , plan to wait in line a few minutes before being seated in a bar or restaurant. Downtown Montreal is very safe for walking so everyone out very late enjoying the nice weather. The Fairmont is central to everything, you can go underground to just about anywhere from the hotel , the Via Rail is just next door under the attached building, so if the weather is not to your taste , just stay inside , eat, shop or just roam around. Overall the stay was great, rooms are quiet, clean , hotel staff very courteous and eager to assist. The only downside to this hotel is the terrible TV, no flat screens here and most of the channels are francais but if it is not your plan to stay inside then its easy to overlook. HINT:Join the Presidents Club online before you go or you will find yourself paying 15.95 per day for internet. There is a lovely pool and gym but I did not check these out while I was there. I would be happy to stay there again. Fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room, great service”
Reviews.Author: Threedogstwokids
Reviews.Content: Travelling with the family we booked a one bedroom suite. The rooms themselves were spacious and clean. The bathrooms are a tad small however that was a small price to pay for such a quiet room The Hotel is exceptionaly well located as it sits atop Central Station and the Montreal underground pathways. We had a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Nice and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Ik0
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Queen Elizabeth recently for a weekend in Montreal. We had a nice corner room on the 15th floor - great view of the Church across the street. The hotel staff were great, the room was really nice and clean. It was really convenient as well as we came in on VIA rail and the hotel is connected to the train station as well as the underground mall. We had a nice and relaxing time.

Reviews.Title: “central location”
Reviews.Author: tiatatravelagent
Reviews.Content: Iconic Montreal property located in the heart of the shopping and near the nightlife district of "Crescent street", if your coming by train, best location you can get, also easily accessible by airport shuttle. Don't eat at the property, overprice, instead walk down the escalator by the train station where many eating option is available if you feel to lazy to get out to walk to Ste-Catherines st

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: raedar
Reviews.Content: My daughter & I just returned from a 2 night stay at the Fairmont Queen Elizabeth. It is a lovely older hotel. We arrived in Montreal by train at noon hour. The hotel is above the train station so you don't even have to go outside. Check-in was a breeze. We were able to get into our room right away even though we were really early. The front desk staff & bell-man were so friendly & helpful. As soon as they realized we only spoke english they immediately switched to english. Whenever we met someone from housekeeping in the halls they always said hello. The room is small but comfortable. The bellman felt our room was a little warm so he opened our window & told us to leave it open for a while & then turn the ventilation system to auto. The room cooled down nicely & we were very comfortable. The beds were very comfortable with lovely linens. The hotel has such a convenient location. We had tickets for Michael Jackson Immortal by Cirque du Soliel at the Bell Centre. It was only minutes from the hotel. The next day we shopped till we dropped on St Catherine Street. It was also a short walk from the hotel. You can also reach it by the underground shopping tunnels if the weather is unpleasant. The weather was beautiful so we enjoyed walking outside & discovered all kinds of wonderful shops. On our last morning we enjoyed a lovely buffet breakfast at the hotel's restaurant. The variety of options was excellent. The food was delicious & again the staff were exceptionally friendly. I don't drink coffee or tea & would have been happy with just juice but the waiter suggested hot chocolate & it was so good. I had my own pot full of chocolate. So yummy. Check-out took only seconds & the hotel kept our luggage in a secure room for us until it was time to catch our train home. They even asked if we needed help getting down to the train station with our luggage. We were fine but it was nice of them to ask. Overall it was a nice little vacation & I will definitely stay at the FQE on my next trip to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the heart of the city!”
Reviews.Author: TinyDancer028
Reviews.Content: One of the best locations - connected to the underground city, and steps away from fabulous shopping, dining (I'm partial to dim sum in Chinatown!)... When I take the train to Montreal I don't even have to step outside to check in to the hotel! Friendly staff, great food... and lovely shops in the lobby that are very tempting... Great gym and the kids loved the pool!

Reviews.Title: “Family trip to Montreal”
Reviews.Author: kanatafamilyof4
Reviews.Content: We went to Montreal for March 2012 and chose to stay at this Fairmont location. I called the hotel directly for the booking and was able to get a federal government rate at $139 per room for a Fairmont room. Since there were four of us, my husband and I and our two daughters, 12 and 15 we decided to get adjoining rooms, which had two doubles for the kids and a king for my husband and I. This worked really well. I would recommend joining up for the Fairmont President's Club which is free and it provides you with free wi-fi which was great since we were there for three nights and also we asked for an extra fridge in the room which was at no extra cost and we could keep drinks and other food cold. The rooms i believe have been recently updated and the decor is nice but they are quite small but worked well enough given the rooms were adjoining. The biggest complaint from all of us was that the beds were quite hard. We are use to having pillow top mattresses and subsequently had a sore back when waking up. The best part of the hotel is that it is linked to the underground city, which has ample shopping without even going outside. I would suggest not to eat in the hotel as the cost is really high but if you go down the elevator to S2, you walk out through the sliding doors and you are right within the food court, which includes Tims, Second Cup and about 20 other take out places. My daughter loved going down in her slippers in the morning to get bagels and drinks. In the underground is also the Via rail station and also the subway is very close by. We used the pool and workout area, both were very clean and well equipped. The service was definitely rated very high and all staff were very friendly and professional. Parking is valet only and is at a cost of $29 per day. Overall the stay was very good and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Central but old.”
Reviews.Author: misskelt
Reviews.Content: We checked out of the Fairmont Royal York in Toronto early the same morning that we checked in to the Queen Elizabeth (lunch time), we had the same room type booked, and boy was there a difference! In short - this hotel is older, or if it's not is definitely looks it. And again there is no free wifi, but don't worry too much about that as downstairs at the train station and shopping mall there is free wifi. We did not receive any welcome platter like we did at the Royal York, nor did we have complimentary mouthwash in our bathroom as we did at the RY. We chose not to eat at the hotel restaurants as there were minimal (not very exciting looking) vegetarian options available. There are many restaurants close by and downstairs to choose from for a much better price. We had a big box of a TV (something I haven't had at home n 15 yrs) and at the RY we had a 40 inch plasma TV in our room, our bath mat was ripped and our lampshade was turning green it looked so old. The bed was comfortable. I would not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Well Appointed Room with King Bed”
Reviews.Author: FromToronto2011
Reviews.Content: Rooms are a very well appointed and have clearly been recently renewed. The bedding and bed are one of the best in the industry. There was no noise from any of the surrounding rooms. The "on my way" checkin for President Club Members did not work quite as well as it should. I arrived about four hours before regular checkin. So my booked room was not ready on ealry arrival. The front desk found me another one in the same grade of room; but it was clear that the cleaning staff had rushed their cleaning. Tables had drink rings on it and one of the waste baskiets were not emptied. The air conditioning in the room was still set for winter mode so the room was a little warmer than I would like. That being said, it was the perfect place to work and got a great night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Would come back....”
Reviews.Author: Jpug70
Reviews.Content: Stayed here only for one night and overall it was a good choice. The only BUT I have for the management was that when I arrives at the room, I noticed the shower had no curtain, so upon leaving for dinner I informed the front desk about this. They assured me they would take care of it.... But they never did...so when I came back from dinner, I was too tired to bother with reminding them or go through the hazzle of waitng for them to do it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful exprerience..”
Reviews.Author: PAPAKO
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at Le Reine Elizabeth and we truly enjoyed our stay. We took advantage of the seat sale offered by ViaRail Canada and the location of the hotel was perfect. It was above Central Station. The service was "par excellence" and could not ask for more. Yes, the room was not as roomy as other hotels we have booked before but it was okey. We just slept there and did not spend too much time. We had the view of the Basilica beside the hotel. The concierge was very helpful and attentive to our needs. And a big bonus was, we were able to leave our bags in their hospitality room, after checking out so that we could go on a 3-hour Gray Line Tour of Montreal. Merci beaucoup, everyone at the Fairmont Queen Elizabeth Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Another excellent stay with the Queen”
Reviews.Author: Frankie K
Reviews.Content: This is our hotel of choice when in Montreal. The hotel is right above the train station and one of the main subway lines so it makes getting around the city a breeze. The hotel itself is outstanding in every respect. My wife had emailed Vincent Leblanc who is the best manager this side of the hemisphere and gave him a heads up that we were coming. He had personally given his info the last time we checked out to let him know when my wife's hospital sent her back to Montreal for another conference. Our room was ready before check in time. Check in itself was smooth. We were offered a suite up on the 11th floor far from the elevators (as per our request....that's another thing, this Fairmont property takes care to any special comments or concerns you have when making a reservation....I don't see a lot of hotels doing that anymore). We had chocolates and bottled water waiting for us compliments of Kenneth Hall (part of the concierge team). Whenever we called down to the front desk or room service they always answered by our name and often asked if there was anything else they could do. Wake up calls were accurate and pleasant (another aspect where some hotels fail). We had the Globe and Mail hanging outside our door free of charge every morning. Internet was free due to our President's Club Membership-free to join, by the way. Housekeeping was consistent and discreet. The hotel was part of the underground path which lead to the Montreal Convention Center. The Concierge was very helpful in offering alternatives to eating out and attractions (Ice Hotel :) Front Desk let us stay an 1hr past checkout and a cab was waiting specifically for us to take to the airport. The lobby is grand and relaxing and a great place to just hang out and read a book from the library or the aforementioned newspaper. 5/5. Running a tight ship here. Merci! Viva Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “traditional hotel -"New- old worldly charm!"”
Reviews.Author: vinchy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my family in their older suite rooms on 20th floor.. better in size than their recently furbished suite a few storeys below!.. Excellent staff, pleasent afro carribean porter...in conceirge desk - mark.. .. ;polite and pleasent... good birts ... well its on top of a large train station .. which is excellent but also has access to over 20 plus restaurants in its basement..!! all reasonably priced.The vietnamese restaurant was an eye opener and good for us! all shut at or before 8pm . The hotel restaurants are expensively priced for a family meal though ...including the breakfast.. good bits- excellent size of queen suites .. double bathrooms .. excellent bed and bedding , good decor, decent sized pool and pleasent staff.. cant ask for more really .. will stay again

Reviews.Title: “Salute”
Reviews.Author: rolando n
Reviews.Content: The trip to Montreal went great.. mostly because of this wonderful Hotel and staff. It was comfortable and inviting.. we ( the family ) also, checked out the Hotel restaurant.. the cuisine was incredible.. this place was perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DJMAlbany_NY
Reviews.Content: The Reine Elizabeth runs a 20% off winter package, which the wife and I have now twice used. Both times, our stay was nothing short of tremendous. First, you can't beat the downtown location (right on top of the main train station, a short underground walk to the Metro and the Underground and (if the weather holds), walking distance outside to more terrific food. If you don't mind a short walk, you can park in the CN garage behind the hotel, or use the hotel valet (costs the same). The rooms may be small (part of the package), but that's not a dealbreaker. The staff was very welcoming and accomodating; the concierge service is some of the best we've encountered (with special kudos to Pascal, who's really not a concierge, but nonetheless dove into the line and helped us with info for the Metro and St Joseph's Oratory - he says his father knew Brother Andre). A minor issue - no free wi-fi. But we spent our time sight-seeing and eating, and with the concierge, you won't really need the computer.

Reviews.Title: “Superb concierge”
Reviews.Author: Terry L
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Queen Elizabeth because of its proximity to the train station. The rooms are a bit small but very well set up. What was truly great was the help we received from the concierge in booking reservations at local restaurants. The resulting meals were outstanding. Both individuals who helped us were charming and attentive. We had some ideas in advance but their knowledge of the local food scene was terrific. We ate breakfast in the hotel. Both the food and service were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and tacky”
Reviews.Author: gutsygirltravels
Reviews.Content: My 4 day stay at the Fairmont was terribly disappointing. I ordinarily enjoy staying at Fairmont properties, however, this property does not do justice to the Fairmont brand. The hotel's public and private spaces show its age, the entire property is in desperate need of a facelift. Even on a president's level floor, the room's decor was tired and the tiny bathroom had essentially no water pressure, making the shower and flushing the toilet challenging. The service was extraordinarily poor. The wait times for check-in was long (even at the President's Club desk), the complimentary late check-out for president's club members was refused, there was a 3$ charge to retrieve luggage from the luggage storage room, and obtaining service at the Montrealais restaurant required me to flag down servers repeatedly at every meal. Overall the service was sub-par with grouchy and unhelpful waiters in the bar, the restaurant and the check-in desk. As a Fairmont President's Club member I was incredibly disappointed with my stay and am unlikely to stay at this, or any other Fairmont property in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Old School Charm III”
Reviews.Author: esben
Reviews.Content: I am also stealing the title of another review; this hotel is definitely somewhat old and un-modern. My room on the 19th floor (Gold room) was quite small, but large enough to be functional. The bathroom was however a bit too small in my opinion. Besides this: location is great, and having (a very simple) breakfast by the panorama windows in the 19th floor lounge was excellent. Staff was very good. Next time, I will consider a modern hotel instead. But at the same time, I find it very likely that I will end up at the Queen Elizabeth once more. To put it short: it was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Business trip”
Reviews.Author: Mike L
Reviews.Content: As part of the Fairmont chain - as usual - you expect the best and receive the best. A wonderful hotel with a great location. The service is beyond exceptional and the appearance is just perfect. Single rooms are not that small - and the suites are amazing. If within your budget - this is a wonderful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with a mix of history and class.”
Reviews.Author: Mountain_Doc
Reviews.Content: An enjoyable stay in this historic hotel. Close enough to walk to McGill for a campus tour for our daughters today. Across the street to the Keg for a great dinner. Free internet if you join the presidents club(free). Pricy breakfast buffet at $26.

Reviews.Title: “Past its best-before date”
Reviews.Author: Rob M
Reviews.Content: Great location, but small rooms, stained carpets and upholstery, aging mattress, aged towels. Pillows and sheets were very nice quality as were soaps etc. TV old non flat screen. Pleasant staff.

Reviews.Title: “Old school charm”
Reviews.Author: Msgeocat
Reviews.Content: I know i copied another reviewer when I titled my review 'old school charm' - but you really can't describe it in a better way. I really really enjoyed staying here. It was glamorous in an understated way - like an understated yet expensive pearl set and Chanel No. 5 perfume. We stayed on the 13th floor in a Cathedral view room. If they tell you that you have a Cathedral view room, then you have lucked out totally - it is a great view. The room was well appointed and elegant. The rooms are smaller - but this hotel was constructed in the 1950's - our concept of space was different in those times - so at that time the rooms were probably considered quite large. That being said there is still heaps of room to move around. The bathroom was clean and nice. I really loved the products - Rose 31 - it was the first time I came home from my vacation wishing I still had the hotel shower-gel and soaps. The room did get a little noisy on the saturday night we were there. Outside noise was minimal - we faced a cathedral - not exactly party central - but some people staying in the adjoining room came home quite late and talked a lot - so that woke me up. So should you stay here? Well it is more expensive than some other hotels - but you can get a good deal if you look around. But I think it is worth it. It is old school charm and luxury. It is a great location (right above Bonadventure subway stop and central station) - the airport bus also stops right outside. There is also good parking for all you car addicts out there. You feel good staying in this hotel, staff are respectful and people appear to be more refined there (maybe its the charm of the hotel that brings out the best in people). I would stay here again in a heartbeat - it was a gorgeous hotel - its one of the last true railway hotels - its a grand old lady who has taken very good care of herself - maybe had a bit of work done but its not too obvious and does not detract from her charm. Also if you are into John Lennon and Yoko Ono you can go up to the famous room on the 17th floor where they staged their 'bed in' - if you don't know about it google it.

Reviews.Title: “Executive floors are GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: WarsawWanderer
Reviews.Content: We splurged on a room on one of the two executive floors (18th and 19th), and were glad we did. The room was handsomely furnished, spacious, well maintained, and offered great views of the heart of Montreal, and permitted access to special features such as the elegant lounge, where complimentary breakfasts and light dinners (from a tasty buffet) are offered.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: CdaTurst
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, rooms slightly small, washrooms tiny with no counter space, but ok for two of us over the weekend. Bed was super comfortable. Hotel is in a great location to walk to the Bell Centre for a hockey game, connect to the underground pathway for lots of shopping indoors which is really nice during the cold months. Very close to lots of restaurants and old montreal is a short walk. And the train station is right below the hotel. Access to everything! Caveat: $30 a night for car park.

Reviews.Title: “Old-school charm, good location”
Reviews.Author: migratorychic
Reviews.Content: Nicely located in Montreal, we were able to get around very easily. Old Montreal is about a 20 minute walk away. Rooms were clean. We got a suite (it was really two connected rooms) with a decent view. The decor was a little dated yet charming at the same time. Bathrooms were clean, though the fixtures were also a bit dated (shower curtain/bathtub). Very nice service, good fitness room with steam room! Parking was expensive. Good experience overall, will likely return for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously underimpressive, with noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: Faience44
Reviews.Content: The Queen Elizabeth is not one of Fairmont's stately Canadian hotels and I'm afraid this shows. The square unremarkable building was constructed in the 1950s and is showing its age. The rooms don't have that solid feeling you notice in other Fairmont properties and I could hear noise clearly from the occupants either side of me, not to mention the traffic that thunders past on the main street outside. The heating system is seriously wonky - either you put the fan on and can't sleep for the noise or you turn the fan off and freeze. My wife and daughter were in a one-room suite down the hall and the fan in the main bedroom was even worse than mine. The service was friendly but generally unremarkable and no one seemed to care about the small children who ran shrieking up and down the corridors. The breakfasts were the usual expensive Fairmont affair ($100 Canadian for three people, tip included) but nowhere near as good as those in the Manoir Richelieu, I'm afraid. So even though I am a member of the Fairmont's frequent traveller scheme (and gain benefits the more times I stay at the chain) I'll be using the Marriott next time I go to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: happycamperNewYork
Reviews.Content: This hotel is still the one to beat in my experiment to sample of all of the properties that are part of the Fairmont Gold brand. The location could not be better and the staff are professional and gracious. Note that this hotel does an enormous business with the cruise ships and the main lobby is often crowded and noisy but you'll find none of this at the oasis known as the Gold level.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great stay”
Reviews.Author: Simlo22
Reviews.Content: We absolutely love Montreal, great city whether it's freezing cold or very warm outside, it's always a happening city. There are always new restaurants to try out. We're big fans of the night live in Montreal and the hotel is perfectly located near Crescent, St-Laurent or the Village. Beds and pillows are so comfy, but the reason why we keep on returning to this hotel is for the great service. The staff remembers us and they make us feel at home. If you can splurge a bit, look at the online deals and upgrade to a Gold room, it's worth it! Sadly we have to check out tomorrow and we can't wait to come back again in a couple of months.

Reviews.Title: “My hotel of choice in Mtl”
Reviews.Author: Frenkee
Reviews.Content: Everything is taken care of. Great service - for example they once let me cancel my stay on the same day, no penalty, when I had to return home for a family emergency. In-room dining is great; diversified food and cafÃ© options are available in the train station accessible by elevator. Corporate prices are affordable. Tip: Make sure you request a recently renovated room!

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Roots1642
Reviews.Content: In this HOTEL you don't have to go outside to enjoy Montreal ,everything is inside. The good part about this HOTEL location, is that in winter time, you don't need to bring your heavy boots and jacket,,because you realy don't have to go outside. Everyting you realy need, Shopping,Food,Casino,Pubs,Train,etc is right there in this location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: coopesc
Reviews.Content: Just got back from another great stay at The Fairmont Queen Elizabeth Hotel in beautiful Montreal. This might be my favorite city in Canada and it doesn't matter what time of year you go. I've stayed at this hotel 3 times now and have had nothing but the best service and comfortable rest. The linens on the beds are incredible, so much I had a hard time getting up each day. So warm and soft on the skin. Better than many quality hotels I have stayed at. Before I get ahead of myself I need to start from the beginning. Valet parking was awesome for such a large hotel in the middle of a downtown core. They greeted me promptly, arranged all my luggage to be taken to my room and escorted me to check in. Check-in went rather quick considering the amount of guests checking in. If possible when booking this hotel try and get a room at the front of the hotel on a higher floor. Great views of Mont-Royal and the city line. The service at the lobby bar was the best I've ever experienced. Our bar keep Daniel loved his job and it showed. He hooked us up with reservations at the best steak house in the country. Queue de Cheval. If you stay here it is a must. Try the 10oz Kobe Filet and you will think you died and went to steak heaven. They also have a phenomial wine list, cigar bar and the best scotch money can buy. Another must do is a quick visit to Saint Patrick's Bascillia. It two blocks from the hotel. When you walk in to this church you will instantly be humbled and feel an incredible feeling of peace. On a completely often hand if you are looking to party the two best spots are Crescent Street and St Laurent near Sherbrook. Like beer? Brutopia on Crescent street has remarkable craft beer and some of the best live music. The Irish pub "Hurleys" next door is great for live music too. Looking to relax? Visit Le Scnandenave spas in old Montreal. They have a hot waterfall that cascades onto your back and neck. Better than an RMT any day. Visiting Mont-Royal in the warmer months is great too. The views are spectacular. Anyway I could write and write. If you are looking for a hotel that is reasonably priced, right smack in the middle iffy all the action and has a little something for everyone, than look no further that the Fairmont Queen Elizabeth Montreal. SC

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in the heart of Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Vanski
Reviews.Content: For the past 4 years I have attended a fitness conference held at the Fairmont The Queen Elizabeth. Being a President Club member, I enjoy the benefits of executive check-in and free internet. Check-in this past weekend was very efficient, they allowed me to have a slightly later check-out to match the finish of our conference activities. The hotel has a very adequate fitness facility that offers fresh fruit, updated machines and water. Although the hotel is a little dated, the room provides comfort. In addition, the hotel is located conveniently amongst plenty of excellent restaurant and the famous shopping on St Catherine Street. Overall a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location-Especially in Winter”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelRod
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in Montreal Centre. Two blocks to Bell Centre but the best part is its attached to the Montreal Underground. So if its rainy-snowy-windy-cold it doesn't matter. You can walk underground to all of the shopping on St Catherines, Eaton Centre, etc. Yes, leave the coat in your room, even if its -10. Rooms are very nice, brunch in the hotel is really really good. Nice pool and one of the best hotel gyms in Montreal. 4 plus stars hotel for sure

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: JackandJill1970
Reviews.Content: Highs Centre of downtown Underground amenities Nice staff Lows Small room Bed too soft In room snack a fortune

Reviews.Title: “Service cuts noticable.”
Reviews.Author: MrWonderfulToronto
Reviews.Content: We went to valet and it took 10 minutes to get someone to help with luggage. Had to go find someone myself. Took forever to get ice, extra pillows. Not worthy of the Fairmont name. Took quite a while to get bellman to bring luggage from room to car. The Beaver Club restaurant is truly excellent and highly recommendable whereas Le Montrealais is ordinary and overpriced. We went there for the Beaver Club and would go back to that restaurant but probably would not stay at the QE again.

Reviews.Title: “A real disappointment for the money”
Reviews.Author: BuddyPR
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel. We booked this hotel at the last minute through Hotels.com. We were told that it was a great 4* bargain. It was overpriced for what we got and they ripped us off for every "extra." We had to pay for parking after we were told that it was included. We had to pay $16 for 24 hours of wifi after we had been told that that was included. We requested a King size bed they had a queen, in fairness, they did upgrade us. However, the room was small well really tiny, the wallpaper was peeling and the bathtub which had been painted some time ago was also peeling. In addition, they had an old tube TV. And this is a four star property? We reserved for 2 nights and left after one. If you could stay here for under $100 and get the parking and wifi included, that would be a bargain, because that is what this room was worth. But as the cost is over $150 without anything included it is a rip off.

Reviews.Title: “The Queen and the court jester”
Reviews.Author: UsBizTraveler01
Reviews.Content: Unlike other recent business-only trips, I joined a few friends in Montreal for a getaway. A few in our group spent an evening at the Fairmont Tremblant to kick off the weekend with some skiing, and then we met up at the Queen Elizabeth for a couple days of carousing. While I have experience with other Fairmonts (Boston, Vancouver, Seattle - see other reviews), I hadn't planned on booking our weekend at the QE until I started calling around for quotes. The Fairmont folks (not direct to hotel, but using int'l number) were by far the most courteous and helpful. I also tried the Marriott and Sheraton in Montreal. The Marriott folks were the least helpful and knew the least about the details of the rooms...even less than I could secure at the property web site for the rooms (multiple, including suites) I was asking about. The Sheraton folks get some kudos - the folks running their call center WERE very helpful. If they didn't have an answer immediately, they put me on hold and went direct to the property to secure one. AND, they did technically offer the best pricing for me. What pushed us to the Queen Elizabeth was the larger sizes for the suites and rooms in general, and the reservation folks gave me the most confidence of room sizes, configurations and proximity when trying to arrange for multiple folks staying together. I won't lengthen this review to cover our onsite experiences. Most were typical of Fairmonts at which I've stayed. Front desk, concierge, etc were ALL very helpful in making various arrangements for us throughout the weekend. The one exception I will mention is our experience at the onsite bistro, Le Montrealais. A bit pretentious, pricey, and service atypical of a Fairmont dining establishment. To be fair, the six of us dining were not dressed as anything approaching business casual, but we weren't dressed as slobs either. We even asked the maitre d' if we were appropriate or if there was another establishment a bit more casual that would be better. I suppose one could argue, "Well, what's he gonna say....'sorry, you can't eat here', but he seemed genuine and sincere. We entered and were summarily seated in the most remote corner of the restaurant - far away and not even visible to any other guests. We actually didn't think much of this, and almost appreciate it. That is, until no one showed up to serve us. Seriously, after 10 minutes (and 10 might be generous), we had to walk back to the host and find a nice way to ask if we would be served. The maitre d' was shocked and immediately went about finding someone. Alas, the server sent was less than apologetic, and clearly, after what was surely a verbal beating from his manager, was less than enthusiastic about serving us. And the service still was not acceptable. If we could have found the water station, just to get refills on our water, we would've served ourselves, because so much time passed between placing our orders and seeing our server again. A final comment: the chicken club was decent, but the 5 of us who had it didn't think it was a $14.95 sent chicken club. In summary, it was well worth visiting the "Queen" and her royal subjects, minus the "jester" in Le Montrealais.

Reviews.Title: “We gave another try to the Queen Elizabeth!!!!”
Reviews.Author: NADIADON
Reviews.Content: After a stay that was not the most pleasant last year, we had a conversation with the manager and we decided to give them another try this year for our trip. We were very pleased with the service this time around and the room provided was awesome!!! We have gained our confidence back in the Fairmont Brand with this stay. Much appreciated!!!! Thanks again for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: goingplacesToronto
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont this past weekend for 2 nights. We were able to take advantage of Montreal Tourism's Sweet Deal, which gave us the 2nd night for 1/2 price. We decided to stay at the Fairmont because it's right above the train station. The hotel was fine but nothing special. It was a small room, linens weren't special, bathroom had not been updated and the toilet was a very old American standard that I was surprised to see still in service. The heating was not working properly: it was either freezing or so hot we couldn't sleep. I will say that the engineer was sent up within minutes when I called to complain, which was great but the problem never really got fixed properly. Service was great but there was certainly nothing special about the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: EdofVA
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel based on its convenient location and underground connections. The hotel is connected to a train station concourse which is connected to a number of shopping center. Both the train station and the shopping centers have a big number of restaurants. We loved it when we just rolled out of our bed, took the elevator down to train station and have a hugh selection of breakfast options. Nothing can beat the aroma of coffee and pastries in the morning to start a day. The check in process was efficient and the front desk was extremely polite and friendly. The room was not big but was adequate and nicely appointed. We had an old style tube TV but we hardly ever watch TV when we travel. There was no above desk power outlet which we find surprising. Even the much older Fairmont Chateau Frontenac has above desk power outlets. We had a high floor which overlooked the church next door. Even though there was a lot of traffic on the street, we had no issue with any noise from the street or inside the hotel. The beds were very comfortable. This hotel only has valet parking. We usually prefer self parking so for us it was a slight negative. The valet parking is a little harder to find if you had never been there before. The quickest way is to enter via Belmont street in the back of the hotel. The valets are present and efficient. The parking garage is shared with the parking for the nearby shopping malls. I noticed that some shoppers parked their vehicles at places that would make others hard to pass through, such as on the side of a turn or on a ramp. In that regard, having valet is an advantage as I probably would not like to drive through obstacles like that. We also enjoyed the indoor swimming pool, which we used to unwind after long days of walking. If you plan to stay at any Fairmont hotel, you may want to join the Fairmont Presidentâ€™s Club (free) in advance which will give you free wifi access.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but old, stodgy and needs work”
Reviews.Author: Lucythepug
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this location for 7 days for work at a rate of $139 a night (company discount rate). The location is close to shopping and touristy things - but the hotel itself needs some updates. The rooms (with a King Beds) are smaller than I expected. My husband met me on the weekend and we were really bumping in to each other and there was not enough room or space to put 2 suitcases on top of chairs, etc. The bathrooms are getting updated - but inside the bathtub the paint was chipped all along the inside and the outside of the tub. It made it look really cheap. I would stay here if I was able to pay $139 a night (without the help of a corporate rate) but I wouldn't pay any more than this. Also, the rooms are SO DRY. Static CLING everywhere. Bring static guard! Old Montreal is a much better place to stay -esp. if you are a foodie.

Reviews.Title: “VERY CENTRAL, BEAUTIFUL HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: cloma099
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location for everything in Montreal. It is 1 block away from the Subway, and is connected underground to shopping malls (protects you from the cold winters). The hotel itself is beautiful. The rooms are not extra spacious, but just enough. The bathrooms are very nice, in marble. The staff at the hotel are very helpful as well. Would definitely recommend this hotel to all!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Karen_To
Reviews.Content: This was our fifth stay at the QE and would stay there again. The location is amazing - connected to the Metro, central train station and the underground city "RESO". During the cold Montreal winter, you can travel all the way to St Catherines and beyond, all underground with shops and restaurants throughout. The hotel itself is huge - nothing much to look at from the outside, but it is lovely and grand inside. The rooms are elegant and spotless, but the TV was an ancient box TV and the phones were also very outdated. The bathrooms are small with very little storage, and although spotless as well, they are a little dated. We had a room facing Place Ville Marie and we could see the cross on Mont Royal - great view. Activity-wise, there is a full gym and pool with hot tub and kid's pool in the basement level. The change rooms are spotless and there is a centrifuge for drying your bathing suits. While we have stayed at the Crystal which is new and modern with a gorgeous pool, nothing can beat the location of the QE.

Reviews.Title: “Needs soundproofing”
Reviews.Author: Alanjameson
Reviews.Content: Had room on Gold floor but could here people in next room talking through the walls. Woke us up throughout night. Response at check out was suggestion to make a comment in review. Otherwise nice hotel. Friendly Staff. Good services.

Reviews.Title: “Just not the same”
Reviews.Author: awtk
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is very conveniently located, the rooms and the hotel decor require a much needs face lift. Tiles were cracked in the bathroom and the rugs were tired. The lobby has no appeal.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Wordfiend
Reviews.Content: The Queen Elizabeth is walking distance from Old Montreal, tons of restaurants, live theatre (yes, in English) and shopping. If you travel by train, it is conveniently located adjacent to the Gare Centrale (don't even need to go outside).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect balance of convenience and value.”
Reviews.Author: Larryort
Reviews.Content: Fairmonts normally don't dissappoint, and this one didn't either. Perfect for it's location in the city center. You can take the elevator into the underground malls and the metro. Which was ideal for us since we went when it was bitterly cold. The lobby is understated and clean. The staff was always friendly and helpful. We stayed in a roomy Junior suite since there were three of us and were happy to see one and a half bathrooms and a room dividing door. The sofa was a pull out queen. Just a note, if you opt for what they call a "mini-suite", it is the same square footage but with a smaller sofa. The room also had two TV's (surprisingly older CRT, non HD models), and a minibar. The bed was plush and very comfortable. Nice large desk and plenty of closet space. The bathrooms were clean and well appointed. The showers were low flow but still had decent water pressure. We didn't eat at the restaurants, but did have nightcaps at the Le Voyageur lobby bar. I highly recommend the "Blueberry Tea" as a warm up after a cold day outside. The whirlpool was out of order (not a major problem as we understand this happens), but the pool was heated, and there was a steam room which still did the trick. It might have been brought up before, but it bears repeating, join the Fairmont President's Club. You can join online and free and it gives you some nice perks such as free in-room internet and access to the fitness center. If at all possible we try and stay a Fairmont, and the Queen Elizabeth lived up to our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great, avoid the place on the New Years Eve”
Reviews.Author: samerium
Reviews.Content: Well, the title says it all. The place is great. People are nice and helpful. Everything is great till we return to the hotel late night on the new year's eve. Place was noisy. Some floors were filled with scattered beer bottles, broken glasses. This is what I did not like about the place. They have trained employees. But what were they thinking when they let "too many people" in one room on the new year's eve? We saw some guy at the door with a list on his clipboard presumably checking who is entering the building. We were not asked anything. But it seemed the management lost control over the situation. I wanted to ask. But there was no one at the desk at around 2 AM when we returned. Anyhow, we manage to catch some sleep after 5 AM when noise calmed down. Next morning I was greeted with an apology and professional greetings to calm me down. This tells me the hotel has class and what it takes to be good. But the manager who was in-charge that very night should be given warning. Everything fell apart. I would have recommended the hotel without any reservation. Now I will tell people to make a cautious decision. Oh, apparently, this year was better than the last one. That's what I was told. So I guess they are "trying". The hotel deserves excellent or very good. But because of my experience on the new year's eve, I am putting average. I would have put "ok" if there was an option between "average" and "very good"

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Horrible, Nothing Exciting - Just a decent/average hotel”
Reviews.Author: NFTravller1
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Queen Elizabeth isn't close to the best hotel I've ever stayed at, but it's far from the worst - it's just an average, clean hotel in downtown Montreal. For those commuting by rail, it is very conveniently located up from the Amtrak/Via Central Station by using an escalator. It is also very close to the Bonaventure Metro station for easy access around Montreal. Many great attractions and restaurants are within walking distance. My room was somewhat small, but had all the basic ammenities and appeared to be last renovated in the late 1990's or early 2000's (still has an old tube TV, walls and plumbing fixtures were looking rough). The room for downtown was very queit - which is appreciable compared to other hotels in Montreal. TIP - SIGN UP FOR THE FAIRMONT CLUB BEFORE CHECKING IN - you will get free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Still a very nice place right in the middle of downtown MontrÃ©al”
Reviews.Author: travellingJf
Reviews.Content: Stayed there a couple of nights last summer, The building doesn't look that good from the outside but it is a beautiful classique and unique hotel. Just walking through the large lobby is an experience. The rooms are nice, maybe a bit on the old side but this is a historic building, we found pretty much everything we expected from a Fairmont Hotel. We had a room on the president's club level, it was clean, nicely decorated, the bed just perfect, the room service was also pretty good. The hotel is in the heart of downtown Montreal, minutes away from the old port and St-Lawrence river. You can access the underground city without even going outside, shopping, restaurants, train station, everything is there at your door.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: HoldfastOntario
Reviews.Content: With a ton of stores just beneath it and, of course, the train station, this is a great hotel location-wise. Rooms are fine. Fitness room is great. I hate the fact that hotels in this price range go and charge you for WIFI.

Reviews.Title: “New Years in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: tellitlikeitis64
Reviews.Content: Took the Via train from Toronto to Montreal to stay at this Fairmont property it was -15 when we arrived so I was eternally grateful that my family and I did not have to go outside to get to the hotel very convenient. I was disappointed that the Gold floor was not opened as I always like the convenience of this when I stay at the Fairmont. I booked 3 rooms with a suite for myself and husband I found the suite to be a little small but it was definately cosy not as elegant as the Chateau Laurier or Royal York . The underground shopping was good since it was so cold and we had lots of different restaurants to choose from within a short distance. Be prepared to use a lot of taxis to keep warm.. I will try to return to try Gold as I did visit the floor and found it looked very elegant

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: ursula312
Reviews.Content: We spent the weekend of New Year's at the Fairmont QE, and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The staff were first rate, and very helpful at all times. The room was extremely comfortable, with a gorgeous view of the mountain. I appreciated the "no parties" contract guests had to sign for New Year's, which ensured quiet on the floor. The location is first rate, as we arrived by train and went right upstairs, and were close to shops and restaurants, and walking distance to both Vieux Montreal and the mountain. The pool is rather small, not really suited for swimming -- it's more of a kiddy play pool. And the weird elevator shuffle (elevators to the room floors stop in the lobby; to get to the pool or the train station you have to switch in the lobby) is unwieldy.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Service, Quality”
Reviews.Author: Joe W
Reviews.Content: Family trip on Via Rail to Montreal. This great hotel is right above the train station so access was a breeze and walking distance to virtually everything. The service from arrival through to departure was impeccable, of particular note was time spent in the piano bar having a late bite to eat and discussing attractions and photographic opportunities with our waiter. Great value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Great, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: globalbouncer
Reviews.Content: This Fairmont is so convenient for visiting Montreal, especially in the winter! If you take the train, you don't even have to go outside to get to your room. Plus, you can go right into the underground shopping tunnels from the property as well. Our room was nice- nothing too fancy, but definitely clean and comfortable. The best part was the view looking out to Mont Royal. You can usually get some good deals on this hotel so it ends up being really affordable for a Fairmont. Plus, John and Yoko stayed there so it has an amazing history too!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable with better than usual catering”
Reviews.Author: RomyDeeJay
Reviews.Content: It's hard to find true luxury on a budget these days, but this property was terrific in many ways. I splurged for a junior suite which, as far as I could tell, was about twice the size of a regular room (although without a view). It was small by suite standards but very well appointed and comfortable. What's truly outstanding about this hotel is the service: front desk, bell staff, etc. And, honestly, most impressive was the quality of the restaurants and the meals at the catered affairs. Even for a convention, it was one of the more elegant and inspired meals. Small bar where it's fun to hang out with superb munchies; the upscale restaurant was pricey but delicious.

Reviews.Title: “It's not the property it's the people who look after you!”
Reviews.Author: MarLinny
Reviews.Content: We are mature Australian first time visitors to Canada. QE well located & with VIA Rail station below it is easily accessible. What made the time there so memorable was the professional, knowledgable and charming service from Concierge Jean-Paul Isoz. From restaurants to neighborhoods to transport he always had time to listen and share his knowledge. His help in us recovering some personal effects left at a previous hotel was exemplary. Due to delays in the courier service we had to move on to our next hotel in New York City. No trouble, he arranged the forwarding from Montreal. And then rang us to check if we had received it. That's service you remember. Thanks Jean-Paul!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Stay on Fairmont Gold”
Reviews.Author: NYUCanadian
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the Gold Floor to celebrate the completion of my Doctoral Exams and was welcomed back like an old friend (stayed previously in the summer of 2006 for the OutGames, and in March 2007). Have always booked a Large Gold Room as opposed to the more standard sized Gold Rooms. I believe my room number was 1927 and it featured an upgraded bathroom with a separate tub and shower (other stays were in 1909 and 1908, which was the usual tub/shower combo set-up). The canapes and snackies at supper were great, as was the morning breakfast layout. I can honestly say that this is my favourite Gold Floor Lounge with its glass cupola overlooking Boulevard Rene Levesque, Mount Royal and Mary Queen of the World Basilica--stunning at night. Was especially impressed with the Gold Floor staff's attention to detail. Mentioned in passing that we enjoyed the toiletries ("Cologne 1888" from Miller Harris was the scent) and the tea (Kyoto Cherry Rose) and the gave us about 10 packets of the tea and two mini-bags full of the toiletries to take with us--easily 15 bottles! How wonderful! I can't wait to go back when I am next in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “very classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: ikojohn
Reviews.Content: We had a gorgeous one bedroom suite with 2 bathroom! It even had it's own doorbell that our guest rang upon arrival for a glass of champagne. We celebrated Christmas there a few weeks before and the room was very nice, old fashioned, clean although you can tell all the marble is original. The view was spectacular and the beds and pillows oh so comfortable. It was worth the money to get the bigger suite as opposed to a regular room which is basic. Amenities such as valet parking, room service etc. all very good for a old classy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to Fairmont standards and an amazing city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gerald L
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for one night on the 23rd. There was alot of snow and montreal was freezing. This hotel was a warm escape with an underground connection, close to the subway and a short wall to St Cat's where i did my last minute christmas shopping. We were upgraded to the junior suite upon check in and everyone was so friendly. The junior suite had a queen bed with a shower and in the other part of the room there was a queen sofa with another washroom. The suit was cramped with both beds open but nonetheless the beds fairmont standard. There was a well stocked mini bar and tons of new la labo lotions. We had made use of the turndown service and everything was made again, towels were changed the only thing that was lacking was a tiny mint on the pillow but whatever :) Overall, Great stay, very elaborate gym and i look forward to come back again. Didn't try any of the restaurants because there were so many things to eat nearby. Parking is valet only and costs $28. <Fairmont Plat Member>

Reviews.Title: “For a Nice Old Hotel can get some New things...”
Reviews.Author: Anilu77
Reviews.Content: Room- Average, not too big but does the job Old features: Hairdryer - The oldest verily working TV- is it the remote or the TV that doesn't work very well?? Bath - an old old model as the bad mat Plus: ;D == Quick good working elevators!! ;D== Great location for quick mobility to metro, train, bus, airport bus 747 + plus for the new Shampoo and Conditioner line - they leave your hair smooth + almost no noise + good selection for the mini bar Extras: Seriously paying almost 50 dollars to enjoy the tea room?? Staff is very very friendly and courteous

Reviews.Title: “Could have been bad...but wasn't”
Reviews.Author: Steve_and_Megann
Reviews.Content: Megann and I were in Montreal a couple of weeks ago for a gala put on by one of the industry associations we're part of. We started with a lovely train journey from Toronto to Montreal, arriving at the hotel about 45 minutes before the gala officially started. Walked upstairs to the hotel (it's very convenient when you arrive by train) and took the elevator to the 19th floor Fairmont Gold reception area. We were greeted by the concierge, who then seemed to have difficulty finding our reservation. Eventually he located it...it was in their system for the prior night! I showed him the various confirmation emails I had received, only to discover that the one I had received from their "pre-check-in" system had switch the dates. "Not to worry" was the response. He booked us into our room and assured us he would check into the error and correct it, if possible. After a lovely dinner and dance we returned to our terrific room overlooking the Mary, Queen of the World Cathedral, collapsed into an extremely comfortable bed, and had a great sleep. The Gold floor room was huge, well appointed and quiet. The lounge was a bit crowded, as everyone had slept in and were trying to have breakfast before the Sunday deadline, but we shared a table and had a nice breakfast. It took a couple of days for the hotel staff to reverse the error and sort out a credit, but everyone we dealt with was very apologetic and very helpful. We received a lovely reply from the General Manager, even though we assured them that everyone at Fairmont served us well, it was their system which let them down.

Reviews.Title: “Older Hotel still among the very best!”
Reviews.Author: KSWilson24
Reviews.Content: Took advantage of a special rate offered for the slow season, and booked a room here for a few days. What a treat! Everything about this hotel is pure old style elegance! I travel alot, I do mean alot, all year long, and think I have an idea of what makes a good hotel, and this one passes with flying colours! The standard rooms are not huge, but the mattress is near perfect, and feels new, the linens are crisp, and the room is clean, although there was a stain on the carpet near the window. The bathroom is marble tiled, and clean. The towels are full weight, and the heavy terrycloth bath robe was a nice added touch. Being a holiday, the lobby was tastefully decoratated, and the check in was efficient, and quick. I just love it's location above the Central Train station, never having to brave the cold weather after arriving on the train. The service was near perfect, and the very friendly, and proper. I will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotels are for those who prize "cool" over flawless service & comfort. Queen E delivers the latter.”
Reviews.Author: mmaddasever
Reviews.Content: I love hotels with history, and Fairmonts tend to have some of the most storied hotels in their global portfolio. Queen Elizabeth, although not as historic as Toronto's Royal York or the Banff Springs Hotel, is a Montreal landmark. As such, everything you'll want for business or pleasure is a few-blocks walk or a quick cab ride away. The hotel has several good restaurants, a mid-size pool that was never crowded (I was there over a weekend and a few weekdays and each time I went to the pool there was one other swimmer), and great staff across the board. I had a junior suite and it was just the right amount of space, and very comfortable. My colleague had a Fairmont room with a King, and found it a good size and comfy as well. Although there are newer hotels in Montreal with more contemporary decor, the Queen E is a well-oiled machine with a competent, friendly, helpful staff. There was rarely any wait at the check-in, concierge or Bell Captain desk, and there was never a worry about getting a cab immediately. Add in all the Fairmont advantages, like pre-check in, and it's a really convenient haven with all the first-class service advantages of a Fairmont, and grand spaciousness of a stately hotel.

Reviews.Title: “overnight stay on points”
Reviews.Author: lizjoffe
Reviews.Content: I (just 1 person) just returned from a 1 night stay at the Queen E. I used points to book this trip so I am writing this review with that in mind. Check in quick, professional and friendly. I requested and received a queen size bed, I was very pleased with my room overall. Excellent new mattress. Often when you book a room on points in a superior hotel you receive a sketchy room. The bedding, towels, bathrobe etc. are top quality. Bathroom meticulous but perfect however cramped but ok for 1 person. Only complaint was the TV- an oldermodel, not flat screen with terrible reception. Second time I stay here on points and equally good. This hotel is directly above the train station, connected to Place Ville Marie, etc. location, location, location. Its a good choice

Reviews.Title: “AN ISLAND OF ELEGANCE IN A SEA OF CHANGE”
Reviews.Author: Alan Y
Reviews.Content: How pleasant and re-assuring it is in this era of change and uncertainty to come across a hotel, nay a landmark in Montreal that is predictably elegant in its traditions. When all else is in flux, one need only descend from a stress-free train ride and take the elevator up to the stately Fairmont Queen Elizabeth. The Q.E. is still the fine old lady she always was, from her comfortable rooms and excellent services to her location, right in the middle of downtown Montreal. We especially liked the sumptuous Gold facilities with their private lounge and express elevator. We enjoyed afternoon tea in the Relais and a memorable dinner in the historic Beaver Club. Yet, the Q.E. is poised above a vast array of shops and restaurants in the StationPlaza and adjoining Place Ville Marie complex and thus connected underground to an endless assortment of shopping malls. For those who prefer more historic haunts, it is only a 15 minute walk from Old Montreal and Le Vieux Port, with a plethora of restaurants and boutiques and steeped in history. We were received, indeed, like royalty, yet affordably. The Fairmont chain operates flagship hotels throughout Canada and they,including the Q.E. transcend the mere designation of hotelsâ€“they are landmarks and destinations of choice and distinction.

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Eff_Pea
Reviews.Content: As a child, when heading to Montreal, my family always stayed at this hotel. We did so before it became a Fairmont and changed a bit. In any case it always and continues to be a lovely luxury hotel that is elegant, yet affordable. Nice rooms, fluffly pillows and very central to Montreal. Located in the heart of downtown near St-Catherine, Ogilvie shops, as well as the VIA Rail station (connected to it), this hotel is the perfect place to stay when visiting Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and clean stay but..”
Reviews.Author: DNimko
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night after the hockey game at Centre Bell close by. The room was very comfortable, quiet, the A/C is easy to set up and works really fine. Everyone tends to say that bed bugs are everywhere.... but I can assure you I saw none. I have tried very hard to find one by looking on the pillow under the pillow case, on the mattress under the mattress protector, on the baseboards and so forth. NO bed bugs at all BUT, baseboards could use dusting The room are not as specious as new hotels, but they do the job pretty well The service is impeccable I will go back to " the Queen " anytime with pleasure we did not have the time to eat at the restaurant called "beaver club" but i can remember they had the best food in town

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: CarletonTraveller
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Fairmont QE a few times now for business, and I find the service excellent. I appreciate their free WiFi (I actually get really really annoyed with hotels that do not offer free WiFi--it should be standard). You may have to get a President's account (I think that is what it is called) to get it, but the account is free, and I've used the same number at every Fairmont in Canada where I've stayed. I appreciate that when I call room service or the front desk or housekeeping, they answer the phone with my name. Because I travel on business often and am an unaccompanied female, I often order room service instead of going out, and the Fairmont is very fast. That said, there is a great food court located just under the building, which during business hours makes for a fast and inexpensive meal, and I often buy a pint of milk and small cereal for my breakfast at one of the fast-food places in that mall.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and convenient location keep me coming back!”
Reviews.Author: urmtrout
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Fairmont Queen Elizabeth countless times for both business and pleasure trips to Montreal. It's downtown location makes it an ideal jumping off point to local attractions such as Old Montreal and the Bell Centre, which are both walking distance. Via Rail takes me to Central Station, which is downstairs from the hotel, so it's just a short walk indoors to the hotel from the train. If I just feel like staying in and not going too far, I have all amenities right there in the building: restaurants, drugstore, dry cleaner, liquor store, convenience store, I can go on and on. As for the hotel itself, it is very old, but manages to combine classic features with modern style. The decor of of the rooms is very nice, and the room includes a mini-bar, coffee maker and bath robes. Beds and bedding are extremely comfortable, and the cordless phone (along with another phone on the desk) enables me alot more flexibility when I need to use it. I always feel pampered when I come here. The staff at check-in are always gracious and attentive, call me by name and are pleasant, helpful and respectful (thanks Georgette!). Bell staff are likewise. Because I travel to Montreal fairly often, this hotel feels like home (except no one makes my bed or cleans up after me at home). I know I will receive a great stay, helpful staff and a travelling experience that makes being away from home a little less stressful. As I travel across Canada often during the last 10 years, I stay at a lot of hotels. This is the first Fairmont I ever stayed in, ad convinced me to look for the Fairmont name wherever I travel. I have never been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Cups in the room”
Reviews.Author: DBM24
Reviews.Content: I was very excited to stay here athe Queen Elizabeth, after spending a few days at the Fairmont Kea Lani earlier this year. Unfortunately, my first impressions were not positive. When I got to my room, the door was ajar, and not locked. I looked around, and made sure everything was in place, and nothing from the mini-bar was missing, and then settled in for the night. The bathroom was clean, the toilet didn't flush properly, but just required another flush. The shower was OK...not quite Westin standards, but OK. I like the toiletries provided at the Fairmont. In the morning, after a reasonable sleep, I woke up to make some coffee. One of the cups had visible coffe stains on the rim. Yuck. Unfortunately, there were no disposable cups to use, so I washed both cups, quickly drank my coffee, and prepared to head out. I'm not sure if housekeeping changed the cups or washed them, or didn't wash them. When I think about, I've never seen any housekeeping staff at any hotel come with soap/sponges to wash anything. I just assumed they take everything away, and put the dirty cups in a dishwasher. I then decided to test this. I made a small mark (a little dot) on the inside of the two cups with the pen provided in the room. It was fairly faint, and it is easily rubbed off with your finger...let alone with soap and sponges. Well the next night, I went to make another cup of coffee, and I found the two small dots stdill present on the cups. I wasn't pleased, and called the manager. I reached the night manager, and I told him what I did/what I found, and asked him how everything is cleaned. He answered by stating firstly the housekeeping manager was not in, since it was late. Secondly, he had not personally every cleaned a room, and so he didn't know the exact procedure for cleaning cups or the coffee maker (now this got me thinking about the cleanliness of the coffee maker). He did state he knew they don't have soap, but use chemicals to clean everything. The manager sent up new cups, and offered compensation. I didn't expect compensation, and accepted a free breakfast for the following morning. Thank-you. As you will see, I have writted over 70 tripadvisor reviews. I believe I'm pretty fair in my reviews. I'm not surprised by the manager's response, and would make a small suggestion to have a set of disposable cups available for the guests. I would also suggest reviewing how the coffee makers are cleaned, and making sure there is a procedure in place to clean them, even if they look clean already. You never know what the previous guest will do. I ate dinner at the hotel with a customer, and it was excellent. The customer who is a native Montrealer commented on how good the Poutine was (a Quebec meal favourite). Breakfast the next morning was also good. The WiFi worked well, and overall the staff was efficient and helpful. The location is very central to downtown Montreal, and convenient for my business meetings, both offsite for my partners to come to the hotel. The bed were fine, but not quite to Starwood (Westin/Sheraton) standards. For a downtown hotel, the rooms were a good size. I would stay here again, but would emphasize the points of some previous reviewers that this hotel needs to work a little bit harder at maintaining the standards of the Fairmont chain.

Reviews.Title: “Gold floor review”
Reviews.Author: Human44
Reviews.Content: I had a very good stay on the Gold Floor, but there is a bit of room for improvement. Arrived Saturday night, and slept very well in the comfortable bed. Bathroom was clean, but not spotless - area behind door had a dustball in it. The only way to fix this is to close the door and look around from the inside. This was caught by Monday's housekeeper, not Sunday's. Breakfast in the club lounge was better on Monday than Tuesday. Tuesday's server didn't ask which tea to bring, and brought my least favourite (Earl Grey). Tuesday's scrambled eggs were below par. Tasted like they'd been frozen then reheated. Other than that everything was up to par. No noise on floors 18 and 19, unlike reports from other parts of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: KSP19348
Reviews.Content: The pros and cons are evenly balanced. I stayed 5 nights last week at the Fairmont Queen Elizabeth for a conference, and am not sure I would stay there again if I had a choice. First, the pros: I stayed in a junior suite, which was nicely and comfortably furnished; not as stylish as the larger suites or Fairmont Gold, but perfectly agreeable. The bed was very comfortable. There's a dedicated President's Club desk, and the staff at check in were very nice and efficient. Indeed this hotel is VERY strong on service, with one exception (see below). The only meal I had in the hotel was room service breakfast, which was excellent and served on time at 6:45am. There's a gym with weights, cardio, pool, and steam room--all well maintained and not at all crowded. Now, the cons: 1. HEATING DIDN'T WORK I was originally checked into room/suite 809, which had poor heating in the bedroom and no heating in the living room. I reported this and a repairman was sent up in a few minutes. He diagnosed the problem and said there weren't any other rooms and that he would have a space heater sent up. Not ideal for $234/night. Waited an hour and still no space heater. So I called the President;'s Club staff, who were very helpful and said immediately that there was another room/suite, which I moved into within an hour (#1617). Alas, both suites has a view of the parking lot, but at least the one higher up had a less offensive view.
