In the new room, the heating did work properly, but the bathrooms were the old unrenovated style. But the real probem was that the shower didn't work. Again I reported it, and the repair was made promptly., But why should guests have to inform the hotel of these basic faults? Don't they check the rooms before allowing guests to spend a night there? 2. NOISE NOISE NOISE Of the 5 nights I spent in this hotel, I was woken up on 3 of them in the middle of the night by drunk noisy guests ... at 3 and 4 am. And on one occasion security had to be called (by another guest). However, security arrived immediately and the offending guests did quiet down -- and seemed to disappear the next day. I've stated in lots of hotels over the years, and this was the worse experience I had for noise. 3. Erratic chambermaid service. Some evenings I was working in the room and told housekeeping I didn't want a turn doen service ... only for another chambermaid to walk in without knocking saying that she was told I did want the turndown service. On other nights, the turndown service was offered anyway, as I was out of the room. But what a disappointment: a corner of the sheet and duvet was folded back and a bottle of water was placed on the nightstand. What's the point? The last hotel I stayed at the turndown service included dim lighting in the bedroom, soft music on the cd player, some aromatherapy, and a plate of brownies. Now that was service! 4. Poor furnishings. There was not a proper dresser or bureau in the bedroom. The only cabinet was one clearly originally used for a mini bar, coffree service, ettc. No proper drawers for clothes. What on earth is this hotel thinking? All of the furniture was chipped, as were the bathroom sinks, and chipped badly. All in all, a toss up. Great service and a (mostly) pleasant room. But faulty infrastructure and guests who don't know how to behave.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JLangs
Reviews.Content: Sue and I honeymooned at the Queen Elizabeth in October of 1971. For our 40th anniversary we returned. Although the neighborhood around the hotel changed dramatically, modern office buildings, etc., the charm of the hotel was exactly as we remembered. Unlike our first visit, we took advantage of an up-grade to a Fairmont Gold room. If nothing else, coffee in the 19th floor longue complete with panoramic views of the city justified the extra expense. As for dining, the Beaver Room in the hotel was the perfect place to celebrate. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Service Is Slipping”
Reviews.Author: MtlHabs
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Fairmont Chain across Canada on business and pleasue for the last 20 yrs. with an average of 4 stays in the various properities per month. In particular the QEW was always a favourite however the high level of service has continued to slip in the last few years. As a President's Club member I grown accustomed to high level service but the last three stays have not been great. While the room was great ( stayed in a suite), there was no turn down service without phoning and requesting it, room was not serviced till approx. 4:30 p.m. daily, no robes were in the room, no water etc.... When turn down service first arrived it first consisted of handing me a bottle of water and nothing else! On the plus side all issues were dealt with and apoligizes offered. Food in the Montrealis restaurant was excellent and you cannot beat the locaion.

Reviews.Title: “A Canadian Institution!”
Reviews.Author: servicecomesfirst
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the "Queen E" off and on since the 60s. Sure, the rooms are tiny and they are need of updating (on the plus side flat-screen TVs seem to have arrived), but the service is first rate, the food is good, the beds are very comfy, the staff are very pleasant and the location is perfect. The Queen Elizabeth is a Canadian institution -- you gotta stay there at least once.

Reviews.Title: “Many possibilities for improvement”
Reviews.Author: Vvrreenniiee
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel during a round trip in Canada with my family. On arrival it became first of all obvious that this Fairmont Hotel has none of the charm that some others like for example the ones in Quebec and Ottawa have. The hotel is an expressionless high-rise building with no architectural highlights. However, the hotel is situated centrally with the major shopping street, shopping centers, restaurant and some sights very close by. The location was much more important for us so that we did not mind the hotel's architecture, although this might have had influenced our overall experience positively. Furthermore, it is not very convenient that it is not possible to stop in front of the hotel during the day. You can only unload the car in front of a side entrance which is hardly visible and even there is only very limited space. Additionally, when we arrived no bell boy or anyone was there to help with the luggage until we looked for someone in the lobby. I think is very unusual for a hotel of this class. The lobby is spacious with many comfortable opportunities to sit down. The front office clerk was very friendly and checked us in quickly and without any problems. We had two rooms on the fourth floor looking at a roof of any adjacent building. This was not very nice but we did not book any special view. The guest rooms as such are extremely small. They are not much wider than the beds standing in the rooms so that there is nearly no space to put the luggage. The bathroom is very small, too and the black floor and tiles make it seem even smaller. But in total the bed and bathrooms are nicely furnished and decorated, the beds are comfortable and you can find all amenities you expect from a hotel within this category. Unfortunately, the cleanliness of the rooms leaves a lot to be desired. The carpet had may stains as well as the curtains. The windows are in a disastrous condition. They were old, dirty, did not close properly and there was mould on the rubber seal. This was probably also the reason why we found thousands of ants in one of our rooms in the luggage on the morning of our departure. The window sill in the rooms is very broad because the AC is stored there. So we put some of our luggage on the window sill as there was no space elsewhere. We mainly packed everything the evening before we left. But the next morning we had to unpack everything again as an ant colony was running all over our belongings. It was awful and we went to the reception to complain. The only good thing that can be said about it is that the front desk clerk was sympathetic and apologized. Besides, she reacted immediately by providing us a free breakfast for the whole family for the inconvenience. As we already often experienced that you complain but nothing happens we appreciated this reaction. Concerning the other services the hotels offers we made one positive and another negative experience. Very positive were our stays in the hotel's bar. The staff there was very friendly and already on the second evening they recognized us and remembered our preferences. Furthermore, you get some unusual variations of nuts, crackers and crisps with your drinks, which are delicious and complement to the drinks and the overall experience. The negative experience we made again with the bell captain service. During our stay we asked the concierge for the best way for five people to get to the airport. We were told that the most convenient and cheapest way would be to go there with a mini van that is spacious enough for five people and luggage. It would be no problem for the bell captain to organize such a car. We should just inform him one hour before we need the car. Thus, we went to the bell captain before we had breakfast on the day of departure and asked him for organizing the car and informed him that we would be five people with luggage because we wanted to make sure that the car is big enough. But when we wanted to leave around one hour later the was firstly now car organized at all. Then a car came but it was ways to small for all of us and our cases. Another a little bit bigger car came, but the bell captain said that this one would be too small, as well and he said that we will need to take two cars. We were quite angry because two cars also meant double costs and it was confirmed that it would be possible to organize a bigger car. In the end we managed to squeeze everything in the little bit bigger car and we were fine. But it was very unpleasant that the bell captain was not helpful at all and even tried to blame us for the problem. All in all we concluded that we faced too many problems during this stay so that we would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Place”
Reviews.Author: aliwithattitude
Reviews.Content: If you are planing a trip around Via Rail this is where to stay - The hotel is directly above the station. Don't worry you would never know there was a busy railway station below. We have stayed here several times and have also gone for lunch with friends. the main reception is a must for people watching. Montreal's underground shopping mall is easily accessible through a connecting door so you never have to step out into the harsh winter weather. The building is Heritage so do not expect huge rooms - Its the price we pay for history. This grand old lady is defiantly the place to stay. Enjoy..

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend getaway.”
Reviews.Author: TNgirl111
Reviews.Content: Great location. Many fresh food vender 2 floors down in shopping network. Helpful concierge always available and gracious. Enjoyed the 24hr fitness center. Be sure to join the Presidents Club, it is free and has worthwhile perks.

Reviews.Title: “Super location!”
Reviews.Author: Hotdogbikers
Reviews.Content: Ok I had read the reviews about the house keeping not being the greatest but because the train stops right below the hotel and my son was going in from Toronto I booked it any way just for the ease of not having to get a cab etc. Yes the rooms are small and yes the brushed nickel door knobs and hardware should be polished after every guest just because you would expect it from a Fairmont hotel, but our view was so excellent overlooking the impressive Baslique and bing able to sit on the extra wide window case made it all worth while. The view from our window in the day and at night was worth putting up with finger prints on the nickel plated hardware and the yellowing of the tub due to age. It is not dirty just aged that's all. The staff was very helpful and you can walk to old Montreal if you wish. Great food great people in Montreal very passionate people. Would I stay there again maybe not unless I was coming by train yes I would.

Reviews.Title: “double payment”
Reviews.Author: eoin s
Reviews.Content: 8 days after checking out and paying my bill, I find that an additional amount comprising the bill plus 100$ per day (which I was not informed about) is still charged against my bank account and will remain so for 14 working days!. Beware preauthorisation procedures!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: TheArc314
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally located near many shops and restaurants. I loved the fact that the train was just downstairs below the hotel. When we arrived in the evening, the customer service began at the front desk. The staff was very warm and courteous and check-in was a breeze. The next morning however, we were awaken by the loud sounds of construction drilling. We immediately called downstairs and requested to be moved to rooms on another floor. I was fortunate enough to have a large corner room and was reluctant to give it up when we were shone the other rooms on another floor. Like the other reviewers mentioned, the hotel rooms are typically very small. The front desk asked the construction crew to work on another side of the hotel for our entire stay. The housekeeping staff were very friendly and seemed to anticipate my needs! Also, I must mention that everyone at the concierge desk were most helpful and made wonderful recommendations! I would definitely return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel, intimate rooms”
Reviews.Author: Havamama
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for a conference and was pleasantly surprised with a number of services that often suffer at other places, in my experience. Arrived too late for dinner so ordered room service and was brought the most lovely vegetable soup in a silver-plated turreen. Small things like that helped to put the annoyances of a long travel day behind me. As other reviewers have said, the rooms are small and lack certain updates (like a flat-screen tv), but the beds and bedding were extraordinary. Pack your bathing suit and warm up in the hot tub after a day of walking in Montreal's lovely neighborhoods.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some TLC”
Reviews.Author: DPSMINOZ
Reviews.Content: This is another Grande Dame hotel, with excellent location and lovely service, but tired and worn. Rooms are small enough that it's hard to walk in between the armoire and the bed. Bathroom is uncomfortably small. Most important, the carpets are dirty, furnishings are shabby, bed is downright lumpy. Could be spectacular, but it's just okay.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: Grmpmbl
Reviews.Content: I'm actually writing this review before my trip is concluded, as I don't recall having such mixed feelings about a hotel. On the one hand, I appreciate the vintage graciousness of the place. While my room is somewhat small (despite my having joined The President's Club), it's nicely appointed despite the very small bathroom. (I agree with the other reviewers in that regard, and I'm not even a very large person.) On the other hand, it never occurred to me, though, that not having a flat-screen TV could make a difference. Now that broadcasts are proportioned for "hi-def," I realized as I watched the news one evening before bed that part of the left side of the screen was basically lopped off because of the older set. And while I can tell that the housekeeping staff works hard, I was surprised to find a small glob of what appears to be hardened toothpaste (someone else's) on the lid of the toilet; I left the lid down when I left this morning in the hope that it would be found and cleaned off. (No luck. And the porcelain on the bathtub is a bit chipped--minor, but.....perhaps that glob is an errant splotch of paint, but I'm not eager to find out.) What has been the most disappointing, though, has been the internet service and its inconsistencies. I am here for a conference, and these days, accessibility by one's office back home is expected. While I have (mostly) been able to gain access from my room and in the hallways, there is a separate network for the conference rooms--to which one does *not* have access (even if one has secured access to the other, "regular" network in the hotel). Another inconsistency: With the regular "Fairmont" network, I had been able to gain access with my last name and room number; suddenly, tonight, after trying to get online numerous times with my name and room number, it appeared that this time I needed my President's Club number to gain access (which I had to retrieve from the friendly hotel operator). In sum, I like the place, overall--but a bit of tweaking here and there might help (even if the bathrooms have to be small).

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: greenpaint
Reviews.Content: This is the place to stay in the heart of Montreal. We took via rail and walked right upstairs from train station to hotel. Walking distance to Old Montreal. Rooms were luxurious! Make sure you sign up for Fairmount Presidents Club which is totally free and allows for perks such as free wifi, use of sportswear shoes IPod Will stay here next trip to this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: Mojo_6674
Reviews.Content: The staff seemed very courteous and attentive (at least during my stay). The room was very clean including the bathrooms. Appreciated the free upgrade without asking as the hotel was full thus worth being a club member (free). The only thing that bothered me was the expensive breakfast buffet for 2 which cost 60 some dollars which was way overpriced. Never again. Catch many better breakfast eateries in downtown Montreal for way less. The hotel is a little dated in the main lobby and sorely needs a face lift, otherwise it is well maintained. Will stay their again as the rest was comfy and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, bathroom too small and lack shelf space”
Reviews.Author: TXGirlinKY
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice older, upper end, well maintained hotel. The front desk and concierge staff were very helpful and the housekeeping staff exceptionally friendly and accomodating. John Lennon and Yoko Ono had a suite on the 16th floor that has a plaque that says "Give Peace A Chance". The bed was comfortable. The bathroom was too small. I personally hate any bathroom where my knees block the door from closing when seated. I continually worried that my toiletries would slide off the small shelf for toiletries into the toilet or jewlery would head south for the sink. I had some allergies which I suspect may have been an a/c ducting issue. Beyond these comments it is a nice hotel with very pleasant and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Love the location BUT...”
Reviews.Author: HotDogColorado
Reviews.Content: You really cannot beat the location of this established hotel--above a train station, steps from great shopping, near the Bell Center, etc. BUT. The service in the restaurant can be spotty--one night we were seated at a table directly under a light that was faulty and flashing and they knew there was a problem with the light before we were even seated there. We had to ask for another table, very irritating and unnecessary. The room we had wasn't huge but it was very clean and had a great view. The bathroom, however, left a lot to be desired. There was a constant drip from the faucet in the tub, which got increasing worse. Apparently it had been that way for a good while--the enamel around the drain was completely eroded. Of course when we called the desk and a maintenance person arrived, the leak stopped. There is virtually no counter space in the bathroom, except for a small amount above the toilet, and half of that is taken up by the extra toilet paper and Kleenex. There is a bit of space around the sink, but that's not a very good spot if you need to keep your toiletries dry. The lighting in the bathroom is horrible. Many people have already commented on the old television sets. Even my parents have more modern flat screens. I can deal with all of the above issues. Not optimal, but not the worst conditions. The thing that just drove me nuts was being able to hear everything going on in adjacent rooms. AND I DO MEAN EVERYTHING. The staff, for the most part, is friendly and accommodating. Room service was quick. Sign up for the Presidents Club to get free Internet access, otherwise they charge an exorbitant daily fee. Would we stay there again? I'm on the fence. Will probably investigate other hotels before making that decision. I just really like the location. BUT.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LL123500
Reviews.Content: This is in a great location -just above care central where the via trains arrive. It is within walking distance to many attractions and shopping. The hotel itself is well furnished, clean and staff are friendly.

Reviews.Title: “1st impressions set the tone”
Reviews.Author: NOLAjetsetter
Reviews.Content: As soon as check in started the tone of my entire stay began. The young woman who was "helping" me was so very rude and condescending! Being my first international get away there were many things I didn't know, and to top it off, I had problems activating my credit card. While I was trying to do this the receptionist insisted on me finding alternate means for payment or even a plan instead of being compassionate and truly putting forth the over the top customer service you would expect from an institution such as the Fairmont, Not only did I feel belittled and embarrassed by this representative, the whole experience left a bad taste in my mouth the remaining of the time. I had to stay here for a conference, but there are a number of other hotels in the area that I'm sure would be honored for you to stay at and would probably bend over backwards for you to feel welcomed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LifeOfTrip
Reviews.Content: I came to the Fairmont for a business convention. It is a great location, close to transportation and walking distance from many attractions. It felt very safe, friendly staff and clean rooms. I wouldn't call the Fairmont luxury by any means, but very nice for business trip. Staff spoke English, which helped me out quite a bit. I would definitely consider staying here again if I returned to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised at some of these reviews...”
Reviews.Author: CherieC515
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in October 2011 - solo. I found all the staff extremely courteous and helpful, although perhaps a little slow on occasions in the restaurant. I made an effort to practise my French and even that was greeted with good humour by all concerned! My room was fine with an extremely comfortable bed and delightful views of the Cathedral. It was a bit noisy at night but it was my choice to have the window open, so that's not a valid complaint. The concierge was friendly and helpful, as were the reception and room service staff. Probably my ONLY complaint - and this is probably not within Fairmont's power to change - was that the taxi which took me to the airport at 05:20am from outside the hotel, threatened to break down on the freeway and we spent most of the trip with hazard lights flashing and me praying. I had been advised there was no need to book a cab, as "there are always ones outside". So please Fairmont management - make sure the taxis you are allowing to service your clientele are ROADWORTHY! Apart from that, its location makes up for any other minor shortcomings. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly let down”
Reviews.Author: goneagain50_7
Reviews.Content: I recently went on a business trip to Montreal and stayed at the Fairmont Queen Elizabeth. I generally love the Fairmont brand of hotels and have stayed here one before for a short stay but this time I was slightly let down. Upon entering my room I noticed it was a nice size and the bed looked nice and inviting especially as I had been travelling for some time. I was about to throw some garbage in to the small garbage can and noticed it had not been cleaned. I contained left over fruit and kleenex etc. I was really surprised by this but thought we all have a bad day and maybe the maid was really busy as a major conference was in town. That night as I got into the lovely bed I noticed several long hairs between the sheets. This really is one of my pet peeves. On another note, whoever designed their bathrooms knew nothing about what a woman needs in there. There is a tiny shelf of no more than 4 inches above the toilet to lay a cosmetic bag on and the makeup mirror is perched in a corner, rather high up over the toilet. In order to put make up on I had to sit on the toilet. I mean really? I like the convenience of the location, the staff are friendly and generally it is a nice quiet hotel but with the choices available in Montreal, I will stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet dreams 'n bad eggs!”
Reviews.Author: David F
Reviews.Content: Location is great, right downtown, next to the train station. Beware of ordering anything extra in the restaurant as it's ridiculously expensive, they charged an extra $9 for an egg when I wanted three eggs instead of two! On the plus side, the bed was extremely comfortable, you kind of melt into the pillows...zzzz...

Reviews.Title: “Service and location are the key”
Reviews.Author: Tex68
Reviews.Content: I'm in Montreal 3-4 times/year for business and the Fairmont Queen Elizabeth remains probably my favorite hotel. Beside the regular quality for a Farimont hotel, what really makes me love this place is the quality of service. Particularly careful and always with a smile, ready to help in any occasion. PS: super breakfast!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cindy l
Reviews.Content: The location of this historical building is by far its' best feature. Although food was good, the service was not....not in the restaurant or elsewhere. Wouldn't call this an experience...just a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average room, poor cleaning stuff”
Reviews.Author: Loukas M
Reviews.Content: Me and a colleague stayed there for 5 nights, visiting the city for a conference taking place about 15 mins away on foot. Hence, the hotel was very well placed and it was a nice walk to the conference centre. The room was of average size, and we found it to be the smallest of the 4 rooms of other colleagues we saw during our stay, which were staying in four nearby hotels and were paying the same price. The cost for the internet was also higher compared to them. Size aside, the beds were comfortable and the noise at a low level. The bathroom was small but adequate. The TV in the room was from the stone age, and it was located such that it only suited one of the two sharers to watch, while in bed. What I really did not like in the hotel was the condition it was left by the cleaners. The floor in the room was not hoovered once during our stay there, which is not what I would expect given the price tag. Also, the surfaces in the bathroom also were not cleaned properly by the cleaning personnel. I did not want to make a fuss, as I could (and did) cleaned the surfaces myself, but I would certainly not be returning to this hotel on my next visit to the city, as it appears below-par with respect to competitors.

Reviews.Title: “Location only upside.”
Reviews.Author: Gibarca
Reviews.Content: It is a good thing this hotel is attached to the train station and underground city and has that Fairmont logo on it because that's about all it has going for it at this time. Clearly we were out of our demographic for this hotel. The average age of guests appeared to be 50-60s; decor and approach seemed to match. No innovation, no thought, boring. Separate and apart from the fact that this hotel is nothing more than every other Fairmont property out there is the staffing issue. When I asked the concierge how to get somewhere via the underground city he seemed amazed that I would ask. First of it, it was pouring rain, second we had selected the hotel because of this feature. He informed me in a smug way, telling me it was much easier to do it above ground - did I mention the rain? The line to check in was unreasonable. A bus group was checking-in in front of us and the hotel had one person at reception. Not the front desk staff's fault; they make do. Management clearly not paying attention. Upon checking in we were given the key to an unmade-up room. Awesome, back to reception. Upon lamenting the problem we were given a new room. No upgrade, no apology, no recognition that maybe something was wrong. Again, not the front desk's fault - they follow marching orders. We were late to our concert, almost missed the first act. Simply not worth the price or frustration.

Reviews.Title: “Bathrooms need updating BADLY!”
Reviews.Author: Bubbavon
Reviews.Content: Our recent 3 night stay at the Fairmont was actually good in every respect but one. The Bathroom we had in room 1759 was embarrassingly in need of renovation. The sinkt is stained and will never look clean not matter who cleans it. The Toilet seat is so scratched and dull I can't imagine how long it has been there. The worst though without question was the tub. Chipped, stained, bad caulking fix jobs that have also been there long enough to stain a dirty brown. The icing was the hair in the tub on arrival. YUCK! This a nice hotel but the bathroom is so bad I would look elsewhere or confirm you are getting an updated bathroom. Other wise we found the service to be good and check in to be extremely efficient. Valet was fast and friendly. I am Fairmont club member (free membership)so I got free internet and it was fast. I also got a free small fridge in the room which was very handy to keep drinks an food in. The location is great for shopping, Old Montreal and Down town. Just a shame about the bathrooms! REALLY BAD BATHROOMS! Other wise I would have given it 4+ as a rating but the bathrooms made it a 3-.

Reviews.Title: “central location with good city view, but not so quiet”
Reviews.Author: liketravel101
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights here for a conference. The location is great, in central downtown Montreal. You can walk to many restaurants and stores on St. Caterhine. Close to subway and the VIA train station is right underneath the hotel. My room is on the 14th floor and has a very nice city view. I feel the dome of Queen Marry Cathedral is just inches away from me, stunning view during night time and early morning. Room is not spacious, but ok, typical metropolitian hotel room size. Your room could be a bit noisy if it is close to the elevators and there are six of them. This is a big and busy hotel and lots of elevators uses, even during the night. I found it not too bad, but light sleepers might not be able to fall asleep.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: LouiseThomas
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at many Fairmonts this hotel was about what I had expected - small room and very small bathroom likely due to older age of hotel; room decor was neutral and contemporary; bed and pillows were very comfortable; and there was coffee and a nice selection of teas in the room. For my business trip it was more than adequate. I found the service very good at this hotel from the business center, front desk, concierge, etc. Fitness room is large and well-equipped with modern fitness equipment. I would definitely recommend staying here. Service at the bistro was not as good but the food was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Close to convenient shopping!”
Reviews.Author: missxanthropy
Reviews.Content: I absolutely LOVED the location of the this Fairmont. Its easy to get to by bus from the airport (the bus stop is literally 1 block from the hotel), the metrol runs below it along with a foodcourt,convenience stores and amtrak. Facing out from the hotel lobby roughly, you're two blocks and mere steps from miles of shopping, restaurants, bars , movie theater and bookstores. Fairmont staff were as always very helpful with directions. I would highly recommend this hotel for the shopper at heart.

Reviews.Title: “Good night sleep”
Reviews.Author: william k
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference, facilities excellent, room very clean, bathroom rather small but good enough. Only negative is they still have the clunker TV sets. Check-in and check-out staff excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in a good location”
Reviews.Author: mikerutherford
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Queen Elizabeth because we got a good corporate rate and the location was very convenient. Otherwise it is pretty average. The decor is older and could use some updates. The room felt small and the bathroom felt really small. Generally the service was very good, except in the bar.

Reviews.Title: “They treat clients as numbers - Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Pepe A
Reviews.Content: I was supposed to stay at this Hotel after making a reservation long time ago. When arriving to the hotel I was told it was full and they sent me to a horrible hotel instead, under the promise that was the same quality. The Fairmont is quite old style, but very convenient, but compared to the one they sent me is the last shout of boutique hotels in town. I would recommend to go to another Hotel, btw, Westin is much better.

Reviews.Title: “Every Need Met and More”
Reviews.Author: PaddyCakeOregon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fairmont Queen Elizabeth in Montreal for three nights. We decided that we would use our President's Club membership and reserve a room at the "gold" level. We were able to use our past reward points to qualify for one free night so we only paid for two nights so it made it a great deal! Each morning we were able to go to the concierge lounge for a breakfast of fresh fruit, pastries, toast, bagels, juice, oatmeal, scrambled eggs, potatoes, etc. Very nice service and good selection for a continental type breakfast. The only down side was the coffee. Canadians, in general, aren't strong coffee drinkers. We asked three different people in the Tourism Centre down the street where we could find a Starbucks and not one person could tell us! Each evening light snacks were served along with a honor bar. Great view from the top of the hotel and a quiet atmosphere. No loud bar with blaring music for us! Drink prices were a bit high but we found that to be true, in general, throughout the city. Also in the lounge we could access bottled water, pop, etc. during the day. The Fairmont was a great choice. I am really glad that we chose the "Queen" for our stay in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: BenGruda
Reviews.Content: We have visited Montreal 2 to 4 times a year for the past 25 years, and we have stayed at most of the major hotels in the downtown area. The Queen Elizabeth has become and remains our go to hotel. It is not the cheapest, but then again none of the major hotels are. Promotions can help, and so does the advance purchase option. The staff are the best and always look out for your well being. All of the restaurants are excellent; even world class. We take the train, and the station is right below the hotel. That area boasts many shops and gourmet food shops. Easy access to the underground and the Bell Center. If you want the best, this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay and PERFECT location!”
Reviews.Author: alelex
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Fairmont Hotel during only 2 days in September, the hotel is a really big city center hotel, and really busy hotel! The room was a Jr Suite, with a nice view and really quite, the bed was AMAZING like always with Fairmont. The restaurant "Le Beaver Club" was a really good choice, the food is excellent but the service was a bit slow (was a problem in the kitchen, so no big deal)! One great thing about this hotel, is the location, you are near everything in Montreal (for what we did, we have the train station under the hotel, the metro too, and we have a direct access to the "la ville souterraine". I will go back in January, and really, cant wait!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not worth the price by far.”
Reviews.Author: leemoreau
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for 2 nights after winning a contest recently. We had a junior suite which has a king size bed and a pull out couch because for some reason they hardly have any rooms with 2 beds? Luckily we didn't pay for it since we won it but when I tried to book the same nights for a junior suite for fun, it showed $823 for two nights on their website!!!!! The hotel is very convenient, you don't have to go outside to get to it from the metro or train which is nice. The lobby is nice as well, definitely has a more up scale feel, but I tend to prefer very modern looking hotels where as this one almost seems a little dated now. The room itself wasn't bad but it really didn't blow me away. I expected to be mind blown walking into a $411 a night room but it was completely average. There were basically two rooms, a living area and then the bedroom. There's a powder room off the living room and full bath off the bedroom which was handy. The furniture though feels cheap, like it's inexpensive but trying to look like it's luxurious. The TVs are ancient as well, they're old CRT ones and on most channels they are in HD so the TV cuts off the left and right side to display the image. In the room there was a tray of snacks and drinks which was funny, $8.50 for a bottle of Evian and $4 for a tiny thing of Pringels. The hotel is very nice and I don't mean to complain a lot, it's just I've stayed at MUCH nicer hotels for way less than this. For the price of it I would have expected something much nicer. I stayed one night after this at the Embassy Suites which was $105 a night with Priceline and I had a 1200 square foot suite with 2 bedrooms, full kitchen, fireplace, etc, the regular price is around $200-250 for the room. Now THAT impressed and blew me away. Maybe older people like this since it definitely is decorated like your grandparents home :)

Reviews.Title: “very convenient and classy”
Reviews.Author: dondedieu
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel several times on business. Although the rooms are smaller than many more modern hotels, the facility is well- maintained and the rooms are very comfortable. I imagine that for those travelling with families, the rooms may feel small. I find them quite adequate and in keeping with the charm of this historic property. The QE is the hands-down winner when travelling by train, especially in the winter. The hotel sit on top of the train station and it is not necessary to go outside to get to it. It is also connected to shopping and right in the middle of Montreal's downtown business area. There is a well-run pool and spa to relax in the evening, a clean work-out facility and convenient restaurants. There is lots of lobby room where one can wait for a taxi, client, airport shuttle or for the next train. The staff is polite and professional. However, I find the food in the hotel restaurants rather ordinary and expensive. If I was going to Montreal for a romantic couples weekend, I would try one of the boutique hotels instead. But for business travel, this is an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't Get Any Nicer!”
Reviews.Author: schnoobs
Reviews.Content: This hotel is something to experience. We arrived via train ( right downstairs from the hotel) From the moment we arrived we had first class reception! The room was beautiful! The bed was super comfortable and the sheet were superb. We requested an early wake up call and had coffee brought to our room complimentary. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and friendly service, but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: PhotoTravels
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont from 9/8 through 9/12 (reluctantly had to go back home for meetings) and my wife stayed on until 9/15 for a conference there. Overall, it was a pleasant stay, mostly because of the friendly hotel staff. The location is right in the middle of the corporate office area of Montreal. Although the hotel is right above the central train station, this is not a particular advantage unless you are using suburban/regional and intercity trains, including Amtrak from the US. There are a several Metro stations nearby, all a short walk via the underground tunnels. The biggest part of the indoor, underground city complex is right around the hotel and train station. You can reach hundreds of shops via the passages, although some are fairly junky. The adjacent Villa Marie complex has nicer shops, and links to the Eaton Centre and similar complexes to the north. You can even walk to the convention hall via the passages, but they are difficult to find and not as convenient to use as walking on the surface if the weather is good. Via surface streets, the old city is about 20-30 minutes walk to the ESE, with some hills to contend with. The entertainment district for the younger crowd, Crescent Street, is about 20 minutes to the WNW. The #747 bus to the airport has a stop right outside the hotel's front door, at the corner of Rene-Levesque and Mansfield. The fare is $8 exact change, but it's better to buy a pass for the same price before boarding, as it gives you 24 hours use of the Metro and buses. The bus worked well for us inbound, but after waiting in the dark for 25 minutes for the scheduled 3:30 a.m. departure, it was a no-show, so I had to scramble to take the $38 cab ride, and wasted my pre-purchased pass. The standard rooms at the hotel are very small, about 14x14 excluding the small bathroom and hallway/closet. On our floor, the standard rooms were the odd-numbered rooms, and overlooked other buildings. The even-numbered rooms were slightly larger and overlooked the main street and the cathedral. We had booked a junior suite, which added a sitting area and powder room in the footprint of two standard rooms, so we had adequate space. The room decor was above average, but not luxurious. The room was very clean except for very dusty curtains, but they were eventually cleaned during our stay. The bathroom was small. It was necessary to close the door to use the toilet. It was clean and well-stocked with quality toiletries, and the shower worked well. There was a mini-bar and an in-room safe. There is normally a $13 daily charge for Internet service -- annoying to me, but it was waived for our junior suite. There is a garage below the hotel, but I don't know the fee. The staff was just delightful -- pleasant and helpful. The good service, combined with the hotel's upscale atmosphere, made our stay a very nice one. Although we didn't have time to use them, the hotel had bicycles available in the lobby for guest use. In connection with the conference, my wife was hosting a dinner for about 200 people. With her staff, she has done this in other places (the next one is in a month at Caesar's in Las Vegas), and was very complimentary of the Fairmont's staff. The food was excellent, the service good, and a good value. She wishes Caesar's was as easy to work with. Overall, we would recommend this as a large hotel choice unless the smaller rooms are an issue.

Reviews.Title: “No Air Freshener in the room please.”
Reviews.Author: BenPrairies
Reviews.Content: Efficient check-in. Comfortable King size bed which dwarfed the smaller room. Opening the door, the room reeked of air freshener smell. Finally located the plugged unit behing the desk and turned it off. In my view, an air freshener has no place in a hotel room. Luckily, the smell wore off quickly. I have stayed at this hotel a couple of other times for one night and was rather underwhelmed. I think I can do better at this price point in Montreal. Will I stay there again? Probably not.

Reviews.Title: “lovely old hotel”
Reviews.Author: jfmack
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a number of times and this visit was no exception. I find the staff helpful and enjoy the history of the hotel. As well I find the location very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Dinner in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Lynn H
Reviews.Content: We wanted to take a nice leisurely ride from New York city to Montreal on the Amtrak Adirondak train. Lovely ride up, train station is directly below the hotel and linked to the underground city/maze of shopping and bistro's. The hotel was very nice and convenient to everything. Expect to pay top dollars for meals and drinks not just at hotel but all over the city! We arrived a few hours late our first night due to problems at the border crossing* so only had sandwiches that night, Breakfast was great and all the food we ate was tasty. Very pricey, glad we only stayed a day :o) The hotel hooked us up with a Gray Line tour and we spent the next afternoon touring and then enjoyed walking around and found a great place to eat across the street from the hotel at The Keg. * BE WARNED, we were shocked that the train was held at the border for more then four hours and eventually several people were pulled off the train and not allowed in the country their fates unknown to us or the train crew. Rumors were that some had DUI convictions and other misdemeanor charges in the USA that we never realized would prevent you from getting into the country.

Reviews.Title: “What a classy Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: michel t
Reviews.Content: I recently visited Montreal. My stay at The Queen Elizabeth Hotel was such a delightful experience I will not soon forget. I highly recommend this Hotel. The staff is out of this world, they really make you feel like you are important, like someone very special, they seem to go out of their way to help you. A special thanks to Viviane who works at the front desk, she was so helpful and thoughtful, a real gem. I also would like to thank CÃ©sar who was a great help. They are top of the line. By the way, the food and service at the Beaver Club is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive business hotel”
Reviews.Author: coalharbor2010
Reviews.Content: Small rooms and high prices with stale 1970`s decor and standard Fairmont good service. This is where governments and big corporations lodge their employees. If you are visiting Montreal as a tourist then one of the boutique hotels is a better choice.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not great”
Reviews.Author: WearyTraveler56463
Reviews.Content: I went to Montreal for a work related conference and got a "special" rate of $182.00. I have stayed at much nicer hotels for way less than this. I will start by saying the location is great - it is right above the underground rail and offers easy access to the indoor city (the locals call it the "indoor city" rather than the undergound city). We were on the 15th floor so we had a beautiful view of the city. We also really liked the toiletry products they use (Miller Harris). Now for the not so great part: we stayed close to the elevators so we could hear them going up and down all the time. Fortunately, it was not too bad during the later part of the night. The housekeeping staff was always very loud out in the hall, so no naps during the afternoon if you are tired from walking all over the city! The room was small and they bathroom very small. I expected a bit larger space that what we got for $182.00. They also nickel and dimed us for every extra thing, charging for local calls and for the use of their business center. I did manage to get them to remove the calls from our bill as the airline had lost our luggage and we needed to call them regularly to find out the status. They were very accommodating about removing the charges. I guess I just expected more luxury for the price. It was OK, but not great.

Reviews.Title: “Overall poor service”
Reviews.Author: Susan C
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night at the end of our road trip during which included very basic chair hotels. This was to be an anniversary splurge. Upon pulling to front, we were met by a bellman who continuously kept telling us to move our car out of the loading zone- apparently it was prom night and the "kids" were much more important than adult clientelle. Luckily, I drove around the block 3 times while my husband went inside. Our first room was nice with a nice view. We requested to be upgraded and moved to a 2 room suite. One room (with fold away couch) smelled heavily of smoke despite being a non smoking room. We have 2 children and smell was nauseating. We requested it be addressed while we went to dinner. Upon leaving the room, a dirty room service tray was in the halllway on the floor. Upon arrival back, no change. Tray still in hallway- hours later. The lobby was inundated with prom kids and felt more like we were in the middle of the function. We had trouble getting a recommendation for a restaurant. Apparently, the concierge desk has names but knows nothing of the restaurants. When we called down for a room change, there were no others for us. They said there was nothing they could do but deoderize room. So by the time this was done, my children got to bed about 11:30 still breathing in smoke. We opened the windows and were very disappointed at the service. The hotel is pretty and has a great view. Many things are within walking distance. From the moment we pulled up, we felt unimportant. This hotel did nothing to make us feel like they wanted our business. It was like they had other people to impress. I have stayed at many "average" hotels that resulted in a wonderful stay due to the consideration and kindness of the staff. Upon arrival home, we received a certificate for one night stay at the sister hotel in Quebec. Since this is so far, we probably will not travel there. I will stick with Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay.”
Reviews.Author: Sharpay10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located above the Via Rail/Amtrak train station which to be honest is the only reason I chose to stay here again. The hotel is grand and has a lovely lobby. Check-in was friendly and fast. We had a smaller room which was dated. Bathroom was normal size. We arrived by Via Rail and it was very easy accessing the hotel from the station. This hotel is located close to shopping and is a short walk to Old Montreal. We enjoyed the Old Montreal area much better than the area the hotel was in. If you get an opportunity to visit Old Montreal and only have a few hours, I would highly recommend the carriage ride. Itâ€™s a large area to cover on foot. The hour long ride gave us a great view of the entire district and was a great experience. Overall I feel this hotel is overpriced for the room quality and amenities. This hotel does not provide free wi-fi and breakfast was not included in the price. There are other hotels in the area that provide more amenities for less.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: HermesParis
Reviews.Content: We always stay at this centrally located hotel when we are in Montreal. This was our anniversary. Ask for room that overlooks the basilica. We prefer the suites. If you are departing on an early train, this is the best location: the station is underneath the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NickPop
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during Rogers Cup and saw several players in the lobby. Very nice grand lobby. Small rooms but functional. Compact bathroom could do with some updating. Complimentary use of BMW bikes a bonus for Fairmont Presidents club members. We used them twice and rode to Old Montreal and along the river. Great location. Very convenient to St. Catherines Street. Starbucks just on other side of St. Catherines. Airport bus drop off and pick off very convenient as well (across the street). Got a great rate from Tennis Canada. There was a dog across the hall who barked a lot. This was very annoying. The hotel is quite plain from the outside; not like other Fairmont hotels. Train station, metro, underground mall all connected to hotel. Quite large exercise room and pool with attendant. Sauna could do with an update. Very well maintainted property.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall stay but expected more from a 5-star mini suite.”
Reviews.Author: k-existence
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont for our girlfriend's bachelorette. It was nice but expected a bit more in the mini suite. The sofabed wasn't comfy but everything was clean. Customer service messed up our room because when we booked, we request and confirm two full baths via the phone. When we checked in, we only got one bath and said no such mini suite exists. However, last year we stayed in a mini suite with two baths! They didn't even upgrade or compensate their mistake. Parking was expensive. $28 a day valet. I would rather stay at a regular holiday inn next time for cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not a 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: bustermania
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that this not a bad hotel but nowhere near what a 5 stars is in Asia. Good location and excellent restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “I'm not sure how the hotel could be rated five stars...”
Reviews.Author: Chris G
Reviews.Content: The lobby sure could though! I booked as part of the LOMA conference (9/11-9/13). We booked a standard room, which was tiny, but livable. We found that the sheets had a pubic hair on them (very prominently displayed next to the welcome card). Since we arrived late (near 6 PM), we decided to go for dinner and to ask the staff at the front desk to have the bedding changed while we were out. When we got back at 9 PM, the sheets were untouched. I called the front desk and was assured that the sheets would be changed. 30 minutes passed and I had to go down and speak to a manager before anything happened. As part of my conference, internet access was included in the room free of charge. When we went to the front desk to ask about it (because the web gate asks us to accept the charges), they said to accept the charges, because they have something on their end that will remove them. I woke up this morning to see a bill slipped under my door - that includes 3 days of DOUBLE internet charges. How lovely. I do not expect much from hotels of any caliber, merely a clean room, and for them to adhere to their word. This hotel fails on both points and if it were not for the location, or the friendliness of the door people, I would have rated it a 1. Also, be prepared for $28/day parking and mandatory valet service. Two things I wasn't expecting (I didn't see a sign for the $28/day and the only place it's listed on the website is on a tiny link on the bottom right titled "fact sheet").

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: MarkKwok
Reviews.Content: This is an old grand hotel conveniently located in downtown Montreal. I am aware that the train and metro stations are underneath the hotel but I ended up taking cabs the entire time of my trip (3 nights) and there is no shortage of cabs. There is always a line of cabs waiting outside the hotel. The room is big and the bed and pillows are very comfortable. There is a charge for in-room WIFI but as other contributors pointed out, it's free upon you presenting front desk with a Fairmont President Club membership number. The membership is free to join online.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel right above Amtrak's station in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: BobbyAMTKtraveler
Reviews.Content: I travel to Quebec occasionally on business, and highly recommend the Queen Elizabeth. It's conveniently located right above Montreal's Central Station, which is served by Amtrak. The hotel itself is very nice, with clean and comfortable rooms. Fine dining is also available in the hotel itself, or you may choose to visit any of the multitude of nearby restaurants. Many of Montreal's attractions are within walking distance, such as the cathedral, Old Montreal, and the Bell Center, where the Canadiens play hockey. Although downtown Montreal hotels, the Queen Elizabeth included, are not the cheapest, you can minimize your costs by taking Amtrak, if you have the time, and want to experience one of the top-ten scenic train rides in North America. A round-trip from Philadelphia to Montreal on Amtrak costs $126 mid-week. The train sets no speed records, but travels along the spectacular shores of the Hudson River and Lake Champlain. My wife and I enjoyed the scenery and the chance to relax and read a good book, letting Amtrak do the driving. It was great having the Queen Elizabeth's comfy room only steps away from the train when we arrived. Cars are available for rental, and Montreal has a great public transit system. If you want to visit Montreal without the hassles associated with flying, try Amtrak to the Queen Elizabeth Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Feeling pampered in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: mermaid3011
Reviews.Content: Great place ! We stayed for three nights midweek and brought our dog! It's the most petfriendly hotel I know! And everyone was so friendly and accommodating so that we felt completely pampered and it was the best part of our vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value for Business or Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: ncbiztraveller
Reviews.Content: The Farimont Queen Elizabeth provides an experience like stepping back in time to the old grand hotel. The lobby is vast and well decorated in a turn of the century decore. There is plenty of sitting areas if you are waiting on a tour bus or just want to sit with a group of people. They also rent bicycles in the lobby which is convenient. The rooms are fantastic. Not large but not tiny either. Tall ceilings make a difference. Heavy draperies, nice linens and a thick comforter. Pillows to die for. I slept better here than in my own bed. Even a Turkish bath robe. Only down side was an old style TV but no big deal for me. The onsite restuarant and bar is nice but there are many other options near by. Now the best part is that is that when you take the elevator to the lower level you are connected to the Montreal underground and the VIA Rail system is directly beneath the hotel. Very convenient for travel and then of couse for shopping. Also, there are several restaurants in the area including "The Keg" directly across the street. There are many beatiful old Churches and buildings in the area making it very pleasant for a walk if the weather is nice. Pricing was very reasonable for a hotel of this caliber. It appeared to me that many tour bus companies use this property

Reviews.Title: “Traditional luxury with best rail travel location”
Reviews.Author: metalmaiden
Reviews.Content: From the days of John & Yoko's bed-in this is very much the luxury hotel of the 70s era. It's not an over-the-top, bend over backwards, race for the most outrageous in luxury. It's very simple and elegant. And it seems quite reasonably priced for a luxury hotel. We stayed 2 nights the first was in a standard king. The room was #1000. It was a corner room with views on two sides one of which was dome level of Cathedrale Marie Reine-du-Monde---breath taking! While the room is quite small I absolutely loved the view! The following night we had a queen room Gold Level. When we did our checkout, checkin, as soon as they saw we were gold level it was as if a switch went off and all of a sudden the level if attention to us went up. Not sure if I liked that. I think everyone should be treated the same. The service provided may be of a higher level, you may have a separate elevator and club lounge but the way the clients are treated should be the same regardless of who they are, which room or level they are staying at or how much they are paying. The gold level was fantastic; service, food, rooms, attention to detail. All around superb. For the small increase in price, for what you get it has value and it is well worth it. The fitness area is really a full gym. There was enough equipment that whatever time of day there was no wait. The equipment was a bit worn and dirty though. The pool and whirlpol were great and never crowded. There's also a wading pool for little ones. The locker room was functional and had a steam room. The down side was that the lockers were quite dirty and the steam shower smelled strongly of mold. One tip is that there is aways fruit infused water and a bowl of fruit at the fitness area desk if you need a little snack pre/post workout or between meals! One great feature is that this hotel is directly above the central railway station (you would never know it! Not a rumble, noise or shake.) which makes it the perfect location for rail travelers. And it is central to business as well as all sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: ilovedgreece
Reviews.Content: I got a good rate on this hotel and a friend and I stayed for 2 nights. I think we got the most basic room which had free internet, comfy beds and I requested the cathedral view which was beautiful. All-in all the room was nice, little "old" and slightly small but in the end, I really can't complain about it. I think the best thing about this hotel is its proximity to the shopping area of St. Catherine's St. with all the outdoor cafes too, and then you are only a 20 mins walk downhill to old Montreal and the water which was beautiful. There are metro stations all around, and the best part is that the hotel is above the train station and an underground shopping area with tons of coffee shops and quick food options. We did the self-parking on a Friday/Saturday and it only cost $30 for 2 days which was great. We went to Montreal for the weekend to go out to the clubs and this hotel was ideally situated b/t the clubs and old montreal/shopping. I would return!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed about the room”
Reviews.Author: DaMaTravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel 3 nights for vacation and were pretty disappointed about the room. We had booked a moderate large king room 5 months in advance but on arrival (4 p.m.) we were told that there was no such room available yet. We were then given a Fairmont room, but upon seeing it (pretty small) we insisted on having what we had booked. We were then showed a moderate large room (suddenly available) and to our even greater disappointment it was pretty old and smelly (all rooms of this category are so old we were told, but on the website of the hotel they are just described as with "traditional furniture"), so we saw no other possibility than accepting the Fairmont room (newer indeed but still with a pretty old bathroom and a cracked basin). Despite having accepted a lower category room and having paid in advance for the stay (we had booked through a travel agency) we were very disappointed the hotel did not even offer us breakfast in compensation. Furthermore we had to wait ages for our luggage to be delivered to the room. Apart from this, the hotel is very good located since it's only 10 minutes walk to the most important sightseeing items. It is above the main train station, which can be reached directly through an hotel internal lift and offers a lot of food alternatives to the quite pricy one of the hotels (we're just judging the prices and not the quality). We would also recommend to adhere to the "Fairmont's President Club" before going to the hotel, so you'll receive free wi-fi access from the room.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: DrShuggy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here whilst attending a conference in the hotel. Arriving from Toronto by train was just about as convenient as it could possibly be since the station is directly beneath the hotel. The room was fine, with a fabulous view up the hill to Mont Royal from the top floor. Service from the check-in staff was polite and efficient and they rapidly corrected some incorrect charges for using the mini bar which I had not done. The hotel does look a little dated and not much of the glamour from when John and Yoko staged their bed in remains, but all in all it's a good value and well-located place to stay in Montreal. Make sure you join the President's club via the fairmont website before arriving so that you get free wi-fi access.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: S T
Reviews.Content: We kick started our 2 week vacation here. Great Location, everywhere is walkable. This hotel is on top of the famous underground city. Walking distance to shopping and restaurants. Hotel is very quiet and great beds! Another great Fairmont Property!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service but pricey breakfast and wifi charges”
Reviews.Author: chocolatemonkeybear
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont is perfect for those costing Montreal for the first time as the central location is fantastic. The concierge provided a number of ideas for a two hour trip one afternoon. My qualms come with the facilities in the room - paid for wifi at newly $14 a night is steep considering that most business travellers expect this as a standard. The breakfasts are great but be prepared to pay roughly Â£15! Eat lots! Finally although clean and tidy the decor is rather out of date and more with what I would associate a country hotel to display as opposed to a premier city hotel. Overlook wifi, eat breakfast elsewhere and you'll have a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown location”
Reviews.Author: Snowbird409
Reviews.Content: Classic Fairmont / CP hotel from last century, but not as nice as some of the other Fairmonts I've been in. Very comfortable beds, small baths, nice lobby, decent restaurant, super location.

Reviews.Title: “Great afternoon tea”
Reviews.Author: LoneRock
Reviews.Content: I went to the Queen Elizabeth Le Montrealis restaurant for afternoon tea with my husband. I would say it was an good experience, but given it wasn't crowded, i was a little disappointed that they wouldn't let me order the high tea and my husband the Austrian tea. The waiter told me that you have to mention that when you make the reservation, when it doesn't say it in the website. All in all the service was fine otherwise and the tea and food was excellent. Never expected to be trying pistachio flavored macaroons which were great and nice sandwiches, scones, jam and cream. My mother and i want to have a girls weekend, so maybe i would take her there.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, great location”
Reviews.Author: Hemmo K
Reviews.Content: I was amazed with the service of the hotel, all your requests and info needs are fullfilled, and with great speed. The location is excellent in the downtown of Montreal. I recommend

Reviews.Title: “Central location, Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: SMP1212
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night recently because we got a great rate through my husband's company. The hotel is located so centrally, an easy walk to Rue Ste.Catherine for shopping as well as very good restaurants nearby. The rooms are clean, although I continue to be surprised by the size of the rooms - seem much smaller than some of the other hotels I have stayed in. The concierge desk was very helpful with directions and restaurant suggestions. The one complaint we had was with the exorbitant rate for valet parking. Other than that, we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Gold Rooms are Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Em-Atlanta
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Fairmont Gold level rooms and it was great. Concierge was EXCELLENT. I've heard the rest of the hotel is in desperate need of a renovation but the Gold level rooms are great. Nice location.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rosemary1938
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the Rogers Cup (tennis) and luckily bumped into several of the top players also. We booked the Gold Plan and were graciously escorted to our room on the 18th floor by the front desk receptionist to ensure that the room met my special requirement - which it did. The room was large and bright and the bed comfortable. On the floor above was the Gold lounge serving excellent breakfasts, hors d'oeuvres and drinks. The chef knows how to make scrambled eggs - light and creamy - not yellow rubber!!! And there was BOILING water for tea!!! On three occasions we ate in the Montrealais restaurant in the hotel and on two of those occasions there we had dinner - very good - and the other was for afternoon tea which was a delight. All dining staff were pleasant and accommodating. We also ate in the bar - again my companion and I found the cocktails very much to our taste and better than in most bars where young barpersons don't have the knack, it seems, to put together a good cocktail. Leaving on the last day of tennis we were able to leave our bags in the hotel until we left town. All together a very pleasant hotel with friendly and helpful staff and a reason to visit Montreal again. A regular room would have been very affordable but we chose to upgrade because of the convenience of the Gold Plan lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and services”
Reviews.Author: orleans_motr
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel is you are coming to MontrÃ©al by train as it's right above the train station. There is also a pretty extensive food court although many places close around 5 and are closed on the weekends. Hotel is close to all major MontrÃ©al attractions and on a mÃ©tro line. Rooms vary quite a bit. The standard Fairmount room tends to be on the very small side so can be a challenge is you have children. Tip would be to join the Fairmount President's Club so you can get free internet and accumulate stays. Food is generally good, some dishes are quite good but others are ordinary. As with most hotels the room service fees are high. Pool is not deep so great for families, very clean. Also a hot tob and children's tub. You can reserve bikes for 2 hour periods at no cost.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravel3or6
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent time and comfortable stay at the Fairmont Queen Elizabeth. The employees were attentive and helpful. The rooms were very clean and the maid service excellent. The hotel is centrally located. We enjoyed Montreal and would enjoy a return visit there. We visited the lobbies of other hotels in the vicinity to make somewhat of a comparison. We would definitely choose the Fairmont again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, but eat out at a local restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: Turtlpc
Reviews.Content: The room was small, but I did not need anything more. The hotel has a charm that stems from being one of the older hotels in the area. My one complaint would be the food, not up to a 4 star rating and over priced. Anyone staying at this hotel should eat out at one of the many fine restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot to stay”
Reviews.Author: brsperth
Reviews.Content: We spent a night at the Queen E with our grandchildren - it is a very nice place to stay - somewhat expensive but right in the center of Montreal. We upgraded to a suite which turned out to be very nice. The restuarant serves great breakfasts and dinners - again a bit expensive but very well done (the liver is great!). We visited the Biodome (lots of fun) and wondered around old Montreal area. Montreal has some great shopping areas we found.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: medchem
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in the Fairmont Queen Elizabeth Hotel twice in the last few years and have loved it both times. The hotel itself is very beautiful, the in-room breakfast is to die for (although quite expensive), but the location is the best thing of all. You can simply go down the stairs from the main lobby and access the underground shopping and subway. So no need to venture out in the arctic cold if you are visiting during the winter months. However, if the weather is nice or one is brave enough to venture out, the very charming shopping district of Rue Ste Catherine is just a very short walk from the hotel. The only negative thing I have to say is that if you are arriving late at night during a weekend, the hotel valet parking gets full, and you might have to park the car yourself in a parking garage across the street, which gets a bit creepy at night, and it isn't a very pleasant walk back to the hotel from there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but needs a facelift”
Reviews.Author: AvidTravellerCalgary
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a good hotel but it is starting to look a little "tired". It does need a facelift. The location is great and the service was excellent. We found the room to be a bit on the small side for a hotel of this caliber. Noise from the elevators could be heard 24 hours a day and this was distracting (the room was some distance from them).

Reviews.Title: “Best big hotel in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: JuliaClaire
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Fairmont a number of times over the years, both on business and pleasure in Montreal. If you want to be downtown, this is a close walk to the Rue St Catherine shopping. The hotel is a beautiful gem and the rooms are super comfortable and classic. If you can afford to, upgrading to the Gold Floor is well worth it -- private check in, beautiful room for breakfast and wine and cheese in the afternoon and great concierge. Otherwise, The superior rooms with the separate sitting area are also terrific. The pool area is nice but the gym needs an upgrade And sign up for the President's club for fast checki in and free wifi. Don't hesitate to stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: garpee
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful! My then boyfriend found a great deal at this hotel. This is a perfect location because it was right near the shops. This hotel wasn't too far from old Montreal and the bus station we got off at. The service was excellent as well. Staff were very friendly and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “A terrific, elegant hotel!”
Reviews.Author: joanwOttawa_Ontario
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had the opportunity to do an overnighter in Montreal. We chose the Queen Elizabeth as our accommodation of choice having never been there before. A friend had mentioned their Fairmont Gold program. Upon further investigation, we discovered the price was not much higher than a standard room and went for it. It was absolutely worth the extra money. Nested on the 18th and 19th floors, the rooms (at least ours) were spacious, bright and had a fantastic view of Mount Royal and the city. Our room was 'guest ready' upon our early evening arrival, with classical music softly playing, ice in the ice bucket and low lighting just waiting for us - and our bottle of wine. As well, there is a private lounge for Fairmont Gold members only with complimentary everything but alcoholic beverages. The lounge - with massive windows overlooking the city - converts to a private breakfast room in the morning, again, only for Fairmont Gold guests. All complimentary. The breakfast was wonderful featuring a wide array of very fresh fruit, eggs, cold meats, fresh juices and pastries. A wonderful way to start a full day of sightseeing. I highly recommend this elegant, historic hotel to anyone with an eye for those little extras that make - or break - a getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: deanhill
Reviews.Content: have been a long time fan of the Fairmont Queen Elizabeth. Great location, especially when arriving by train! The Gold Floor is a worthwile upgrade, although the lounge is far too small to accomodate all guests for breakfast during busy holiday weekends. I am afraid this stay may be my last. Rooms are starting to show wear; and the bed (both mattress and linens) are not on par with Westin or Marriott's offerings. Nice to see new high-def TVs, but with no HD programming, what's the point? With the recent 4 and 5 star hotel openings in Montreal, Fairmont would be wise to reinvest in this property and not rest on their laurels for much longer.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious but more for business”
Reviews.Author: mahadeen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over a long weekend in April 2011. Got an amazing deal from their website and decided to give it a try. I take the train in from Toronto and have always wanted to stay at this hotel given that it is right on top of the train station. That was neat given that you dont have far to travel to get into your room once you arrive into the city. This would be very nice in the winter given that you don't even go outside to get to the hotel lobby. My main problem with this hotel is that it is not even close to the Mountain. It is located right in the downtown district but where most of the business takes place. Therefore, it is a long walk to the Mountain (which is the nicest part of Montreal) and I also found the air pollution to be greatest in this area, compared with properties closer to the mountain. Otherwise, the location is ideal for shopping on Ste. Catherines and is close to a lot of downtown restaurants. The hotel room was really nice. Well appointed with nice amenities although small. the lobby is fantastic with a nice private sitting area.. I would stay here again if the price was right (I paid $129 a night) but I would look a bit harder for hotels a little closer to the mountain.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location small but great rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jonesilla
Reviews.Content: There for business. Staff very helpful. Room was small but immaculate and bed was heavenly. Prime location downtown, as close to everything. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great central hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: justatravellinman
Reviews.Content: despite some of the prior posts (marked walls, smell of smoke) we decided to book here anyways and are glad we did! rooms are "cozy" (as they are in all properties of this era) and service was outstanding from check in to check out. Hotel is only a block away from the excitement of St. Catherines St and a 15 minute walk to the great restaurants of Cresent St. I strongly recommend the valet parking at the property as it's too easy to get lost if you self park (off property only) and walk to the hotel This hotel checked all boxes for us.........

Reviews.Title: “lovely with " reservations" on the hotel restaurant”
Reviews.Author: mmv123
Reviews.Content: This was our 1st family trip to montreal and we were unsure about the best place to stay. Using the Fairmont Club members card, we were able to save quite a bit of money on the room rate. There is not a thing out of place at this hotel; very clean, well run, knowledgable staff. The suite was on an upper floor as requested with a good amnt of space for 4 people. I would have spent the entire week in the lovely shower if not for the pull of Montreal itself. The beds were turned down at night and a small lamp lit. The concierge was wonderful; answering all subway questions, etc.. It was a very welcome respite at the end of a long day of sightseeing. The bed linen was light and soft, mattresses with just the right amount of give to them. Nice to be able to reach the underground directly from the hotel. My only concern would the hotel restaurant. We ate dinner there on our last night and found it to be rather expensive and poorly staffed. So poorly staffed that when my husband found a small piece of glass in his entree, there was very little concern! The management did handle it the next day when I was checking out and paid for our meal. Not quite sure if this was a valid resolution to a potentially very serious situation but we were ready to head home at this point.

Reviews.Title: “Old Montreal from the seat of a BMW Bike”
Reviews.Author: PrairiePatty
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed touring Old Montreal and the fabulous waterfront on our BMW Bikes provide by the Queen Elizabeth as part of our Presidents Club Membership! Thank-you! What a great way to see So Much!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: peace4242
Reviews.Content: I visited Montreal this month (July 2011) with my husband. We spent two nights staying at The Nelligan in Old Montreal (nice hotel - see separate review) and then spent one night in downtown Montreal at The Queen Elizabeth. I was not excited to stay in downtown Montreal - or at the Queen Elizabeth - because I didn't want to be in a business district in a large, touristy hotel. That being said, I found that downtown Montreal is a great location! It is a more central location than Old Montreal and easier to get where you need to go. Taxis are right outside the hotel and the hotel is directly above the subway and Amtrak station, which is incredibly convenient for people who want to zip around the city. Great restaurants are just up the street. The Park Mont-Royal, The University and great museums are within walking distance. The hotel itself was just lovely. The room was tiny but great - they had everything you would need for your stay in that tiny room (bathrobes, coffee maker, flat screen TV, hair dryer, etc) and the bed was ultra comfortable. My husband was bummed they didn't have an ipod docking station in the room but that was his only gripe with the hotel...
