The staff was really nice and helpful, which is a definite compliment because this hotel is huge with tons of people asking a zillion questions. This place is not quaint and intimate (it's a large hotel catering to hundreds of people) but I found the staff, location and amenities to be top notch. Plus, it was $100 cheaper to stay here than in Old Montreal. So, I will definitely be staying here again when I return to Montreal next year!

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed it.”
Reviews.Author: EluniaZ
Reviews.Content: Service was friendly and helpful. Location was central to everthing. Close to train station. Room was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: evanjva1Usa
Reviews.Content: We were booked here as part of a cruise package. The location was great as it was above the Central train station, Amtrak two floors down, and the Underground City, 19 miles of tunnels and shopping and places to eat. The rooms were clean but a little worn. I clipped a couple of ravels off the middle of the rug that should have been noticed by housekeeping. The beds were comfortable and there was the usual coffee and tea service. I had them remove the mini bar snacks that sat on top of the television cabinet and lock the mini bar so thre would not be any dispute whether it had been used or not. I recommend signing up for the President's Club. It saved me a $13.95CAD per day for internet service and allowed me to check in ahead of my other cruise mates. Our room was ready while most of the other cruisers had to wait since we arrived at 11 AM and the normal checkin time is 3 PM.

Reviews.Title: “Go for the Gold”
Reviews.Author: Torontonian54
Reviews.Content: The Gold Room experience at Fairmont Queen Elizabeth can really transform, for a decent surcharge, the quite good staying experience into a really super one. The attentiveness of the concierge, the more polished rooms and amenities, the breakfast and hors-d'oeuvres, to name a few, add much luster to the visit to Montreal. Hard to go back to the standard rooms after experiencing the Gold.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: wfn10
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in many Fairmonts and found this property very welcoming,safe and a good value. It is centrally located in Montreal close to everything!! Prices were reasonable for value received. Fairmonts are our 1st choice when we are in Canada!!

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont amoung the Best!”
Reviews.Author: 780Edmonton
Reviews.Content: Excellant location with very accomodating staff. Great business facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but....”
Reviews.Author: NorthCarolinaRoxy
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5 & booked adjoining rooms at the Queen Elizabeth. The rooms are typical city rooms, small. Although, two rooms were plenty of space. When I opened the blinds I was surprised to have such a great view. Across the street is a beautiful church. My main complaints with this hotel have to do with smell: 1) there is a musty odor as you walk down the hallways & 2) we were on the third floor - smoking is on the 4th - the odor of cigarette smoke was so strong in our bathroom in the morning I couldn't stand in there to dry my hair. On the positive side, the staff were very friendly, quick to assist in exchanging money, helpful with bags & fast when retrieving the car. The concierge was informative, pleasant & helpful. The hotel is located directly over the train station which is convenient for transportation, shopping & breakfast (Premier Moisson & Tim Horton's is located steps from the elevator). We were only there 2 days & spent most of our time in Old Montreal. Now having a better "lay of the land" If I were to take the family back I would probably try a hotel closer to Old Montreal. If you want to be downtown, I'd say the Fairmont is a nice hotel but make sure if you do not smoke that you are placed several floors away from smoking.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: EBEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights pre-cruise on 30th june. On arriving in Montreal we discovered the airline had lost all our luggage. Checkin at hotel was quick and efficient the room was a little small and a bit dated but very clean and adequate for a short stay. We did not use the restaurant during out stay but we didorder romm service both evenings and the food was nice and good value. Nadine on the COncierge desk was exceptionally helpfull and kind regarding our lost luggage and contacted Air France on our behalf. Unfortunately the suitcases had still not arrived by the time we checked out and this obviously had an impact on the enjoyment of our stay. However,I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel for it's lovely staff.

Reviews.Title: “Resting on their laurels”
Reviews.Author: newberries
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel, but I feel that they expect their reputation to carry them over. I found that recent renovations were poorly (cheaply) done. The bathtub had been "resurfaced" but the coating was peeling off (see photo of drain). The decor was nice enough, but the quality of the furnishings was something like you would find at Costco. The sheets were a coarse, low thread-count muslin. But worst of all was the mattress. It was of very low quality, not at all firm, bouncy to sit on with an old fashioned blue and white ticking cover. I have experienced better at a Hampton Inn! As is common in high-end hotels, you must pay for wi-fi. I have become accustomed to this, but when we got our bill for one night, we had been charged 3 times for wi-fi. When I questioned this, I was told that they charge per device used (my husband and I each used our iPads and I my iPhone), although they did issue a credit for 2 of the charges. I guess they get this complaint a lot. All in all, I expected a bit more for $300 a night!

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: Nessnclair
Reviews.Content: Room was guaranteed by 4pm but was not ready until 6:15 pm. Our luggage was supposed to be in the room, but was not. It had been sent to someone elses room. Found an hour later. Room was a non-smoking room but smelled of smoke enough not to be able to sleep due to burning eyes and coughing

Reviews.Title: “Would like to come back”
Reviews.Author: whoknows987
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and is centrally located in the city. The staff was friendly and helpful. the room furnishing were of good quality although the room was a little cramped. Had a room right next to the elevators and expected it to be noisy but was not a problem. Could not get a non-smoking room even though I booked well ahead. While the elevator lobby reeked of stale cigarette smoke, it was not at all noticeable in the room. This is no bargain hotel. Even with a substantial conference discount, it was pretty pricey as was the hotel restaurant where I ate only once. The hotel sits right over a train station and there is a large food court and some restaurants associated with it where reasonably priced food my be obtained most hours of the day. There is an extensive network of underground passages, shops, etc. in downtown Montreal and you can get many places without going above ground. The passages can be rather confusing. With the complex tunnels and French signs, I got totally lost my first attempt and had to get above ground to find my way back to the hotel. However, once you figure them out, they work quite nicely. Although a bit pricey, Montreal is a really nice city to visit and, for US visitors, you get the real flavor of going to a foreign country without the cost and stress of overseas travel. While some knowledge of French would be useful, this non-French speaker had no trouble getting around and encountered no resentment for my lack of ability to read or speak French. Most clerks and shop keepers I encountered were fluently bi-lingual. However, signage is almost entirely in French. All-in-all it much easier than most European countries I have visited.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: dobblesUsa
Reviews.Content: It isat the center of MontrÃ©al's vibrant cultural and commercial district sits . Located above a food court, the train station (Via Rail & AMTRAK) and it is connected to an extensive underground city of boutiques, restaurants and cafÃ©s, and within walking distance of sports and cultural attractions. I was only there for two nights so I was not able to take advantage of everything the hotel had to offer like the restaurant, swimming pool, gym etc...

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: SAGlobetrotters
Reviews.Content: In the knowledge that the rooms of this hotel were small, we arranged a suite. The bathrooms are very pokey with no bench space with old fixtures/fittings. Never had to pay to store luggage before and had to pay $3 per person for a couple of hours. Well located centrally. Lots of food options underneath the hotel. Premiere Moisson bakery underneath and highly recommended for breakfast. Staff provided good service in general. You can join the President's Club for free before you go and then get free internet when you are there.

Reviews.Title: “hotel was OK”
Reviews.Author: sandysan09
Reviews.Content: Firs time in Montreal and wanting to stay at a Fairmont hotel since they normally have a great reputation. However my opinion has drastically changed, upon arrival there was no attendants at the front to assist with your luggage, the front desk staff was pleasant but aloof. Immediately I could see that the hotel is more of a "convention" hotel, not an acommodating to "all" guests type it looks and smells old, this was, or used to be a very fine and spectacular hotel (probably when John Lennon and Yoko Ono stayed there), it is looking very dated and the rooms are OK, but need refurbishing badly, the bathrooms need new paint/wallpaper, the beds are great though, the ammenities are excellent and we had plenty of towels. The public areas are always buzing with people in between their meeting and/or conventions, you can hardly find anyone from the staff to ask any type of question. It is centrally located and has great access to all.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location if arriving by Train”
Reviews.Author: Bergie01
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times when arriving in Montreal by train. The convenience can't be beat, since the gorgeous hotel lobby is simply an escalator up from the train station. No taxis or subway required...and it's an easy indoor walk. The lobby itself is gorgeous. Make sure to sign up in advance to be a Fairmont President's Club member (free) and get a quick check-in. Front desk staff have always been very friendly and professional. The rooms can be on the small side, but very well appointed. Comfortable beds, nice washrooms, good views. The subway is a block away and the hotel is convenient to many good restaurants and shopping. Avoid eating at the hotel restaurant. The buffet breakfast is good, but very expensive. The hotel pool is small, but lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the price!”
Reviews.Author: prof_trad
Reviews.Content: Gracious service through and through - from check-in: upgrade to Fairmont Gold quickly done upon my request to very helpful gold level Concierge - wished I had asked her to book an impossible-to-reserve table at Le Pied du Cochon! Lounge very comfortable, albeit a bit squished at breakfast rush. Great views, highly convenient location; we arrived by train and walked everywhere. Would definitely stay there again if I didn't have family in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service for high room rate”
Reviews.Author: zzz12314
Reviews.Content: I paid $259.00 per night and definitely did not get the service I expected. Front desk and concierge staff answered my questions, but it seemed like a chore for them to do so. Light bulb died in my room. Maid called down but light bulb never was replaced. TV which was in a stand with 2 covered doors was 90 degrees from bed, so it was impossible to watch TV if lying in bed as door opened to only 90 degrees. Bathroom had hair left 3 of 5 days. Ice bucket was not emptied daily. Although I needed to check out at 5:30 am, which was early, I had to wait 10 minutes before someone appeared (there was no bell to notify anyone), resulting in my missing the shuttle to airport. The attendant in the gym was the only one who provided great service. Will never stay at this hotel again and most likely not at another Fairmont Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience and elegance, but a tad small”
Reviews.Author: Lubiere
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the Mondiale de la Biere, June 9. Govt rate of 139$. Arriving by train, this is the ideal hotel, connecting to the waiting hall via the 3rd level basement elevator. Check in was very courteous and friendly. Fairmont President Club member get free internet. The room was on the small side, but the comfie queen bed made up for this. The work area is adequate, however, a real ergo chair would be better than the restaurant chair provided. Internet service was excellent. The TV is still an old CRT hidden in the TV cabinet, fridge appointed with expensive offerings. The bathroom is rather claustrophobic, with a very inconvenient tight squeeze on the toilet bowl, especially with a big behind like mine. The shower was nice and with good pressure. The view outside was superb, with the CathÃ©drale next door. The gym area is decent, with the usual cardio, some old school muscle machines, and the pool is shallow but long, so good for laps. The Jacuzzi was a nice surprise, large and deep. The changing room has a nice steam room. Overall, a very conveniently located hotel, great for businessmen, and govt employees with easy access to metro and train. I shall be back.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!!”
Reviews.Author: ciscokid23
Reviews.Content: This past May, I returned to the Queen Elizabeth Hotel for my sixth vacation stay in six years. Does that mean I like it? Guess? To begin with, Montreal is one of the outstanding urban destinations in all of North America - the food, the culture, the museums, the history, the Habs - the city has it all. And, the Queen Elizabeth Hotel is right at the center of it. The location right on Rene Leveque Avenue, atop the passenger train station (VIA Rail and Amtrak) and the Bonaventure Metro station, means that not only do you have access to anywhere in the city or, for that matter, the country, but also to Tim Hortons (Toujours Frais!) and to a Quebec SAQ liquour store. The hotel is huge and attracts many conventions, but the front desk staff is always courteous and hospitable and the only noise is a bustling lobby. Even when there was an impromptu strike of the housekeeping staff two years ago (it is, after all, French Canada with all of its charms and quirks!), the staff tried to cover any inconvenience. Will I return next year? Of course I will, and, if you do, go in May - it's like having outdoor air conditioning and you'll catch the tail end of the winter season events - the symphony, opera, and art exhibits.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel. Not sure if it's five stars, though.”
Reviews.Author: PopeBiff
Reviews.Content: A clean, friendly, centrally located hotel. If you're taking the train to Montreal, you can't beat this place since it's attached to Central Station. Staff is happy to speak English. Bed was comfortable and bathroom was well-appointed. Classic mid-century architecture. Coffee maker didn't work. Beautifully-restored Dominion Tavern is around the corner on Metcalfe--check it out for dinner and drinks. Although, this is a high-end hotel, I'm not sure it's five stars. Oh, and Beatle-geeks will love that you can rent the room where John Lennon and Loco Ono had their 1969 bed-in.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, close to everything downtown”
Reviews.Author: ljf83
Reviews.Content: I spent a weekend at the Fairmont Queen Elizabeth for a girls' getaway trip. Our rooms were spotlessly clean, with a lovely view of Mont-Royal, and the pool and gym facilities were a nice perk. We also spent some time in the hotel bar and received excellent service. Although it may be a bit of a splurge price-wise, it is worth it for the location and the quality.

Reviews.Title: “Terrrific staff-great location”
Reviews.Author: OhioMaranello
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Queen Elizabeth every June to attend the Canadian Grand Prix and have never been disappointed. Great downtown location. Check in is a breeze. The lobby is large and designed to process throngs of guests. No place to hang out and no atmosphere. All business. Our room is a bit tired but clean and comfortable. No flat screen televisions or IPod docks. The bathrooms are adequate but not fancy. The beds are extremely comfortable and the linens top notch. The breakfast is outstanding. As good as it gets. Plentiful fruits and cereals and everything else you could imagine. The restaurant staff is extremely courteous and professional. One of our servers, Irene, an extremely kind eastern European, went out of her way to give us sightseeing tips which turned out to be terrific. An added bonus is the great work of Nathaly the Concierge. Don't hesitate to rely upon her judgement as she is a woman with outstanding taste. All of her dinner suggestions were perfect. The Health Club is very well equipped and a pleasure to use. A fine selection of weights and machines along with treadmills, bikes, ellipticals, and a rower. There is also a pool and very clean locker room. In summary, you won't go wrong at this property. Professionally staffed with outstanding dedication to customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Simply great - loved it”
Reviews.Author: little_birdie18
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for the weekend with my partner and young child for a birthday celebration and this hotel really made our trip. I was apprehensive about travelling with a young child but staff were all really excellent; they anticipated needs, followed up on each and every query, and even printed us out maps to get to local attractions, restaurants, bars and bagel shops :-) Location was great - 10 minutes to Old Montreal and 5 minutes to downtown so we could stroll around for a wander and get 'back to base' quickly during the day (vitally important for little people whose feet get tired very quickly). We took a gamble and paid for an upgrade to a Fairmont Gold Room, and I would not hesitate to do it again - we got a *stunning* (and enormous) room with an incredible bathroom, free beverages (not the alcoholic ones though, mind you) and snacks all day in their wonderful 'Gold' lounge, as well as free breakfast and evening canapes and desserts. Will we be back? My (four year old) child has already asked if we can stay here for their birthday!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: VaniaSmith
Reviews.Content: Very good location, if you want to walk in the city. Check-in and check-out was very easy, the staff was very helpful and professional. The room was smaller than I expected it to be, but enough for two people. Very clean, the cleaning staff prepared some little surprise every night: towels with shapes, candies, etc. The breakfast at the hotel restaurant Le Montrealais was the best I've ever had. Definitely try the Pecan Pie. Convenient access to the underground shopping is also a good thing. The only negative aspects are: the internet service is expensive, there is no free parking and inside the room you can hear what other people talk in the rooms next to you. Other than these, I was very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Gazebo211
Reviews.Content: Excellent service and follow-up from the staff on any request!! Great location, great rooms. The staff was very professional and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Grande Dame - a little bit dated yet still good service and great cocktails”
Reviews.Author: Benodon
Reviews.Content: I stayed for almost a week and was satisfied with the hotel. While I agree that the hotel feels quite dated (even the renovated bits) and some services are ludicrously expensive, it is a good place to stay. The rooms are spacious, staff was firendly and helpful and the location is great. Also try the classic cocktails!

Reviews.Title: “Grand dame still delights”
Reviews.Author: Ivz_travels
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not the funkiest or hippest or the latest in design but most of the time when I travel for work these aspects aren't as important as a good night's sleep and comfortable room. This hotel ticks most of the boxes (comfortable room, nice towels, in-room internet etc) - including a great location. The service is also good; some renovating taking place in the station underneath was reverberating up to my 5th floor room but was quickly offered an older style, larger room on a higher floor when I enquired at the front desk. This doesn't always happen elsewhere! Convenient access to the underground shopping network is also a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: violetvale
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at the QueenE. The location can't be beat--the hotel is literally right above the train station, and the Metro station is a one-minute walk away underground so it's easy to get everywhere, and the old port area is a ten-minute walk away. The rooms are always clean, the bed is wonderful, and there's free wifi if you sign up for the President's Club (sign up is free). Some of the rooms have big windows and wide window ledges where you can sit and just watch the world go by.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly helpful staff, but a little dated”
Reviews.Author: JelmeisterCanada
Reviews.Content: I tend to agree with most of the previous comments. Great location and the staff could not be more helpful, but the rooms are starting to show their age and it is definitely overpriced for the quality of the room. The rooms are clean, but certainly not the usual Fairmont acommodation. You expect a certain standard when you book and pay for the Fairmont name. I was given a room by the elevator, and agree its is very noisy. I was however moved with no fuss, to one of their "best" rooms. It was really just a standard hotel room you would find in any chain hotel. Also I think it is a bit off, charging for Wifi nowadays

Reviews.Title: “We will return soon!”
Reviews.Author: Simlo22
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, couldn't have asked for better! Right downtown a block away from St.Catherine street ideal for shoppers like us. By the way if it's raining, the hotel connects via the underground to all the shopping malls! A few minutes away from Crescent street where we went for dinner, towards the weekend its quite animated in the evening, which is great. It took us 15 minutes to walk from the hotel to Old Montreal. We travel a lot and we loved that hotel. The rooms are not all renovated, bathroom a bit small but what we look for in a hotel is character, charm and of course the service. All staff members were friendly and welcoming! You have to try the restaurant called Montrealais near the lobby. We tried the local Quebec food, the Montreal smoked meat sandwich, couldn't resist the French onion soup...and wait for it.... they have a seafood poutine! Ok I wasn't sure at first but it was good! Back home we run a lot and the concierge at the hotel gave us a running map so we can go explore MountRoyal park. They mentioned there is a running and walking club some days in the morning where staff members take guests around an area of the city to exercise.... we didn't get to try it, they said they only start next week but when we come back we'll try it for sure! Their gym is great.... so different than major hotels who put two pieces of equipment in a small room and they call it a gym. They have a large gym and a pool. Oh don't forget to sign up for their loyalty program to be a member of the club President Fairmont you can do that at the Front desk or online before you get there, it's free to enroll and it gives you free wireless internet access!!

Reviews.Title: “Queen Elizabeth was superb”
Reviews.Author: Marketmiami1
Reviews.Content: I actually stayed more than a year ago for a quick visit to Montreal after a drive up from Vermont. I have family there so I was familiar with the city, but I had never actually stayed in a hotel downtown. I was quite impressed from the moment we pulled up and they kindly helped with the luggage and parked our car. The rooms were quite beautiful, and I especially loved the detail in the black marble bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4* Hotel”
Reviews.Author: C0pey
Reviews.Content: We Stayed at the Queen Elizabeth In April having trvel to Toronto, Ottawa and Quebec, Montreal was our last call. Our Hotel Room at the Queen Elizabeth was the worst and we paid the most for this room out of all the others. It was well past it's sell by date. It was more a 2-3* room and a quoted 4*. It was clean and tidy, but the furinture was old and scratched. The Bathoomneed a re vamp. The sink was all cracked and the tiles on the bathroom floor were chiped uyou had to wear shoes in theire, I used to feel dirted coimg out of the shower that when I 1st went in. The Hotel it's self was OK.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Old Lady”
Reviews.Author: Yanick55
Reviews.Content: Having lived in Montreal many years ago I was very familiar with the Queen Elizabeth but never had the chance to stay there. Of course it was the setting for John and Yoko's bed in and I would have loved to have seen the room they had but unfortunately it was booked the whole time I was there. My stay in Montreal on this occasion was for business purposes and I had to be there for two weeks so staying someplace comfortable was key. What I enjoyed about the hotel were many things, access to the underground city, the bed was very comfortable, the service was exceptional, the room was very clean, the gym had everything you needed, the location is perfect if you want to be in the middle of downtown and the use of the terrycloth bathrobes was great. My minor issues were the size of the room, the outdated television, the high cost of the food and drinks and the fact they froze 3000 on my credit card because I was staying for 12 nights (basically they froze 1800 for my room and an extra 1200 for incidentals) now that would be fine if I was traveling on a company credit card but it was my own and I get reimbursed after so that caught me off guard. I understand this is standard practice but the hotel should inform you when you check in so you don't wonder why you don't have as much credit as you thought on your card. Like I said minor issues but overall it was a wonderful stay and would go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “what a disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: pcalhoun
Reviews.Content: I'm a huge fan of Fairmonts. I have status and everything. Was going to Montreal and decided to stay at the Queen Elizabeth. Being originally from Montreal, I know the location is great, but it is an older hotel. I figured given it is now owned by Fairmont, they would have done a good job of keeping it clean. well... not really. First, the rooms are very small. I believe the bathtub is the original one from when the hotel was constructed, although they had updated the tiles. They had the great Fairmont bathroom products, although the "paper products" were of extremely low quality. Very un-Fairmont like. There was a huge stain on the rug in my room. I mean it was gross. It clearly had been there for a while. When you see dirty rugs, it then makes you wonder whether the rest of the room is being upkept properly. not a good feeling when you are in a hotel ;-). In all fairness, on day two of three I complained. They left me voicemails to ask to move me, but I was out until really late. By the time I got back it was too late to start moving around, as I was leaving the next morning anyhow. at least they tried. The wood work around the window was falling apart. we couldn't quite figure out the heating/cooling system. It was freezing during the day, then hot as all heck at night. What gives?!? The window opens partially, but you are smack downtown, so it gets noisy. Really disappointed. Not going back to that hotel next time I'm in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service but not Great Value”
Reviews.Author: PoorestTourists
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for business for a week in March 2011. The service was great when I checked in and throughout my stay. The service is really a cut above. It was nice to get free wi-fi by signing up for the President's Club (It is free to sign up), and you also get a priority check-in line. The rooms are fine, but not a good value for the price. They are actually quite small, particularly the bathroom. There is no in-room safe, and the tv is older, and positioned too low in the entertainment center to watch correctly from the bed. I also would have expected that with the rate for the hotel, they would have flat-screen tvs, but they don't. Also, I was sort of surprised to see that our ice bucket was dirty and crusted with something. Other than that though the room was quite clean. It's not that the room was bad by any means, but rather that I expected more for the price. I stayed at the Novotel down the street for one night before this, and the rooms there were more spacious (with an in-room safe and flat screen) and it was a fair bit cheaper. The hotel is in a good location--I was there for business so I can't rate the proximity to tourist attractions, but it was within walking distance to the Chinatown area, and there is a train station underneath the hotel (with a nice food court for a quick bite to eat). I would recommend the hotel but it really depends on what you are looking for. If service is important to you, then stay here. If you are looking for a good value or a larger room, stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive to stay for 3.5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: dstr
Reviews.Content: Montreal is my favourite place to relax and have fun. Over the past 5 years, I've almost exclusively stayed at the Fairmont Queen Elizabeth (maybe 50 times all totaled). The room and hall dÃ©cor was somewhat dated, but the service was very good. Over these years, the rates were going up slowly but at an acceptable rate. The past year, I've stayed in a Fairmont View room for $179 Cdn - this was reasonable considering I would usually book 2 weeks in advance. Today I tried booking several dates, from 2 weeks to 7 months away. In all cases, the rates were over $200. Even 6 - 7 months out, all the dates in October and November were $225. They have been updating the rooms over the past few years, but the changes made do not justify the drastic price increase in 2011. I would recommend that you book elsewhere to get a better value 3+ star hotel. I know that this Fairmont Platinum member plans to take his business elsewhere. ps: This is NOT a 4 star (or diamond) hotel. The service is very good, but the property/rooms are not at what I would consider a 4 star level.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Magnificent”
Reviews.Author: Doubleshot_Espresso
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. I was here on business for a convention and this was the hotel of choice. The Queen Elizabeth did not disappoint one bit. The service and staff were superior. Smiles all the time, friendly, helpful, and usually spoke both French and English. Take your pick. The food was great and the wait/service staff were on time and professional. It was as if they could read minds! "More coffee, monsieur?" Housekeeping was the absolute best. The bed was nice and had four comfortable pillows. The thermostat is easily accessible and intuitive. The bathroom literally sparkled. Powerful shower! Towels galore. Tempting snack tray, but pricey! All the usual perks..... What else can I say? For a convention or gathering, this is as good as it gets. I am bringing the family next time. The 15 minute cab ride was $38.00 each way from the airport as mentioned in a previous review.

Reviews.Title: “Not what i thought a 4 or 5 star hotel would be”
Reviews.Author: bab2882
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review before but i feel compelled to inform those who might be interested in staying at the Fairmont hotel about our experience. So we chose this hotel after reading most of the reviews on trip advisor and most of them are true and accurate. We arrived at the hotel, where the valet took our room information and informed us that the bell man would come down and retrieve our luggage and bring it to our room. We were impressed so far, went to our room and were surprised by how small the room was. In addition, though the decorations were new (new shower head, new tv, nice bed) the walls were paper thin. We could hear our neighbors cough next to us. We are from New York and this was a New York City sized room. Not what we expected in Montreal. In addition, given the reputation of the Fairmont hotel, I was expecting the room to be of the same caliber/quality of a Ritz Carlton or a Four Seasons and it was not even close. These two hotels are far more superior in quality, service, room amenities, etc. After checking out our room, we left to see the city. The hotel is in a GREAT location. Centrally located and easy to walk to St. Catherine's street (lots of shopping) and Old City (nice bars and restaurants). We walked around for a while and ate dinner. When we arrived back in our room, we expected to see our luggage but it was not there. We called the bell man who was quite rude. I mentioned that we had checked in over 2 hours ago and expected our luggage to be in our room, instead of being appologetic, sympathetic or anything but defensive he said well how were we supposed to know which luggage is yours, we have numberous bags down here. I explained to him that we provided our room number to valet and he informed us that this information would be passed along to the bellman. I mention the pieces that identify our luggage and the bellman brought our luggage up within 10 mins. We then decided, against the advice of all who have written reviews, to go downstaris to the hotel restaurant and get appetizers and a few drinks. THIS WAS A BIG MISTAKE. The scallop appetizer was COLD and the drinks were not that good, I got a mojito and my husband got a screwdriver....they were not that exotic. I would suggest going to any restaurant in town and you will be more likely to get your moneys worth. Similar to all of the reviews, you can go to any cafe and get breakfast and there are lots of places to go for lunch and dinner. If we are to go back to Montreal, we will not be returning to the Fairmont. I just do not think the hotel was worth the amount of money that it costs.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great service!!!”
Reviews.Author: islandhopper72
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Queen Elizabeth on a Wednesday before check in time. (from the airport, $38 for cab one way) No problem, our room was ready - just what I love to hear! We were placed on the 16th floor and yes, we are here for a Conference! We ended in the newer part of the hotel with updated beds and flat screen TVs and robes. AHHH! Nothing missing here. The coffee Is included in the room, not part of the charged mini bar as one reviewer had stated. GOOD coffee. Yes, the room is smaller than many I have traveled in but this is an older property and we are right in the heart of Montreal! I have stayed in much smaller rooms, you will find I am sure, this room has everything you need. Service from everyone we have met at this hotel has been incredible, helpful, courteous. The elevators are plentiful and are fast. The beds are super comfy and the shower head in our room was just fine (I read some complaints about these). Yes, the bathroom can only fit one person at a time, but I was just grateful to have a bathtub! The rooms for their age have nice furniture and are kept very clean. I get the feeling that staff really do care about doing a nice job. My ONLY real complaint is that the walls are paper thin and if you have partiers next door, you may not get a good night's sleep, earplugs or not! Food in the Hotel is pricey but take a look around, down in the shops below the hotel, so many bakeries!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! We ate apps at Planet Deli one night, it was fine, Happy Hour for drinks was on until 8pm, 2 for 1! Cheap meal! I loved walking around shopping underground and avoiding the cold weather outside, leaving jackets behind in our room! I would stay here again. The suites I have been in here as well are sooo nice - if you can afford to treat yourself - do it!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Internet spotty at times but make sure you sign up for the President's Club before coming here and save on that expense. I would gladly stay here again!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: madeira10
Reviews.Content: Fairmont Gold floor provides impeccable accomodation. Bright, quiet, elegant decor, spotless. Superb dining experience at the Beaver Club. Polished service, great menu, creative cooking. A must. Excellent location in the heart of city. We have stayed at the Q.E. for many years. Never a disappointment. Great product, great consistency. The best of Fairmont Hotels. On a par with the Fairmont Monte-Carlo, Savoy London or The Plaza, New-York properties.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, a bit small”
Reviews.Author: hockeyparent33
Reviews.Content: We stayed in late March. The hotel is in a great location, we were able to walk to Old Montreal, the Bell Center and its atop numerous shops and restaurants. Our only complaint was that even with upgrading to a jr suite, our room still felt small. The staff and service was great and always met our needs. The bar and restaurant are expensive, if you just want a meal, head below ground. We'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience in years”
Reviews.Author: AMMJK
Reviews.Content: This is NOT a four star hotel. The room was dirty and substandard with dust-caked curtains, a blood-stained sheet, a broken hairdryer and ripped tablecloth for room service. Despite our request for a quiet room, we were placed on a packed corridor, and kept awake all night by television noise through paper-thin walls until 4:00 A.M. This is in sharp contrast to the outstanding staff who were very friendly and helpful, We have stayed in Montreal a number of times, but have never had such a bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: ClaudeJames
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week for a conference like the previous reviewer. Had a room with a (very, very comfortable) queensize bed on a high floor, looking straight down the boulevard, which had the most stunning views, particularly at night. This is a great hotel - it carries its grand history without being up itself. The service is immaculate, the rooms (at least the one I stayed in) very well appointed and spacious. The public areas are beautifully presented and could swallow about half a conference of 5000 people without ever feeling crowded (unlike the Sheraton down the road which felt like rush hour on the Lodon Underground). The food is very good too, and room service is well presented and prompt. For someone from the UK, the hotel is amazing value - you'd be very lucky to get a room this size, as well furnished, with such good views in a comparable city for double the price. I wasn't troubled by an inadequately sized showerhead, but perhaps didn't look closely enough.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was great about this hotel, but some room elements could use updating”
Reviews.Author: psprof
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights for a conference and received a discounted conference rate for the room. I stayed in a single king size bed with a view of the cathedral, and I signed up for the President's club membership before making my booking. You should sign up for the president's club because you get some benefits like free internet. The hotel service was excellent. I never had any problems with the staff or service and they always honored my requests for room cleaning and any other issues at the front desk. Check-in was very easy and fast. I had in-room dining for breakfast once and it was absolutely fantastic. I loved the pancake rolls with maple butter. They were great. The location is excellent, primarily because of the distance to the central train station, shopping and food underground, as well as being central to the downtown area. It is a little bit of a trip either via metro or taxi to some of the nicer, more local, French eateries, however, the convenience of this hotel cannot be outmatched. There is an elevator in the hotel that takes you down to the sub-basement level where you can find all kinds of Montreal's best foods, breads, breakfasts, and coffee places. If you do a bit of walking from the central station, you can get to the shopping mall for any clothing or gifts. I had absolutely no problems with the sleep quality in the room, but when I first arrived, the sheets seemed a bit like plastic. I am not sure if this is due to perhaps the room not being used in a while because it seemed to be fine after the first night. The only things that bothered me a little where the lamps, the TV, and the shower-head. The shower-head is one of those really cheap ones you find in very inexpensive business hotels. Perhaps I am a bit spoiled, but I would like to see this updated. In addition, the TV is old and flickers, which is not a big problem for me since I didn't use it much. The lamps also sometimes didn't go on when I flicked the switches on them. I think they are just old.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what you expect in a hotel for business travel”
Reviews.Author: FlyingDutchman42
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont is a comfortable hotel in the Montreal city center. Rooms are quite, bed comfortable, pillows ample. Wi-Fi and Internet are free if you are a member of the "President's Club," which is reason enough to join. The hotel bar is nice, and makes a point of its "classic" cocktails, which are in fact very good. Food in the "bistro" restaurant, which is where they serve breakfast (not included in my rate, but I ate there anyway), is no better than average, and like all such places absurdly expensive. There are, alas no convenient breakfast alternatives within easy walking distance of the hotel. Still, I felt no more gouged than I usually do on these occasions. My only complaint is a generic one: like nearly all hotels that provide a desk in the room for working at a computer, they FAIL to provide an adjustable chair that will allow you to do such work comfortably. Why is a complete mystery.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated old lady...”
Reviews.Author: HicEtNunc
Reviews.Content: Good city view from our Fairmont king room (1366), although the room itself was shoebox-sized, and its bathroom so small that two people cannot possibly share it. At 25$ apiece, the buffet breakfast at the Montrealais restaurant was under par... Service is very good, though, except for quite a rude server at the hotel bar... Parking is expensive @ 28$ per day

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: gabbygrrl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the weekend and were very pleased! The location could not be better for exploring the city. We went down to the train station (directly connected to the hotel, although you do have to change elevators) for breakfast, snacks and some beverages to take back to our room. It was nice being able to walk the Underground malls and shopping without having to go outside. The room was spacious (we had a Junior Suite) and comfortable. We could hear the neighbors well into the evening, which made one night a bit of a pain. Otherwise, pretty quiet. We enjoyed the spa one morning for wonderful pedicures and foot massages. The prices were average and we left feeling refreshed. However the Spa area is cramped, more like a maze of meeting rooms instead of an open, inviting space. The downside of this property was the service. It was passive at best. The President's Club check in was exceptional and friendly, but other than that, it was poor service all the way around. We had to wait 10 minutes for a bellman when we arrived. The valet took our info and walked off to talk to the other 3 guys, just standing around. I had to go over and ask for luggage help. He called, said it would be a few minutes, and walked away. They talked about coworkers and their managers behavior, all while standing right near us. One night of our visit we met some friends down at the Bar for a few drinks after dinner. The service was horrible! It seemed like they were annoyed that we were there. With only our table plus another table, you would think they would trip over themselves to make us happy. Not so. We actually had to get up and go get them in order to have another round. Once again, the 4 waiters stood at the corner of the bar and chatted about their weekend activities while we were waving and trying to get their attention in order to get a menu. Our bill was over $150 for drinks and we were not even thanked for coming in. We ended up going across the street to the Keg Steakhouse and Bar-fantastic food and drinks and wonderful, friendly service. Highly recommend!! All in all, a good stay in a great location. Is it a "true" Fairmont? No. Not even close to the service at the Boston Battery Wharf location, or the Lake Louise or Banff hotels. But it's nice, comfortable and a step up from other options. If you get a good deal, take it. But I wouldn't go with the expectation of being pampered. It's just not going to happen.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Old Elegance - Great staff.”
Reviews.Author: RickyH1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend with friends to see the hockey game. Third visit to the property and it is nice, clean, and has an "old elegance" to it. We got a good deal so I was pleased with the value since upscale hotels in Montreal are not cheap! The bathroom was a bit dated, but other than that - no complaints. It's right over the main train station (no noise) and an underground shopping complex so it's very convenient to most downtown Montreal venues. Staff is very attentive and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, central location, large and conference oriented.”
Reviews.Author: Knickerbocker001
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend with friends and found it to be a very pleasant experience. Rooms are a bit small but overall the hotel was atractive, clean, and centrally located. Service was great and there were many ammenities. The hotel does have a business feel, clearly catering to conferences.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm right downtown”
Reviews.Author: merlin888
Reviews.Content: We've never gone wrong with Fairmont hotels. They are beautifully appointed, the lobbies are grand and the service is second to none. The added bonus is this hotel can be accessed by the train station and you can walk through the underground shopping mall right into the downtown main street. The breakfast buffet is definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for train”
Reviews.Author: Canberra_Traveller
Reviews.Content: We were travelling by train from Quebec City to Toronto and decided to stop overnight at the Fairmont Queen Elizabeth. This hotel is right on top of the main train station and a two minute walk up the escalators. We arrived at 11am and took a 3 hour city tour booked through the concierge and a good way to get an overview of Montreal. Pickup is at the door. Our junior suite had a rooftop view, was compact but nicely decorated and well priced for this time of year. Had a drink in the cocktail bar downstairs - the barman was grumpy and the menu in the restaurant was not inspirational so opted to eat at Beaver Hall, a delightful bistro serving regional food just two blocks away - recommended by the concierges. Next day we took the escalator down for our train to Toronto. Our overnight stay was very enjoyable due to the hotel's convenience to the station, the underground mall and it's concierge service which took care of everything we needed at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Price of the room should include coffee”
Reviews.Author: yolande_10
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed a w.end at this Hotel,and I could not beleive that at the price they charge they put the coffee maker and the coffee as part of the mini bar!come on,most hotel,leave the coffee maker and the coffee free of charge in the room!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, great price”
Reviews.Author: dtokio
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fairmont Friday & Saturday night. Went for a Canadians/Toronto hockey game. Fairmont is about a ten minute walk from the Bell Centre and about 10 minute walk to St. Catherines were all there is good shopping and restaurants. As we arrived by train from Toronto this was the perfect hotel because the hotel is part of the train station so you go up 2 escalators and your in the lobby. We paid $120 a night and the lady behind me in line was paying $229.00 so if you don't mind looking around on the internet you can definitely save some $$. Our room was right behind the elevator shaft so all night long it sounded as if cars were going by. Just a dull "swoosh" that doesn't keep you awake but when you do awake and wonder where you are you can hear it. Try not to use the phones as a 10 minute long distance call to ontario was about $17.00. They also charge for local calls which I think is kind of tacky but I guess like any business they have to make it wherever they can. On a positive note this location is also good if you don't want to go out of the hotel as the 2 stage elevator will take you to the station level where ther are about a dozen restaurants including a Timmy's, Second cup & Cinnabon. There is also a liquor store down there. At the far end of the train station there is a "depaneur" ( convenience store) where you can get snacks, beer , wine, magazines, etc. If you want to go out to eat I recommend Wienstein and Gavinos on Crescent, ( about 20 minute walk). Good atmosphere, fair prices, good food. ( not fine dining. )

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location for train traveler”
Reviews.Author: GranBeba
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights at the end of a week's trip to Canada. I must admit that I might be influenced by the superb hotel we had come from in Quebec City (Auberge St. Antoine) so that might have altered my perception of the hotel. The location was perfect for us arriving by train. We just had to take the escalator upstairs without going out into the cold and snow. The hotel is very large! Our room, on the otherhand was small. It was down a long and narrow hallway that seemed endless. But the room was very clean and well equipped. The bathroom is also small but quite nice and the toilletries are VERY nice. I have two complaints. One is that the soundproofing between rooms is not good. We could hear conversations in the next room after we got in bed at night. It was as though the people were in the room with us! The other is that the concierge seems not to be well informed about some information he was giving us. He gave wrong informatip\on about when shops opened on Sunday. But what really upset us was that he told us that the antique shops on "Antique Alley" were open for regular business hours on Monday and we took a taxi out there and found ourselves on a cold and snowy street far from our hotel where most all the shops were CLOSED on Monday! A big disappointment and a big hassle to get back to the hotel later. We did have a very good rate with buffet breakfast included. No complaints there. I would recommend this hotel,with reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Grand dame is showing age”
Reviews.Author: Juhwawa
Reviews.Content: I had been looking forward to my stay but ultimately was disappointed. The hotel is showing it's age. My room was small but adequate but showed some water stains and the door needed paint. My colleague had a shower with the expanded shower curtain but mine did not. Not a fairmont experience overall. One more small point was there was only 1 clerk to checkin for the regular folks like myself whereas their loyalty club had two. Unfortunately our line was a lot longer. I noticed this a few times. Beautiful lobby tho so you aren't bored watching the flood of people.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: FromToronto2011
Reviews.Content: From the President's Club check-in to upgraded room to comfortable bed and no hassle check-out, I could not ask for more. Beaver Club on main floor was perfect! I enjoyed the Beaver Clubâ€™s famous roast prime rib of beef au jus, Emile Jung sauce along with the trology of Creme Brule. The service could not be any more attentive!

Reviews.Title: “That's Disgusting!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bobobarley
Reviews.Content: I've attended the same ski show for about thirt years now. This was my first star at the Queen E. It was also my last. I arrived late and I arrived tired. I should have left. I didn't. There were three stains on the carpet, I hope they were ketchup. The toilet was not flushed from the previous guest. I am not at all queezy, but this simply turned my stomach. Can you imagine?

Reviews.Title: “Love it here!”
Reviews.Author: lushiousnorth
Reviews.Content: We've always gotten great service and nice rooms. Love the view of Mount Royal or the church next door. We stopped in the bar lounge "Les Voyageurs" for a couple cocktails before going out. I had the amazing sake, vodka and cucumber martini known as "Yoko Fresh". Liked it so much I had three! Our bartender Daniel was friendly and personable and gave us great service. My wife had the pomegranate cucumber mojito and loved that. Nice place to grab a drink and listen to some live piano.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special, Nothing Horrible”
Reviews.Author: PlatoPutas
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Fairmont Queen Elizabeth didn't exceed my expectations, and also didn't disappoint. It was a nice hotel, but didn't blow me away. My room was slightly smaller than average although it was clean and with a slightly more modern decor than a typical Fairmont. My one gripe is with the toilet. It's basically the kind of toilet you'd find in a public bathroom, with a flush that's located under the counter and hard to get to. I do enjoy the Miller Harris citron toiletries, so that is a plus. Overall I'd rather be more centrally located to the main downtown area or closer to Old Montreal. It was fine for business travel and a short trip, but if I was visiting for vacation with the same budget, I'd likely go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: CANTriTraveller
Reviews.Content: Great location and service. The morning running group with the hotel employees were a great way for the active travellers to experience the city and the extensive running paths.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms that are well used”
Reviews.Author: ThoughtfulTraveler05
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located if you take the train, connected directly to the train station without having to go outside which is always a plus with the usually poor Montreal weather, But most of the rooms are small at 225 sf so it,you really need to upgrade. reasonable food choices are available in the area below at the train station or in Place Ville Marie. Check min as a Presidents Club member is efficient and quick. The Gold floor lounge is very nice and the rooms are much better if you can afford

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: fmtavar
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here for NYE celebration; the location is perfect check-in was a breeze, staff were amazing, the pool was great, and the maid was aaamazing! I wouldn't eat at this location and I found there bar to be kind of lame and dated however, there is a great bar at the Sheraton just down the street. DO NOT PARK here - I think they charge $28 per night -- take a short drive to the BMO and there is underground parking there for about $15 per night. They biggest bother about my stay here was the WIFI; there's a charge of about $15 for $25hrs of WIFI. I've stayed at three star properties that offer free WIFI. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good Service, BUT...”
Reviews.Author: DDatYVR
Reviews.Content: Check-in was very smooth and as a President's Club member, internet access that would have cost $13+ a day was complimentary. Service was excellent as with all Fairmont properties. Location of hotel was excellent as it was connected to the underground corridors to Place Ville Marie and Gare Centrale. However, the king-sized room that was supposed to have been recently renovated was tired and musky. Carpets were worn and the walls could have used a fresh coat of paint. Hotel walls were thin as I could hear my neighbour taking a shower and drying his/her hair at 1 a.m. The bathroom fixtures were old and tarnished; while I'm sure the cleaning crew did a fantastic job, there is only so much you can do to spruce up 50+ year old taps and knobs. There was little water pressure for the shower. Sink and shower drainage could also be more efficient. The hotel is functional overall, but is not a place that I would write home about. I will stay again just so that I don't have to walk outside in the winter to my office building. However, come summer, I might defect to some place more modern.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minute of it”
Reviews.Author: happycamper57201
Reviews.Content: Was able to upgrade to the Gold floor and worth every penny. Had dinner at the Beaver club and enjoyed the excellent service. It made our stay very memorable. The hotel is beautiful in the winter, a magical place.

Reviews.Title: “Relatively expensive old fashioned Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Canadianknowitall
Reviews.Content: Convenient if you are taking the train as I did to Montreal as the hotel is accessed directly from the station. Check-in was very good, though I had booked a King size bedded room only to be given a room with two beds in it as none were available. In spite of the two beds in it, It was just big enough for one so I would think it would be very tight with two. The TV was very last century as was the room, though clean,bright and well lit. The bathroom was spotless and the shower pressure excellent and water heat comfortably adjustable. The bed was comfortable but nothing to write home about. Unfortunately one can hear all the comings and goings on in the hallway as other guests close or open their room doors and surprisingly for such a prestigious hotel, no one has thought of soundproofing the door closing and locking mechanisms. The housekeeping staff are also a noisy lot starting at about 8am yelling at each other down the hallways like fishwives. God forbid that one would want to sleep in. Breakfast prices are as usual ridiculous. $17.00 for a bun or whatever ,a juice and a coffee or $24.50 for what seemed to me when I checked it out,a mediocre looking buffet/trough in the Montrealais bistro. There are lots of places for coffee and food right next door in the station and for mucht less and as the hotel charges $15.00 for Internet (shame on them!) you can surf the internet for free at several of the station cafes that I went to for coffee. The location is wonderful for anywhere you want to get to in Montreal and I would qualify my recommendation to stay at this hotel by saying it would only deserve a maximum two night stay at a discounted rate. Any longer and you can do much better elsewhere for less money (Delta,Gouverneurs) or for pretty much the same d rates classy luxury boutiques such as The Nelligan,The Vogue,The Saint-Sulpice...etc.

Reviews.Title: “Tired looking room, no free internet or bottled water...Toto I don't think I am at a Starwood Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Papa
Reviews.Content: I did not book the hotel but was looking for the stay anyway since I heard a lot of great things. Check in was quick, efficient, and very friendly. I was on the 20th floor in Queen bed room. The room was clean but looked very dated and tired. The furniture definitely could use a bit of polish and chairs need to come out of the 80's. My first disappointment was no free internet. $ 15 for skyping my kids back home. I did sleep well. The bed and the pillow was comfortable and slept almost immediately. The heat was a problem. Turned the heat all the way up but didn't change the temperature. It wasn't until I left the room the next morning that I noticed the hall way was a lot warmer than my room. But I did not freeze my bum but then again my wife complaints I am very 'cold blooded' and tolerate a cold room than most people! ;0 The other disappointment was when I woke up in the morning, I realized there wasn't any bottle water other than a $8 Evian bottle. So it was the tap water with a mug. The shower and sink was so, so. Again very tired looking and need a refurbishment. The gym was spacious and I really enjoy it. With 10 people in the gym, it did not feel cramp and I like to lemon water. The equipment was good and enjoyed my morning run. Other than the tired room, the Fairmont was a decent hotel and staff was friendly and efficient. All pluses in my books. My problem was that my expectations where not managed and I realize how I am use to the free internet and bottled waters that Starwood would provide. It is the little things that made me pause but then again aren't the little things that would make people come back?

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place for a romantic weekend”
Reviews.Author: MSensor
Reviews.Content: My wife and booked a long weekend getaway to Montreal through Amtrak Vacations for our anniversary. The Queen Elizabeth was one of the options available to us, so after looking through the reviews, we decided to get it. We weren't disappointed. First, the location couldn't be more convenient. The hotel is connected to Montreal Central Station by means of escalator and elevator, so getting from the train to the hotel was as easy as walking down the hall. Also, the hotel connects to Montreal's vast underground city, of which Central Station is a part, meaning a quick elevator ride takes you to a vast array of shops, cafes, and restaurants, as well as the Montreal subway system. Turning to the hotel itself, when we arrived, we learned that due to a slight mix-up, Amtrak Vacations booked us a queen room instead of a king room. My wife is 6 1/2 months pregnant and a bed that small wasn't an option, so I asked for a king. We were pleased tp learn that for only $50 more a night, we could be upgraded to the concierge level (the "Gold" level), which we jumped at. We weren't disappointed. The room was fantastic, with a postcard-perfect view of the skyline and Mary Queen of the World Basilica. Access to the Gold Lounge on the next floor above came with the price of admission, which offered breakfast in the morning, snacks all day, and apertifs and desserts in the evening, not to mention the most comfortable couches I've sat in in a long time overlooking the city. The concierges - both upstairs and down in the main lobby - couldn't have been more helpful. On our first night my wife needed a bandage because she ripped a small hangnail, so I called down to ask if they had one. Not only was someone up within 3 minutes with a bandage, but they also asked if we needed a doctor... no, but I'm glad they asked! Similarly, every staff member we encountered was unfailingly polite and courteous. The room was very comfortable, although the bathroom was a tad cramped, which seems to be a problem with a lot of hotels. Comfort-wise, the bed was great, especially after a long train trip from Delaware, and we had no problems with outside noise. The hotel has a number of restaurants as well as the Beaver Club lounge & bistro. We had a great dinner at the Le Montrealais bistro as well as a room-service dinner on our last night. Surprisingly, the room service menu wasn't too high, although the minibar prices came close to highway robbery (CDN$ 5 for a Toblerone bar? CDN $8.50 for a bottle of Evian water? Yikes!). Little known but interesting fact: John Lennon and Yoko Ono's famous "Bed-In", where "Give Peace a Chance" was recorded, took place at The Queen Elizabeth in 1969. Turned out we were one floor above where it all happened. Surprisingly, the hotel does not market this fact very much. I had to look up the hotel's Wikipedia page to find it out.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Weswee
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 separate nights at the Queen Elizabeth going to and coming back from Quebec city. We travelled by train and therefore the Queen E could not be more convenient, being right above the train station. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Our rooms were small but spotlessly clean and fairly modern. The first night our room faced the church and was nice and quiet. However, the second night our room faced Rene Levesque Blvd and was very noisy. We could hear trains, sirens and traffic all night. We were impressed that, even though we arrived for the second night at 10:45 a.m., our room was ready and we were allowed to check in. Food at the bar and at the Montrealais was very good but pricey. All in all,we were very impressed and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: drbex999
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and got an upgrade to a superior room. There was a nice amount of space, very clean and quiet. Bar area is nice and the staff all friendly. Restaurant was OK but would eat out next time. I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: drlhbl
Reviews.Content: We decided to take a little overnight getaway to Montreal. I booked the hotel through Expedia. What a great decision! This hotel was so convenient to everything! The underground city/Metro is an elevator ride down from the beautiful lobby. It was fantastic service from the minute we walked through the door until the minute we left. The only complaints we have were that there were no phone books in the rooms and the tub drain had an issue. All in all it was a fabulous stay. The room was gorgeous with a great view.

Reviews.Title: “4 class maybe but not 5 class”
Reviews.Author: dutchgirl54
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel in the old world style but a bit impersonal. The rooms are smallish but adequete. Decor is tasteful but not luxurious as you might expect from a 5 star hotel. Room service is prompt but the food is expensive. Would have loved the empty tissue box to be replaced. Generally a 4 star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated, overpriced, worn and torn.”
Reviews.Author: ted3000
Reviews.Content: Stayed on way to cruise departure from Quebec City as hotel is located above the train station. Check in was tedious and slow, finally was assigned Room 421 which was a large room located next to the coke and ice machines, which were very noisy. We changed rooms, more hassle, and was assigned Room 474 a smaller room with paper thin walls, torn towels and a small bathroom. The hallways lack cleaning as dust and debris are evident thruout. Rather disappointing experience, Fairmont should take its' name off this place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Concierge Service”
Reviews.Author: kwylee
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights at this hotel over the summer. We had a junior suite room -- since we also had our infant son and five year old with us. The staff were friendly, polite, and extra helpful. The concierge helped us numerous times - mostly with restaurant recommendations. The room was nice enough, but seemed crowded. It had too much furniture in it for the size. Also, we had requested a non-smoking room. After the second night, we woke up to a STRONG smell of cigarette smoke which had wafted from an adjacent floor. They promptly moved us to another room. The pool was fun for the kids -- they have a whirlpool as well as a kiddie pool. The lobby adjacent to the gym/pool offers complimentary fresh fruit.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: habel_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Fairmont Room. Room and bathroom was fine, it could use a bit so called spring cleaning. For a 4 star hotel we did not expect stained carpet, lose wallpaper and the grime around the doorknobs. Be aware of the goodybasket, a bottle of water is $8.50. Overall the hotel was nice. We chose the location because of the train-station. Next time we will stay closer to the old-port. After walking all day, it is a long walk back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch”
Reviews.Author: Palpatine
Reviews.Content: Not the trendiest hotel, can get a bit busy but treat yourself to the gold floor and you will get to experience what excellence in service should be- I have spent over 30 nights here between 2009 and 2010 and Ben the gold floor head concierge and his team are the most genuine and dedicated team I have ever met- I have not been travelling as often to Montreal lately and I miss the good service and the genuine welcome from the gold floor team-

Reviews.Title: “Rest, Relax, Fun”
Reviews.Author: MOMSUPREME
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay in this luxurious hotel. Lots to do in the hotel (health club and swimming pool) and lots to do within walking distance. Can't wait to do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: smlear
Reviews.Content: Myself & my husband stayed at Fairmont The Queen Elizabeth in Montreal last December during Christmas & New Year's. The location was excellent; within easy walking distance to restaurants & the Old Port. The underground city was great to access everything without having to go outside. The hotel staff were very helpful in providing information to any questions we had regarding restaurants, etc.. I would recommend staying at this hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Elegance”
Reviews.Author: globaltraveller58
Reviews.Content: Appearances can be deceptive. On the outside, this is an ugly brown slab with an unpleasant entrance. Inside,The Queen Elizabeth Fairmont is a lovely, gracious and elegant hotel with over half-a-century of excellent service. From the spacious old-fashioned lobby to the wonderful elderly serving-staff in the quaint restuarant, the whole place exudes the warmth, welcome and hospitality of a bygone era. I loved it. Service is inconsistent - ranging from barely satisfactiry to excellent. The best part of The Queen Elizabeth Fairmont is that the original architecture and many pieces of the original furniture have been carefully preserved and cherished. the location is also extremely convenient, with direct access below to the train-station and underground city. Parking, however, is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “DonÂ´t go!”
Reviews.Author: Adventure2Stockholm
Reviews.Content: When thinking about Fairmont, one expects a high level of service and a comfortable hotel. My stay was nothing but that. The room was very little, old, dusty and stinky, with no safety box. The worst experience was the breakfast room, long lines every morning, no clean cups, glasses nor plates, many of the items on the buffet were finished. The friendly staff tried to do their very best but the system cannot manage the huge amount of hotel guests. Check-out was not so nice either with an angry receptionist at the front desk. My stay was a total disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “The real deal on the John Lennon suite...”
Reviews.Author: gaoliya
Reviews.Content: If he were alive today, I am quite certain he'd NEVER stay there! The room is cool for its pictures, newsclippings, a great view (especially at night), the bed is very comfortable and it comes with his Greatest Hits CD but the bathroom is TINY, the carpet is GRUNGY, there's a kitchenette that makes no sense (not furnished with anything - just some empty cupboards and a minibar - good thing we brought our own plastic forks when we picked up dinner - and it's bigger than the bathroom - why not use the space for more luxurious facilities?). There's a TV in each of the bedroom and in the sitting room but they are circa 1986 tube TVs that are tucked inside a cupboard - not good for easy viewing and barely any English stations (I live in Montreal so I know these are available and I'd hazard to guess that most Lennon fans that would stay here are Anglophones). I understand the idea of keeping its "retro" style but nothing in that room is original (or in any way resembling anything from 1969) anymore anyway so why not update? I'm a big John Lennon fan, I did not pay for this room (it was a gift) but, at $699/night, I would surely have been ANGRY if I had! The service was mediocre. We arrived at 3:47 (check in is 4) and were told we'd have to wait for our room (come ON! - we finally got in way past 4) and were (politely) refused late check out . The porter brought our bags up and was very polite. Breakfast the next morning wes decent (we had the buffet at Montrealais which was included in our gift). The whole hotel gives you a bit of a grungy feeling - nothing feels clean and even though the 17th floor is a non-smoking floor, we could still smell smoky carpets, smoky walls where ever we went in the hotel. Needs new carpets and a few cans of paint. The only really great thing about this hotel is the location but my husband and I both agree that the boutique hotels are the way to go in Montreal. Le Germain is just a five minute walk away and if we were to spend another night in our home city at a hotel, it would be that or the Sofitel which also has a great location. The Fairmont is not what it once was and the QE Montreal is the worst!

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Queen Elizabeth”
Reviews.Author: eatnomeat
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in August with my husband and three kids (all under 6). I found the front desk staff to be the friendliest hotel staff I've ever encountered. Check in and out was very fast and I loved that valet parking was manditory. The pool was very nice as well. The only problem we had with the Queen Elizabeth was the small size of our room- too small for a family. However, the helpfulness of the staff made up for it- we had no idea that the Biodome was on strike all summer and that was our big event we had planned for the kids- but the concierge gave us a map and made some great suggestions for family activities downtown and we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, overrated, very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: JustATraveller07
Reviews.Content: Checked in at 1pm but obviously the room wasn't ready. Returned at 4pm but the room still wasn't ready. Checked in again at 5:15 only to be told that the room was ready at 4:15, but noone told us. We booked the Junior Suite and overall it was hugely disappointing. Normally we never spend this kind of money on a hotel but family recommended the Fairmont. The hotel in general sorely needs renovating. The decor is awful and very worn. The carpets and some sofas in the lobby are filthy and disgusting. The room was the same; badly in need of renovating. The bath was so old it was stained yellow with use and age. I refused to bathe my daughter in it. The furniture was way too big (and ugly!) and negated staying in a two room suite with a sofa bed. The main bed was actually quite comfortable. A couple of staff on the front desks (registration and concierge) were obnoxious and annoying. I never once felt like the staff cared about having me as a "guest". I was just another lemming staying in a room, paying my expensive bill. Yes, the hotel was vastly overpriced I thought considering the poor state of the hotel. We didn't try the restaurant as it was too expensive for us. $35 for breakfast? No thanks.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay during a wonderful trip”
Reviews.Author: NanaimoKyla
Reviews.Content: Had a fabulous weekend in Montreal and part of what made it great was staying in the lovely Fairmont Queen Elizabeth. Spacious room, comfy bed, extremely knowledgeable and helpful staff who made us feel very welcome. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Did Not Like”
Reviews.Author: thestubesyvr
Reviews.Content: Usually when I travel to Montreal I like to stay at the Sheraton Versailles which I find excelelnt. But this trip was for meetings/show and the Fairmont was the hotel picked. I will not return to the Fairmont for several reasons. My room (404) was extremely small. Smaller than most hotel rooms. Bathroom also small. The furniture and carpet of the hotel is out-dated. No wireless internet in the room (only cable). They charge $16/day for internet but if you sign up to Fairmont Club (free to join) you get free internet. Even though we were in a non-smoking room/floor there was a constant smoke smell. There are much better places to stay in Montreal and less expensive. I do have a couple of postive comments. I found the staff very friendly and helpful and the location of the hotel is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont the Queen Elizabeth is Montreal.”
Reviews.Author: nkm61
Reviews.Content: Traveled with children and teen grandchildren to Montreal for the week-end. We had stayed at the Queen over 20 years ago...we loved it then and loved it even more this time. From check-in to check out the staff constantly provided everything we needed to make this too-short stay memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: NovaCath
Reviews.Content: Stayed during the Montreal Jazz Festival for 6 nights. Booked the Fairmont Summer Sale so we got a good room rate and $50 in dining credit for 3 days. Used the dining credit for dinner one night and for the breakfast buffet on two mornings. Thought the food was very good, I am a Fairmont President Club member (free to join) so Internet (wired in the room; wireless in the lobby) was free. Room was clean and bed was comfortable. Even though I booked the cheapest category, the room was not too small. Beside a desk with a chair, there was another chair with a separate foot rest in the room, which was nice to not have to sit on the bed in order to watch TV or read. The location is great. It is above the VIA station, which has a large food court and access to the Metro. Airport bus stops across the street and the bus to Old Montreal runs on the street in front of the hotel. Was within walking distance to the site of the Jazz Festival and the McCord Museum. Old Montreal is within walking distance. Too much walking can cause pain in my knee so taking the bus to Old Montreal let me do more walking there. We went to Old Montreal several times to see Cirque du Soleil, the Pointe-A-Calliere (Montreal Museum of Archaeology and History), which has an Easter Island exhibit, and to take a boat tour from the Quays of the Old Port. We took the Metro to see the excellent Miles Davis exhibit at the Montreal Museum of Fine Arts on a Sunday and their Metro has much better Sunday service compared to where I live,

Reviews.Title: “World be a great hotel if reserved rooms were available at a reasonable hour”
Reviews.Author: drgmobile
Reviews.Content: I've always been a big fan of the Fairmont Queen Elizabeth but this trip was a glaring exception. I arrived to check in at 12:30 pm on a Sunday. There was a mix-up with my reservation, which they fixed but said my room wasn't clean yet. They said they would put a rush on it. We didn't get our room until 5:15 pm. At 4 they gave me a temporary room -- the living room of a suite on a smoking floor. But we had wanted to relax and get ready for the evening hours before and we wanted to get into our room before heading out for the evening.
