The turn of events meant we were hours late in catching up with our friends. Information was sorely lacking. The hotel never was able to predict when the room would be cleaned. Somebody really should have come from behind the counter and consulted somebody on housekeeping to deal with the matter. On this day other people were waiting for rooms well into the late afternoon. Clearly the hotel does not have enough housekeeping staff required to provide guests with fresh rooms within a reasonable amount of time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: marker19
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, (Nice Big room 20th floor) Great Service. (Greast concierge serice as well) Can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Instant Karma?”
Reviews.Author: PhileasFoggontour
Reviews.Content: Over the years Iâ€™ve stayed many times at the Reine Elizabeth. I donâ€™t think I would ever describe any one of those stays as perfect, but I still keep coming back. Firstly Montreal in the summer is a glorious place to be. I cannot remember enjoying a trip to the city more. Perhaps itâ€™s all those months of frozen weather that encourages people to be out and about in the summer, but there really is a buzz to the place. My tip would be to head beyond the downtown and up to streets like Duluth where youâ€™ll find excellent places to eat. Note that many places are â€˜bring your own bottleâ€™ a result of the high local taxes for licensed restaurants. As for the hotel it does have a personality to it. Some hotels are just hotels, but perhaps during their bed-in John and Yoko left some karma floating around the place. I also recommend the Gold floors. With all the little extras, plus the views from the lounge and your own elevator it does feel like a hotel within the hotel. You can also get some very good deals directly from Fairmont; mine included a $50 a day Food and Beverage credit. The rooms, at least on the Gold Floor are spacious, and pleasant. Not the most modern, letâ€™s call it classic. For me the Fairmont has three problems; details, some of the staff, and the awful parking. To address each in turn: Details: There was a nice new flat screen TV placed inside the armoire, but no matter how much you turned it was just too large to see from the bed, and one part of the screen would be obscured by the wooden doors. The covered area also included the remote sensor so you couldnâ€™t operate the TV from the bed. I know Quebec is a French speaking area, but the selection of English language stations is on the thin side. One piece of soap? Yes, one piece of soap that I had to move carefully between the sink and the bath. It just lasted the three nights of my stay. The air conditioner was noisy. If you pressed on the cover it would stop for a while, but you would have thought that one of the room attendant might have had someone look at it a long time ago. When I checked in the staff gave me the key to my room on the floor below. There was no offer to escort me to the room. Of course the electronic key didnâ€™t work so I had to retrace my steps to the front desk. A new key was programmed and I was sent on my way again. This one worked, and there was a follow-up call to make sure that I had managed to get into the room. My suggestion â€“ if the programmed key doesnâ€™t work go with the guest to ensure that they are using it correctly, and to ensure that the reprogrammed key does function. Room Service: Poor and expensive. Presentation was also not a high point (a Club Sandwich seemingly tipped onto a plate with some soggy fries). However it did arrive quickly. The Staff: Some of the staff tries very hard, and some of them donâ€™t. Staying on the Club Floor I wanted to leave my luggage (I couldnâ€™t get an extra 30 minutes extension on the room) with them. Although the luggage could be stored on the Club Floor theyâ€™d rather have it placed in the main luggage room â€˜as they werenâ€™t always at the deskâ€™. Frankly I thought that the point of having the â€˜Clubâ€™ experience was to provide that extra level of service. In the Beaver Club (always an experience, sometime positive, sometimes not) I was â€˜attendedâ€™ by a clearly long serving employee â€“ Iâ€™ve seen him before - who really managed to mess some pretty basic things up. To allow me to try the bottle of wine I had ordered he poured a complete glassful (despite my protestations) into a glass that still had the residue of my aperitif in. I did get a discount on the bottle of wine, but it was a terrible waste. For two of the courses I was warned that the plates were â€˜very hotâ€™ and they were. One of them would have served duty as a pizza stone. I did ask the Matrieâ€™D if such a hot plate might not be a bad idea for the rather delicate Black Cod upon it. Perhaps I was thinking that it had been sitting for a long time under those heating lamps? His response was that the kitchen was a long way from the dining room and as a result patrons had complained in the past about the food being cold, hence the too hot to touch plates. He did at least respond to the problems that I raised, but I do think that the restaurant continues to go downhill. Also the excellent lady sommelier is gone. The wine list is still good however, if not cheap and lacking any real choice in half bottles. Itâ€™s easy to run up a pretty good tab in the Beaver Club as well; the standards could be better. Again the details suffer - the cutlery is also clunky for some of the smaller (sashimi for example) dishes. The restaurant is only open on three nights of the week, which suggests it is not doing very well. The other options in the hotel are very limited in particular at night. The Parking Garage: The Parking Garage (which the hotel staff will say doesnâ€™t belong to them) is dark and tight. It does raise a question about why someone doesnâ€™t put some better lighting in. When departing I went to get my car. The valet handed me the key. I asked him if I didnâ€™t need the small ticket that he was holding (you place it in the machine at the exit and the barrier raises). His response to me was â€˜You have something for me perhaps?â€™ So, if you want your car out of the garage, make sure that you offer a tip first. The garage is expensive as well, and if you donâ€™t know the hotel well isnâ€™t that easy to find. On some occasions (not on this trip) youâ€™ll find the entrance blocked or obscured by delivery vehicles. You also have to wait by your car while they call for one of the baggage staff to come down to the garage to collect your bags. Even if the garage isnâ€™t managed by the hotel, itâ€™s a very poor first impression. Iâ€™d encourage people who can get a good rate on the Gold Floor to give the hotel a try. Also sign up for the Fairmont Club to get your free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Does not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: GoguBoston
Reviews.Content: Tiny, dark rooms with outdated furniture and cathodic tube TV sets. The pool area is a joke: it is good for at most 5-6 people. Expensive parking (only valet for $28/day). The only plus is the conference center.

Reviews.Title: “A very good stay except for the malfunctioned aircon”
Reviews.Author: Wismergirl
Reviews.Content: My family of 3 stayed at the Mini Suite of Fairmont Queen Elizabeth for one night. The room was quite spacious as the living room and the bedroom were separated by a set of solid wood sliding doors to allow some privacy. DD stayed in the living room with a double sofabed and DH & I used the Queen bed in the bedroom. The air con in the sitting room worked fine but ours was not working properly...even with 10 degrees Celcius as set using the inroom thermometer we could feel no cool air and the room was like 25 degrees. Fortunately the air con in the sitting room worked wonderfully and we could use some of its coolness by leaving the sliding doors open. It's good to have a powder room (a washroom with just a sink and a toilet but no bath) so my teenage daughter can have some privacy on her side. The view from the room was pretty bad though - it's a room with NO view. Since I am a President's Club member we got free local calls and free wired internet. The connection was fast and smooth. Housekeeping left us 5 bottles of water after we finished the 2 that were placed on the desk when we checked in. They also left us with a little box of beautifully wrapped chocolate. The location of the hotel was very central and we could walk to Julien Restaurant (on Union past University) in 10 minutes. Food was pretty good there. Parking was pricey but we had no problem finding free meter parking past 6 p.m. Lots of parking spaces around the hotel and we saved a lot. We just needed to leave before 9 a.m. the next day. That was a good stay in Montreal but we still like the Executive Suite of Omni Mont-Royal the best. The decor was way more elegant and the room size was twice as big at the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Gr8 location for Jazzfest!”
Reviews.Author: scott r
Reviews.Content: Super hotel, with a great location near St Catherine's for shopping & of course Jazzfest!

Reviews.Title: “Go Gold!”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTravels02
Reviews.Content: Our family enjoyed a wonderful, luxurious stay on the Fairmont Gold level, concierge floors. Our rooms were quite large, clean, quiet, and comfortable. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Gold level rates included breakfast in the lounge on the 19th floor or in the main dining room downstairs, plus an assortment of desserts for afternoon tea and a larger spread of food, including meats and cheeses, from 5-7 pm. We actually found value and convenience, by paying a little bit more for the hotel and a lot less at restaurants. We really felt at home during our entire stay, but especially the time we were welcomed back from a long hot city walk by a staff member rushing to hand us bottles of cold water! Thank you, Gold Staffers!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: rocker18
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a downtown hotel convenient to all amenities, including shopping, restaurants, musuems, Old Montreal (30 minute walk) and the subway (easy and convenient to use), this fits the bill. We arrived by train and were a short elevator ride away from the hotel lobby where we were greeted by friendly staff. What the hotel may lack in modern decor (the rooms are a bit small and could use an upgrade as well as a good dusting), the Queen Elizabeth more than makes up with their service-excellent conceirge desk-busy but ofter more than one employee on duty. The health club is well equipped and the pool, although small, is fine for kids to enjoy. Fresh fruit and a plentiful supply of towels is a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: AnaesDoc
Reviews.Content: Fairmonts are reliable. Good room and service. The hotel itself is looking a bit dated. Could use a refresh.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: Hibiscus99
Reviews.Content: I don't know why we keep staying at Fairmont properties... Some of them have some history, this one does not. It looks and feels like a converted 70's office building. The bed and pillows were good, but the linens were not (no duvet). Our bathroom was old and small. The TV ancient and nearly impossible to decipher at the edges. The cooling worked well though and the window opened, which is nice. There are so many better options in Montreal. This was our second stay here, and if I have my way our last. No WiFi in the rooms (not even for a fee). It's an old hard-wire hook-up, which is a pain.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: Haligonian08
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the QE June 17-19. No real complaints, I guess I was just expected more. The positives are excellant location for shopping and fantastic breakfast included with the room. (The breakfast for 2 people cost about $60 so being included in the room made it a great value. Fruit, cheese, meats, pastries and breads, bacon, sausages, eggs benedict, scrambled eggs, crepes and more!) The room itself was small and the bathroom was very small (had to close the door to sit on the "throne"), but it was clean. The iron leaked water all over my clothes so I left a note for the maid and she replaced the iron right away. LIke I said, no complaints really, I was just underwhelmed with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Staff let down the Fairmont brand”
Reviews.Author: anniebm
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, the hotel and rooms are pretty good but the staff were sullen and lazy. In the restaurant it was virtually impossible to get served - I got fed up of waiting for cutlery after my meal finally arrived and went and found some myself. Other people had simialr experiences. Room service trays sat in the corridors from mid afternoon and were still there the following morning. At the concierge desk a lady reported a problem in the valet parking area. She was advised that the concierge would phone valet and ask for their attention yet as soon as the lady walked away the girl put the phone down without not speaking to valet. We have stayed all across Canada in Fairmonts and the service - except in the hotel - has been excellent. This crowd need replacing or a rocket!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Salthillhalli
Reviews.Content: Good location, friendly front desk staff however my room was incredibly small, thankfully I was traveling alone as my wife and I would have not had a good stay if we were in that room together. Honestly the smallest room I have ever stayed in, bathroom size was a bad joke, cleanliness could have been better as there were carpet stains. I arrived very late at night and ordered soup and a sandwich from room service, the sandwich was completely inedible, I should have complained but at 2:00 AM I was exhausted. I guess they allow pets as there was a dog barking on the second night. I was paying close to $200 so would expect more, especially from a Fairmont. I have only stayed at two hotels in Montreal, the Fairmont and the Inter-Con and would only return to the Inter-Con although I may give the Westin a try next time.

Reviews.Title: “The city at your doorstep”
Reviews.Author: CarelessWizard
Reviews.Content: The Queen Elizabeth was built in 1958 atop the central rail station and was specially built to eliminate the vibration from the trains underneath. The Queen is unbelievably well located in the city with everything closeby. I have stayed here on 3 occasions over 2 years and have had remarkably consistent service and quality of rooms. This is a city hotel, so the rooms are somewhat small, but they are wonderfully appointed. As I am not a discerning upscale type of guy - but I do appreciate a fine hotel - I will always stay here because of the location and the comfort of the hotel. When we arrive the doorman takes the car and has it valet parked, and after a breeze checkin process we are ready to explore the city. The beds are comfortable and the hotel is noiseless, unless the windows are open. We generally eat breakfast and lunch in the train station which has a huge variety of excellent food - especially the french bakery/deli closest to the mall and the hotel entrance. We often book the hotel in advance and with a good discount, often staying for $125-135 per night, a great deal for such a superb location and excellent hotel. Book early, get the discounts, give it a try - you will be glad you did!

Reviews.Title: “FIX THE HUM (OR FIRE THE BUILDING ENGINEER!)”
Reviews.Author: Voyager2Seattle_WA
Reviews.Content: Selected this hotel because of its super-convenient location and ease of access (for limited-mobility traveler in her 80's), plus Fairmont's reputation. What a disappointment! Immediately upon entering our 4th floor room, there was an obvious vibrating hum in the room - which we later found seems to afflict the entire 4th floor! (Didn't explore to see if other levels were so affected). Complained at Front Desk - received "You're the 1st one today to mention it" - not exactly a disclaimer, but said they'd check on it. No results, no apologies, after several more attempts to get some resolution. Even more annoying when trying to sleep with this buzzy hum constantly there. Montreal is a lovely city - I'll go back - but certainly not to the Fairmont!

Reviews.Title: “Quality Accommodation in Downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Panthalassa
Reviews.Content: The Queen Elizabeth is a large city hotel, well-suited for business travelers and those looking for quality accommodations in Montreal. OVERALL HOTEL: Entered the hotel from the underground parking (valet $24+) and was greeted with a clean modern looking city hotel. Long clean lobby, very business looking. Not a very homey feel to the entrance lobby, but clean and classy looking nonetheless. Long hallways leading to rooms on each floor. Everything is very clean! ROOM: We stayed in a Jr. Suite, which was very impressive. Suite contained one large full bathroom off the bedroom and one small bathroom/powder room (toilet and sink only) at the entrance to the suite. Suite also contained a sitting room and a bedroom (separated by a sliding door). Bedroom had a comfortable Queen size bed and dresser. Sitting room has TV in cabinet, a couch, coffee table and small desk. The view from our suite was nothing impressive, but the room was nice clean and modern. SERVICE: Check-in was straightforward. As a Fairmont Presidentâ€™s Club member, I was able to use the private reception desk which made check-in/out fast and simple. There were several other â€œregularâ€� check-in counters, which had lines at certain points of the day. Spoke with the concierge about the winter festival that was on in Montreal, and he was very helpful, providing us with a map and directions to the festival. LOCATION: Montreal is a beautiful city to explore. The Queen Elizabeth is located in the city center, which provides a good base to explore or for business travel.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed drab- service glitches- not for this price”
Reviews.Author: mmhscreenname
Reviews.Content: my last experience at fairmont vancouver was wonderful, so i did not hesitate to book 4 nights here at the Queen Elizabeth. For the price that i paid, i was shocked to find out that internet was not free! Other hotels, including travel lodge would provide that complimentary. i had to join the presidents club in order to get the free internet. After a 23 hour journey to reach here, i was surprised to find no comb, no ear buds, cotton for make-up removal, no toothbrush, and no slippers. I was going to a 5 star facility, i expected those items there and relieved the worries during my packing. When i called for assistance, they confirmed those items i need to request ? (you mean like travellodge). I am a tea drinker, and i had to call for the kettle. there was no place to put it but the floor next to the plug. The tea that i drink was not replenished, so i had to purchase my own box. The room was spacious, the colour was drab, monotonous light brown, not a touch of colour on the curtains, on the chair on the pillows, all brown and tired looking. I just received my bill this morning, and that prompted me to make my first ever posting review. The travellodge was 1 km away and could provided me with the same (am sure smaller room, and free internet) Did i pay for the name only here? I am truly disappointed, and so i hear of other business men who attended the similar conference. Yes growing up, this was an icon, but you got to do the upkeep! Get real, any hotel at this pricing that has to pay for internet is a major turn off and an inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK”
Reviews.Author: SurferBetty
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here due to the preferred rate we get at work. The hotel was OK. I have to say the service was terrible. The city has completely downhill. Montreal isn't the beautiful city that I remember it used to be. It looks like any major city in the US now, lots of panhandling, garbag and filth. While we were eating one night, there was an SUV full of 20 somethings pulled up in front of the restaurant. One of the kids whips open his pants and starts peeing in front of his parked car but we could see all he had to offer. Nice, eh? Not sure I'd really want to return.

Reviews.Title: “5 star plus hotel....1 star city..”
Reviews.Author: mrsbeasely
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great! Service, amenities, and staff are pleasant and helpful. Our stay here would have been perfect if there had been enough to keep us entertained in the hotel. The city itself....I will never return. On every corner and on the streets there are panhandlers, even in old Montreal. The city needs to get a handle on their homeless problem. Service in the city (restaurants and shopping) was extremely hit and miss. Either they speak English and are friendly, if they don't...basically they want you out of their establishment. Our next trip WAS going to be to Quebec city...but forget that. I will go to the states instead.

Reviews.Title: “dont eat the jam”
Reviews.Author: ferrarihotpants
Reviews.Content: the hotel was nice. the staff - not so much. the rooms were tidy. we ordered breakfast, which was presented in royal fashion, only the jam had already been opened!! gross!! we told the manager about it, basically - he did nothing - and might as well have said we were lying and probably wanted a kickback ???!!!! the location is great for buisness downtown - not so much if your wanting to see old port of montreal. a little bit of a walk. a lot of homeless beggars downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location to explore downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Wootten00
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ve stayed here a number of times and have never left disappointed. The staff are great, the rooms are well appointed, and the amenities abundant. You are minutes away from shopping, the Bell Centre, the university, Old Montreal and all of the Montreal nightlife. Theyâ€™ve got a fitness centre, a pool and a steam room. If you join their free frequent traveller program, internet access is free. This is a solid choice for the business or leisure traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in the Heart of Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Lynnja
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont Queen Elizabeth in Montreal in early April 2010. I was a first time customer. My sister, who I traveled with, was a repeat customer - and now I see why. First off, the service at this hotel is top notch. The staff are very friendly and courteous. My sister had left her cell phone charger at home and we were very impressed to find that they had complementary phone charges you could borrow during your stay if you were in such a pinch. Also, due to an allergy, we had requested a replacement for the feather pillows that came standard with the room. That replacement came within 15 minutes of our request! They were just as quick to respond to a request to change a broken light bulb by one of the beds. Second, they have great ammenities for members of their President's Club (it's their preferred customer program - it's free to join on-line). These ammenities included free bicycle rentals that can be used by hotel guests to go around the city. President's Club members get free internet access in their rooms (sadly not wireless but ethernet cable provided). Another perk for this club are free calls to 800 and local #s from your room. Free daily newspaper too. Third, the hotel is very clean. Aesthetically, the decor of the hotel is a little dated, but everything seemed to be maintained fairly well. We stayed in a room with two double beds. The room itself was a little bit on the smaller side, but we were definitely comfortable. I am a fussy sleeper and found their beds to be quite comfortable (I appreciate a firm mattress). The room came with a 19 / 21" television set - but it was an older model - not an LCD TV. More importantly, the TV reception was clear so this was more of another aesthetic issue. Fourth, the Fairmont's location is unbeatable. It's located right above a subway station. The new 747 Airport Express Bus ($7 one way) stops right by the hotel. I also appreciated that they had a food court located underneath the hotel which provided guests with quick, inexpensive meal options. The've got a great bounlangerie (bakery) down there too which I highly recommend. This hotel is within walking distance of Rue St. Catherine which is one of the main go-to locations in Montreal. Fifth, the hotel has a lovely spa - the Gibson - located on its premises. The spa is well maintained, clean and reasonably priced. My sister and I both got massages and were both surprised by the good skill demonstrated by our massage therapists. Sixth, despite being a big hotel, we were surprised that we had no issues with noise levels in our rooms. We didn't hear any of our neighbors from our room. While the hotel does have an indoor pool, my sister and I were disappointed that their pool was rather small. For such a big facility, the pool is compartively tiny so it tends to fill up easily making it annoying to try and do laps. We ordered room service for breakfast on our final morning at the hotel. The food was good and arrived promptly. What was slightly disappointing was that their menu was rather limited. Another issue with this being a larger hotel is that they tend to have many customers. While the staff are very nice, at one point during a Saturday evening, there was a bit of a wait to speak with one of the front desk staff (of which there were already 3 or 4). But when we did get to the front of the line, they were very nice and very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and very convenient”
Reviews.Author: toerist
Reviews.Content: Travelled by train just to spend a weekend in Montreal. Great price, very comfortable; great location from which to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: nbboy_2009
Reviews.Content: The service was great. The only concern I had that I was not told about the President's Club until I asked about it, which meant free internet while I was there for 4 days otherwise I would have paid close to $17 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Always the Best at La Reine Elizabeth”
Reviews.Author: Piperbear
Reviews.Content: One of the best offerings in the Fairmont chain. This hotel is well maintained and comfortable. Check in is always a breeze because they have lots of staff on the front desk. I had a Junior suite this time which has a powder room at the entrance, a good seating area, and a separate bedroom with private bath. there is ample closet space. Certainly great value. The location can't be beat with connection to the underground shopping and the VIA Rail train station only an elevator ride away. My only complaint is they don't vacuum the public hallways nearly enough...it was a bit rough looking walking down the hall to the room. Not a big deal...the room was certainly exceptionally clean.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay - perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: malibert
Reviews.Content: We went up in mid-March for our 5th anniversary, and paid to upgrade to the Gold Floor. This is an incredible value. We had a large room, and an incredible Sensaflow bed. We didn't have time for the evening canapes, but the private lounge was cool, and the staff was so helpful and friendly. The breakfasts were welcoming and good - not just toast and cereal but hot food, good coffee, and fruit and oatmeal. The staff was right there to help in any way, but also politely in the background so it wasn't like they were intruding. In general, this was a great stay for us. The weather was a little colder and wetter than we expected, but the hotel is connected directly to the underground city, and we spent plenty of time wandering underground. We opted to park on our own at the Place Ville Marie, which I think is a little cheaper than parking through the hotel, but I think that only works on weekends.

Reviews.Title: “SIMPLYTHE BEST!”
Reviews.Author: RosanaSpinelli
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband and my little daughter at Fairmont The Queen Elizabeth, in 2009, December, for four nights, and our experience was wonderful! I read a review that chid was very welcome at Fairmont The Queen Elizabeth. Because of that and the convenient location (just above the Montreal Underground Pedestrian Network, that has a 30 km pedestrian walkways), I chose this hotel, and I was so glad! The staff attested the children priority. On our check-in, my daughter won a little toy with a warmy welcome. In Christmas Eve, she won a push bear and many sweets in a Santa Claus sock. The hotel is fantastic! The room wasnÂ´t big, but convenient for a short stay. The lobby was beautiful and the staff was very helpful and nice. The swimming pool was a "plus" for relax. If you look for luxury, good location and vip treatment, you must stay at Fairmont The Queen Elizabeth, in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont The Queen Elizabeth - Over Rated, Aged Hotel, Loosing its Starsâ€¦”
Reviews.Author: MandLD
Reviews.Content: Fairmont The Queen Elizabeth - Over Rated, Aged Hotel, Loosing its Starsâ€¦ We stay here because it was located next to my spouse business training and meetings. The â€œnewly refurbishâ€� room are getting really run down, the room was small, and the washroom even smaller, but clean, and no room to leave suitcases anywhere. The staff in general was not very attentive and borderline rude. One good thing is that Hotel is conveniently located to the underground city with easy access to shopping, eating and the train station. We would not recommend that Hotel, instead for value and money if you have the option, we invite you to choose a Starwood Hotels (Westin, Sheraton) in general they are much better (rooms are spacious, great amenities, fine staff etc.)

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Gold = Awesome Room”
Reviews.Author: gabigoose
Reviews.Content: I havenâ€™t been to the Queen Elizabeth in several years. A client meeting provided me the opportunity to return recently, but just for one night. I was completely impressed. First I was upgraded to a Fairmont Gold room (Room 1879). The room was perfect. It was a 1-bedroom suite with views of two sides of Montreal. I loved the separate living room area and the bath. All of the dÃ©cor on the Gold Floor was perfect for my tastesâ€¦very sophisticated. The lobby and convention floors are also very nicely decorated. The Gold Lounge provided great evening appetizers and a high-class light morning breakfast. Service in the Gold Lounge was terrific. I was also impressed with the front desk agents. Check in was easy and friendly and upon checkout I needed an itemized print out of a receipt from an in-room dining meal. The agent was very responsive and made me feel like a valued guest as I was preparing to depart. Enjoy the hotel if you visit and if possible upgrade to a Fairmont Gold floor.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay, good location”
Reviews.Author: violetvale
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Queen E for 2 nights in a moderate-large room on the 17th floor. They were nice about giving me early check-in (2:30pm vs 4pm regular) and late check-out. Room was clean and a good size, with Miller Harris toiletries. The bed, esp. the big pillows, was very comfy. The location is great if you are taking the train as the hotel is located directly above the train station. Also on the lower level is an extensive food court with lots of choice. The croissants, sandwiches and pastries at the Premiere Moisson were very good. There's also a liquor store (SAQ) in the food court, lots of banking machines, and Bonaventure metro station is connected underground. The pool is okay - it was a bit less clean than the other areas of the hotel and the pool area is functional, not decorated in a way to make you want to sit and relax there. Overall, I enjoyed my stay and would return.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THE QUEEN E”
Reviews.Author: penroy1965
Reviews.Content: We had a studio suite with one and a half baths. Really liked the hotel, great location in Montreal just above the via rail station. Staff was pleasant. Pascal from the front desk was more than willing to help when AMEX declined my pre-auth.

Reviews.Title: “great for train travellers”
Reviews.Author: winston123Toronto
Reviews.Content: We stay here because it is located right above the train station. If you have children the larger rooms (suites) are great. Unfortunately the restaurant changed from something great to something not so good. The rooms are getting a little rundown, but just a little. They were done with all high quality materials - marble and such so they have weathered well. There rates seems to vary aa lot but there are great bagains to be had sometimes. Sevice is very good.

Reviews.Title: “My new home away from home in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: bardurf
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many hotels in downtown Montreal and the Ritz Carlton was my favorite until it closed for renovations. The Queen Elizabeth's Entre Gold floor is a serious contendor to Ritz's style and service. This was my second stay in four months at the "Queen E" on their Gold floor (floors 18 and 19) and I was very satisfied. The concierge staff on the Entre Gold floor are very attentive. The morning breakfast (included with rate) and evening hors d'oeuvres are excellent. Although the rooms are on the small side, they make up for it in the quality of furnishings and decor. I also found the rates quite competitive - we paid less than $250 (double) per night.. You are central to everything here and can use the underground city walkways, and Metro subway, to get just about anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, beautiful city!”
Reviews.Author: Satchriani
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont Queen Elizabeth during the NHL All Star weekend. My production team was covering the event and it's festivities. Upon check-in we were greeted by the friendly staff, and promptly assigned to our rooms. Mind you, the lobby was VERY busy. They took the time to answer all our questions, and to share a few laughs. The rooms were beautiful, with amazing views of the city/surroundings. Everything was clean, and orderly. Extra pillows were delivered quickly upon request. Room service was excellent, and the high-speed internet really was high speed. Since the train station is right underneath the hotel (I didn't realize this until the day before our departure) there are PLENTY of choices for food, drink, etc. There is also a fabulous restaurant right across the street. The staff was very friendly and kind, and all bi-lingual. Someone wrote that since they didn't speak French the staff was not forgiving. I'd have to disagree. If I ever visit Montreal again, I would jump at the chance of staying at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and convenient”
Reviews.Author: rideauferry
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a two day stay at this hotel. The rooms were good, checking in and out fast and efficient. The location was what attracted us to it, and that was one of the best features. My friends and I ate at the Bistro restaurant on Valentine's Day for dinner, and were very disappointed with the service, although the food was very good. The other feature that was not up to par was the swimming area. While the workout area was well-appointed, the swimming pool and hot tub area was just mediocre. Don't stay here if you are expecting a good time at the pool - very small, cramped and no nice atmosphere whatsoever. We also visited the GIbson spa, and liked our treatments - they didn't try to sell us their expensive products. Overall a good place to stay if you're looking for something central to everything in Montreal, but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: bandlshoe
Reviews.Content: Most positive point of this hotel is that is located above the train station and that is very convenient. Found staff to be rude, unhelpful and seemingly put off that we did not speak French. We checked into our room just after 7pm to find dirty, torn and worn carpet. We were too tired at this point to complain and just ate dinner and crashed. We got sandwiches from one of the few restaurants still open in the underground mall. We had a tour of Montreal the next morning that would not be finished until noon (check-out time). The hotel could not even accomodate us with a late check out and painfully, it seemed, stored our luggage for us while we went on our tour. (That put us checking in at 7pm and checking out at 7--8am) After our tour, it was pouring rain--we found a spot for lunch (nothing worth mentioning) and sat in the hotel lobby (with our luggage) until time to catch our train at 6pm. Luckily, the lobby is equipped with large restrooms where we could freshen up.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Kim_Rob
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms, a little small. Nice amenities, great location. This is primarily a business/convention hotel and is NOT child-friendly. Would absolutely stay there again.....but not with children.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JimVT
Reviews.Content: Always like to stay at Fairmont hotels when we travel because we like the old world feel and have always gotten very good service and a comfortable room at a competitive price. Within the past year or 2 have stayed in Fairmonts in Toronto and Ottawa and were more than satisfied both times. Didn't quite know what to expect from this hotel in Montreal because it is so large (1700 rooms), right over the central rail station and in the heart of downtown. Although we live relatively close to Montreal (2 1/2 hrs. away) we haven't visited because of stories about traffic, crime (stolen cars, mostly), etc. But, I must say that my fears were totally unfounded. The hotel itself does not seem like a large hotel once inside, the room was well laid out and very comfortable even though we paid a bargain price ($142 CAN) and had a very nice downtown view. Check-in and check-out were smooth and easy and with the free Presidents Club you get free high speed internet. Also free was a very nice health club and pool, spa, steamroom, etc. It's a fairly short, nice walk over to old Montreal and there are plenty of restaurants in the area. We didn't eat in the hotel, but did have a drink at the bar which is very nice, although expensive with someone playing the piano and everyone very friendly. If you don't want to pay top price for breakfast and don't want to walk outside in the cold or poor weather I would suggest going down to the train station where there are plenty of places to get a reasonably priced meal. The underground city (which is huge) is located under the hotel also but doesn't open much of anything before 10am. Plenty of parking is available with quick access to the hotel through the train station. Price is $17 CAN per day and the garage has a secure system where you take your ticket and then pay before you leave, inserting your paid ticket to get out. If you're going to be constantly going in and out it might be worth paying the hotel for valet parking but that's just unlimited in/out for $26 CAN per day. Access to the hotel from outside the city seemed quite easy. We didn't get there on a workday or at rush hour so we don't know what the traffic situation is at those times but was relatively benign on the weekend. We're looking forward to going back in the warm weather because the old section and riverfront area looks like it must be a blast. Quiet in winter, though but many nice restaurants down there and they do fill up at night. Will definitely stay at the Fairmont Queen Elizabeth again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, wonderful location...but...”
Reviews.Author: mrfuni
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend in Montreal at The Queen Elizabeth. Room was wonderful with a corner view from the 16th floor. Bed very comfortable and the room was well appointed, with a flat screen TV, coffee maker, bath robes, etc. Loved the location right in midtown, with access to the "underground city" from the hotel. Concierge was the best and gave us two great French restaurant recommendations close by. I have 2 issues that prevent me from rating the hotel 5 stars. first we arrived about 1:45 pm to check in and we were told the room wasn't ready, and their check in time is 4:00 pm. Long story short, we waited in the lobby until they finally had a room for us at 4:35 pm. We could have checked in our luggage and did some sight seeing, but the temps were below zero and we were tired from our travels. Guess we thought the room would be ready "any time now." Second issue is the parking. Be prepared to pay $26 usd per day to park your car. You can park in the garage across the street for a reduced rate, but with the weather being what it was, it was hard to convince my wife to drag our luggage in the freezing snow for check in and check out. Without the checkin and parking issue, it was a nice, comfortable stay and would give it another try again

Reviews.Title: “Don't be a member of President club at Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: fairmontsucks
Reviews.Content: Do not subscribe to Fairmont President Club (FPC) because they have serious problems of security. I was a frequent client of Fairmont Hotel and a FPC member. In December 2009, because Fairmont lack of privacy someone had access to my FPC account and was able to charge the stay to my credit card. Fairmont told me only after many exchanges of emails that they gave access to my FPC account to another customer (because of an human error...) and that customer was able to see my information (and was able to change it). I received a final email from their VP legal that they were sorry but that mistake was not as serious as I was claiming to be.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: tisim
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Fairmont Queen Elizabeth every time we are in Montreal---usually two or three times a year and love it. It is well located for shopping downtown or going to Old Montreal and site seeing. No need to go outside with all the shopping and food services underground if the weather is not the best. The service in the hotel is wonderful and all staff will go out of their way to make you feel special and welcome. there is a great spa in the hotel that is worth a visit while you are there. We have never been disappointed and have been staying here for the last six years. A good pick!

Reviews.Title: “I would stay again...!!!”
Reviews.Author: SiddG
Reviews.Content: We chose Montreal as our Christmas 2009 holiday destination and enjoyed it for the following reasons; - Beautiful Hotel - Professional/Top Class receptions: Kevin - Outstanding rooms - Perfect location - Access to the underground pathway makes it just perfect during the winters We arrived at 8am in the morning and Kevin (at check in) was very courteous and checked us right into Room 1570 a high up floor with a perfect view of McGill road (beautiful view of the university, city decorations, downtown and mountains in the back drop). The thing that surprised us was that were better rooms then the standard room we booked via Expedia... We were more than satisfied with the room, hotel & service and we will return to try out their Gold standard rooms. We would recommend this hotel to everyone who wants to stay downtown with easy access to all stations. I would highly recommend you order from the restaurant (room service) and try the creme' brulee... amazing!! Thank you for making our trip comfortable and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Would not class as Five Star”
Reviews.Author: IrelandTwinkle
Reviews.Content: First thing you notice in the lobby is the dated 70's brown formica all around the lobby area and I was itching to tear it down along with the dated wallpaper behind the reception. The velour chairs also need changing as they are very worn. Room was adequate but small with no room to leave suitcases anywhere. The website states free newspaper, but we had none, free bathrobes, but we had none and free tea or coffee but alas we had none. I have stayed in better 3 star hotels around the world. Location is great as you are near everything however and found the staff to be quite pleasant and check in easy. The gym is good but didn't use the restaurans. Perhaps the hotel uses its past visitors as its glorification Dala Lama, Royalty, Actors etc but please please update that lobby for starters!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mimikaayu
Reviews.Content: I have been to this hotel countless time as part of frequent business travel. The location is great for business (right in financial centre) and for leisure (5 min walk to St Catherine Street where the shopping and restaurants are). I had an encounter of very bad service once. I took the matter to customer service aftewards and was impressed they listened and offered to upgrade my room next time I stay. Overall it is a good hotel and I would recommand to others.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Hotel or Salvation Army ?”
Reviews.Author: ReneSheridan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed in many hotels in our life time, but never at the Queen E. Being 62 I like to stay in nice places. In Montreal, there are the Westin, Sheraton, Bonaventure and many more. But we never tried the Queen E before. We decided to go there on Christmas day, being located next to the Cathedral and we went to the Christmas mass. We came at the Hotel, to find out that they would not accept our Aeroplan card, and that the parking was 26$/day (across the street it is 17$/day) We went to our room drop our baggages and went in the city. The room is small, old TV but it is late and we went to bed. In the morning, I noticed a big dirty spot on the carpet, no newspaper at the door and when I checked the coffee machine, it was dirty from the visitors before us. The cups had not been washed, no carpets in the bathroom, in short I have seen Motel 8 in better shape than this 4 star hotel. I called the concierge and they sent a clean coffee pot, then somebody else came in the room to wash the cups etc etc. They finally sent a pot of fresh coffee, and after talking to the customer service representative, they sent us a plate of cheese in the afternoon, and a carpet cleaner. Breakfeast start at 24$ and a bottle of water is 8$ Please people, go anywhere but the Queen E in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: GayTripper90046
Reviews.Content: We booked through an online site for USD 110 a night. The location is central and close walk to Ste Catherine's shops and restaurants and can reach the subway through underground which is a big plus during severe weather. The front desk and concierge staff is very helpful. The housekeeping is a bit slow perhaps due to the size of the hotel. We wanted a quiet, comfortable room which was what we got. The one major disappointment is the bathroom - really feel like giving it one scrub over. The grills on the air vent is really dusty, the light fixture is very dirty, the sink has major hard water stains, so so water pressure and even though the bath tub is big, water stains prevent us from truly enjoying it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: summerlover03
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 1 night In Oct/09. I found a decent rate on Expedia.ca and the location was very convenient being just above the train station. The concierge service was very helpful. The room was very nice & clean, in my opinion it had a more luxurious look than your average hotel. However the room & bathroom were a little on the smaller side, but still served it's purpose. Make sure you read the mini-bar prices before you dig-in...the prices are ridiculous! Overall very nice stay, I'd go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Pre Conference Site Visit”
Reviews.Author: WendyK4
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable rooms but small dark bathroom. Morning wait-staff in restaurant is unmatched. They were fabulous. Prefer more action in a lobby...very boring.

Reviews.Title: “A refuge from the awful weather”
Reviews.Author: TatOnHols
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the same reasons a lot of other travellers do - it was conveniently located above the train station. The hotle was very moderately priced, and seemed even more of a bargain after what we paid for in New York. Our room had recently been refurbished and was lovely. The bed was spectacularly comfortable and we had the best sleep of the whole trip. Unlike others, I thought the room was definitely large enough. The view was nice. We had room service which was ok, and drinks in the lounge downstairs that were good quality, reasonably priced and accompanied by great service and snacks. It surprises me that there was no free wifi, but that it had to be paid for, whereas the 2* hotel in New York was able to provide it. The location was ok, and we were able to find some good restaurants and used the metro system with ease. I would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with Character”
Reviews.Author: pr123
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Montreal for 2 nights visiting family. We have stayed at other hotels in the past, but were intrigued by the character of the Queen Elizabeth, so tried it. The hotel is very large, and is located on top of the main train station. (You wouldn't know it, but we met a family member arriving by train.) It seems like one of those older 'destination' hotels where everything happens. We spent most of one day shopping when it poured rain, and there is a huge network of retail shopping accessible underground from the hotel. When we ventured out after the rain, we seemed to be close to everything and had dinner with family only a few blocks from the property. Service was good (not outstanding, but good), and the room was good. Overall, a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rmhayward
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with great service. The room was a bit small but very comfortable. Great location especially if your walking.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly good hotel”
Reviews.Author: b0bcat66
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fairmont Queen Elizabeth from October 24 - 28, 2009 in a Fairmont Room. King bed, small room, smaller bathroom. The bathrooms are too small to accommodate all of the toiletries that are necessary. We were on the ninth floor and had a fantastic view of the dome of the cathedral across the street. The location of the hotel is very central for walking to Rue St. Catherine for shopping and to Old Montreal for touring. We had dinner at Europea and I would highly recommend the restaurant. We tried to get into the Beaver Club Restaurant at the hotel, but it was booked solid. Rue St. Paul is the main street for shops, galleries and restaurants in Old Montreal. The city is very walkable and cabs are plentiful if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: saucie60
Reviews.Content: Even though our room was pre-booked a month in advance, "Fairmont" felt it was acceptable to give our room away because they said they had a party of people come unexpectedly. This, in my opinon was very unprofessional.

Reviews.Title: “An ordinary 4 star hotel in downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Burydrive
Reviews.Content: As part of a long weekend trip to Canada (stops in Montreal & Quebec City), my wife and I stayed at the Fairmont Queen Elizabeth hotel for two nights in early October, 2009. In general, we tend to stay in traditionally decorated 4 & 5 star hotels with reputations for quality and convenience (i.e., traditionally decorated & clean hotels that have a bar, a restaurant, and are located within walking distance to local attractions & the historic city centers). Except for the modern dÃ©cor, the Queen Elizabeth fit all of our typical needs and requirements (i.e., it was a clean 4 star hotel with a bar, restaurant, located within the city center, and within walking distance to the local attractions/historic city center). Our overall impression of the hotel, though, was that the Queen Elizabeth was non-descript and average. For us, the hotel did not have the character and charm that normally distinguishes a Fairmont property from any average 4 or 5 star hotel in North American (for example, if we didnâ€™t know that we were in the Queen Elizabeth in Montreal we would have thought that we were in any Hyatt, Marriott, or Sheraton high rise hotel). While we enjoyed our stay at the Queen Elizabeth (the room was quiet and the king size bed was very comfortable), our recommendation would be to research other hotel options in Montreal before choosing the Queen Elizabeth. Prior to booking our room at the Queen Elizabeth, we did all of our typical research by reading reviews on TripAdvisor, gathering hotel details from the hotel website, searching the internet for information regarding the hotel, etc. Based upon the results of our research (i.e., mixed reviews of the Queen Elizabeth), we had some concerns about staying in this hotel. After researching rates and comparing our options, we decided to reserve a room at the Queen Elizabeth in one of their â€˜Goldâ€™ rooms (located on the 18th and 19th floors of the hotel). In our opinion, if you choose to stay at the Queen Elizabeth try to get a good deal on a â€˜Goldâ€™ room as these appear to be the best rooms that the hotel has to offer. In addition, as part of our â€˜Goldâ€™ room package we received several convenient amenities such as complimentary snacks/non-alcoholic drinks during happy hour & a daily complimentary breakfast (a light buffet with coffee/juice). We flew into Montreal from the US so we arrived via the airport (YUL). At the airport, we were presented with several different options to travel to the hotel (i.e., bus, taxi, or town car). We originally chose the taxi but at the last minute switched to the town car option (the taxi and town car options have fixed rates into the city center and the town car was only $10 CAN more than the taxi). I am not sure if this was the best overall choice, but for us it worked out well (our flight arrived late at night and we did not clear customers/immigration until after 11:30 PM - so we wanted to take the most convenient transportation to the hotel). The town car was not fancy, but it was clean, comfortable, and did get us to the hotel by midnight. The town car dropped us off at the side entrance of the hotel (which seems to be typical for this hotel) and we checked in with relative ease (the front desk staff was very pleasant and assigned us room 1961). Just a note - when staying in a â€˜Goldâ€™ room you can check in with the concierge on the 19th floor as long as you arrive prior to 11:00 PM (a very convenient option during peak times). We left Montreal for Quebec City via the train. The location of the Queen Elizabeth (right above the central train station) made the trip to Quebec City even more convenient (simply take the elevator from the hotel lobby down two flights to the train station). The train was perfect. We reserved Business Class tickets (they were only slightly more expensive than the coach option) and we received a complimentary lunch and drinks during the three and a half hour journey (a three course meal with a hot main course and complimentary wine/beer).

Reviews.Title: “Great Character Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DAGK
Reviews.Content: Good Location. Nicely appointed rooms ( most have been recently updated). Good for those without car, hotel is right on top of central train station, and for those with car as their valet service is very efficient. The only complaint I have with his hotel is the attitude from some ( not all) of the service staff. unfortunately more than once I have seen staff give off a very snobby attitude towards guest. other than that good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing one bedroom suites, stay @ Queen for its location”
Reviews.Author: vincebilodeau
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Queen E a couple of times in the past, so I came to know the different room styles. In my last stay, I picked a one bedroom suite that was totally worth the price. The other suites or mini suites have no views, i.e., view of the parking lot and loading area, and are somehow smallish and not very well designed. Anyways, my stay in the suite at the end of the 13rd floor hallway was memorable. It was nicely furnished and distributed, the view on the city and the mountain was gorgeous. The foie gras from the room service was delicious, I had it twice. Got wrongly charged two nights of parking after checking-out, but staff at the accounting dept. refunded my credit card quickly. Careful with the parking charges, it is the second time I have problem with that.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and just so...convenient!”
Reviews.Author: auher
Reviews.Content: I usually shy away from staying at conference hotels when I'm in town for a conference somewhere, but in this case, I couldn't find a better deal and figured I'd give it a try. The location is perfect, connected to the "underground city" and the train station. It's steps from shopping, dining, vieux-port, everything. The hotel has great services. Rooms are quaint, if a bit small, but I was happy. Just really glad I stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “Bring uppers”
Reviews.Author: jonat1x
Reviews.Content: There's something about the name of this place that makes you feel important. The location is great. The room was a bit of a disappointment - described as recently renovated, it had chips in the tiles in the bathroom floor and burn marks in the carpet - despite being a non-smoking room. And everything except the sheets and towels is BROWN. The carpet is BROWN. The drapes are BROWN. The chairs are upholstered in BROWN. The shower curtain is BROWN. The wallpaper is BROWN. The bathroom tiles are BROWN. The frame around the bathroom mirror is BROWN. The facial tissues are in a BROWN holder. The doors are painted BROWN. All the furniture is BROWN. The bedspread is BROWN. The lampshades are BROWN. It's unbelievable! If you're a naturally cheerful person and have a sense of the absurd, come and enjoy the BROWN. Otherwise, find somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: AvidTraveler95
Reviews.Content: Room was pricey but well worth it. Couldn't ask for a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: UK_Basball_Fans
Reviews.Content: Well placed to visit Mont Royal, Old Town and built over main rail station so well connected to Olympic Park site. Close to shops and restaurants. Strongly recommend visitors to join the Fairmont Presidents Club if they want free internet access - we did this with the hotel concierge and gained immediate access. Spacious room with good view. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “5 star rating for a very good reason!”
Reviews.Author: showmanNewYork
Reviews.Content: First and foremost... the service was the best I have ever had. I travel very often and know exceptional service when I see or receive it. The Beaver Club restaurant is a 5 diamond restaurant.... there are only a handful of restaurants with that rating in Canada. Veeery pricey but the service and food are unparalleled. An experience you will keep with you forever. My rooms rating is a little lower because we found our room had very limited space. With a room that size they should use smaller furniture. I am confident that they have some pretty beautiful suites. Also take note that you can rent the same suite as John Lennon and Yoko Ono used for their famous "make love not war" campaign against the war.It's suite #1742... you can also take a picture in front of it instead. Great location, close to the Bell Centre and, well, everything in downtown Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay - especially good service.”
Reviews.Author: SLG29
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 nights at the QE, part business, part leisure. Good points:- Very comfortable bed. Well appointed and stylish room, not huge but perfectly acceptable. Nice Miller Harris toiletries. Gold floor lounge served good continental breakfast and floor concierge was helpful and charming. Less good points:- The airconditioning was really quite noisy even on the low setting, and the fan stayed on even when it was turned off. Not enough surfaces in the bathroom for stuff. Hotel bar area lacked charm and natural light, (but made good cocktails). Turndown service was too early, we were getting ready to go out to dinner when they called. However we find this is a general problem in North America - perhaps because Europeans go out/eat out later?? There are lots of choices of hotel of this standard in central Montreal but I would choose to stay here again, as the location was excellent and the staff were friendly and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: seyenepo
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money. Rooms not big but adequate. Location is perfect. The coffee shop serves great snacks with your drinks & kids drink (& eat) free.

Reviews.Title: “Not Fairmont quality at all, needs a refresh badly!”
Reviews.Author: k2chad
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights, bit on the Presidents club email at a good rate. Location is very good, you can park anywhere downtown and walk in. I paid $30 total for 3 days very close by. Subway and train are right there, no need to go out even. Check in area average at best. Pleasant service but not Fairmont service. Room was very basic. Bathroom adequate, no fan. Older tub and toilet with a very institutional style flush handle. Strange. One small chair (with a broken armrest) and desk. Wired internet, with a broken ethernet cable. Old style CRT TV about a 22 inch. Bed was supposedly a queen but felt like a full at best. Firm mattress that was very springy and felt old. Old style thermostat with a basic radiator/air conditioner. Overall this is 2 star quality at a 4 star price. I would not stay here again as there are many MODERN hotels downtown for the same price. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the QE”
Reviews.Author: CaseyMD
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at the Queen Elizabeth, in town for the Montreal Film Festival. I booked two rooms through hotels.com and was pleased they were able to put us in side-by-side rooms despite being fully booked. I signed up for the president's club on the Fairmont website prior to the visit based on another traveler's recommendation in an earlier review. I think this was worth it, the lobby can get very busy during check-in and it was nice to have a shorter, private line. We used the valet at $26 a night, which was steep but all in all worth it as it is difficult to park right in the center of montreal. The location of the hotel was great, only a block from lots of shopping. Restaurants are many around, but we did eat at the hotel's bistro, Montrealis I believe it was called. The food was adequate for the high prices: nothing to write home about but not terrible either. Service was good, the front desk staff helpful. They upgraded us to rooms with king-size beds. The room was actually larger than I had expected from reading reviews, I have certainly stayed in much much smaller rooms in the centers of cities before. The bed was very comfortable, I slept wonderfully. Overall I would recommend this hotel to travelers, I think it would be comfortable for longer stays as well.

Reviews.Title: “QE is always great”
Reviews.Author: RobertGvl
Reviews.Content: I often go to Montreal on business or leisure and this hotel is definitely the best spot in town. You cannot beat location. Sitting right on the train station, at a walking distance from everywhere you need to go, and directly linked with the underground city. Queen Elizabeth is the biggest hotel in Montreal (more than 1000 rooms) and has very interesting history behind it. Service level is standardized so that you always have the same experience every time you come. If you can afford it, Gold floor is fantastic... It is not only a slightly upgraded floor as you'll find in other hotels, but it is actually a personalized boutique style hotel within the hotel with your own entrance. If you're looking at a high service level, this is the room you need to book, especially if you're on business. But if you're on a romantic week-end, the regular room will give you all the intimacy you need. Finally, the Sunday brunch is really a must, as in all Fairmont !! Now beware!! This is NOT a family hotel. They do not have the facilities to accommodate families, especially young children; rooms are not designed to accommodate an additional bed or cot. Rooms are small (but cozy). So if youâ€™re on a family trip, other options in Montreal will suit better your needs. Another con... this hotel, especially during Summer months (high demand in Montreal during Summer) can get very pricey (from mid June to mid August). Also the QE hosts many conventions, so sometimes it can get fully booked during weekdays (tip : if it gets fully booked, try with a consolidator, sometimes they have rooms available even if the hotels says it is fully booked). I would recommend this hotel to anyone not on a family trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Fairmont hotel.”
Reviews.Author: vinceg89
Reviews.Content: I went to the Fairmont Queen Elizabeth on August 9 2009 during the tennis tournament (Rogersâ€™s cup). During my stay, the atmosphere of the hotel was really great because this was the official hotel for the tennis tournament. A lot of tennis players stayed at this hotel during the week. In general, the Fairmont Queen Elizabeth is a really nice hotel but itâ€™s not perfect. HOTEL AMENITIES AND PUBLIC ROOMS: The Fairmont Queen Elizabeth has a nice lobby with a lounge next to it. The dÃ©cor is classy with white marbles floor. I would say that the dÃ©cor is classic and not too modern. Itâ€™s still beautiful in my opinion. The hotel has a nice fitness center with good equipments and plenty of space for your personal workout. Itâ€™s on the lower floor, under the lobby. Next to the fitness center, there is an indoor pool with two Jacuzzis. The pool is not really big but itâ€™s a city hotel, not a resort. So it did the job. I didnâ€™t try any of the hotel restaurants because there are a lot of restaurants nearby so I canâ€™t comment on those, but I have heard that the food is pretty good. Whatâ€™s special about this particular hotel in Montreal is that you can access the underground shopping mall by going down a level from the hotel lobby. The mall is literally under the hotel, so you donâ€™t need to go outside to reach it. So, I would say that the Fairmont Queen Elizabeth has nice public rooms and good amenities for a hotel of this class. HOTEL ROOM: I stayed in a Fairmont room with a queen bed. I found the room small compare to other Fairmont hotels where I stayed at but itâ€™s was really beautiful. The dÃ©cor of the room is modern compare to the rest of the hotel with really nice furniture. The bathroom was small but it was clean and beautiful with black marbles floor and walls. In general, the room was great. SERVICE: The service that I received during my stay at the Queen Elizabeth was good but not perfect. I was able to check-in early but the reception employee seemed not really happy. She was only doing her job and nothing more. The staffs that I encountered thorough my stay didnâ€™t seem to welcome the guests with enthusiasm. On a possible maximum score of 10, I would only give 7 out of 10 for the service I received at the Fairmont Queen Elizabeth. OVERALL RATING: I give the Fairmont Queen Elizabeth 4* out of 5* for its nice amenities and small, but beautiful hotel rooms. The only reason why I donâ€™t give this hotel 5* is because the service was not up to the quality that Fairmont hotels are known for.

Reviews.Title: “Tammy was the BEST”
Reviews.Author: JimGunther
Reviews.Content: Visited Montreal for our 42nd Anniversay last weekend. First time back to thyis beautiful city since our honeymoon exactly 42 years ago. The Queen is perfectly located and does many things well and nothing badly. Our stay on the Gold floor was made especially enjoyable by Tammy. She made our visits to the lounge area especially enjoyable. (I'm not certain of her title - she attended to the snack and drink area - but, went way beyond expected in service and warmth. We especially appreciated her suggestion of Restaurant Julien as a small (not-such-an-elaborate-deal) within walking distance. (For some reason,?? the Gold Room desk on the Saturday evening shift did NOT offer Menus <or much help really> about near by (walkable) alternatives to the Fairmont's Beaver Club). A comment on value: maybe things have changed in the last couple years - I think a beer or glass of wine OUGHT to be complimentary on any premium floor. There was an Honor Bar charge.:( They had a GREAT selection of beers. Wines were nice but limited selection available. The snacks were fine but certainly not remarkable. (We've really enjoyed and been spoiled by the Ritz-Carlton Club Floor in past years.) All things considered, there was nothing that would disuade me from staying here again (Tammy might convince us to return) but, I'd probably shop-around to see if there might be something that "had it all".

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a good location and nice view of the city”
Reviews.Author: nes56
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a long weekend to escape from NYC. My date joined the President's Club which made check in a breeze and gave us other amenities to enjoy (like the morning paper). I found very little to complain about - minor things like less frequent changing of linen and fewer room attendants cause our room not to be serviced until early evening (5:30 PM) on the second day. Room # 1078 was a tad small, but I've stayed in tighter quarters for more money. Nice toiletries and plush linens though. Nice furniture but not much room for storage - plenty of mirrors. Had lunch in the Montrealais Bistro Bar and enjoyed the Â½ pound burger - the wait staff was great (staff was attentive throughout the hotel actually). The Bistro is pretty and has nice street views, prices were a tad high, but I think comparable to NYC's east side hoteliers prices. A word of compliment to the housekeeping staff - I left behind some papers I was grading. When I called the hotel to inquire, they actually sent someone to check the room, found the missing item, returned my call and offered to send my portfolio back to me! Very considerate! I would stay here again, especially since it is almost directly above the Amtrak train station. Great for walking or biking to the various neighborhoods of Montreal and for shopping in the Old City and the Underground or St. Catherine Ste.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Yummy Brunch Buffet”
Reviews.Author: ArtapQuebec
Reviews.Content: The Queen Elizabeth cannot be in a better location in terms of shopping. It's connected to the Place Ville Marie underground shopping mall, which connects to many other malls like Eaton Centre and Les Ailes, not to mention its close proximity to the infamous Rue Ste.-Catherine. The train station is also directly beneath the hotel, which is also ultra-convenient if you want to arrive by train. Our room was a little on the small side. I'm not sure if we just got the slim pickins or if they are all mostly like that. I think I was expecting a little more in terms of space and maybe bed comfort, and maybe a little more luxury, but it wasn't a big deal. As far as service goes, I must say that the valet service is super speedy, I have to give them their props. The concierge was extremely helpful. He took his time, despite the line, to thoughtfully recommend a restaurant and provide printed information on the location. Very thorough, prince of a fellow.. Check-in was slow, but it was a busy weekend. Brunch at the restaurant next to the elevators, Le Montrealais, was great. Fresh fruits, fresh OJ, eggs benedict, bacon, sausage, pastries (you must try one), crepes, yogurts, cheeses and more. Go early if eating on the weekends to not get the last of everything. Kids eat free, not sure up to what age, but our kids were 6 and under. Hubby said that the hot tub was a bit on the cold side, and he's pretty sensitive to hot water.

Reviews.Title: “I Will Not Stay Here If I Were You”
Reviews.Author: EtobicokeGirl
Reviews.Content: Let me first say the things that I liked about this hotel. The location is central to all the places you would want to go to, say, the church the Old Port or the St. Joseph's Oratory or the shopping areas and etc. It is clean, I must say, as it is what you should expect from a four-star hotel. And here is what you should be reading: when we arrived, parking is already a problem, since your only option is a) valet service which is $26 dollars per day from the hotel, and b) a green-P parking that charges $8 dollars per hour. TAKE YOUR PICK. As we checked-in, there are only about 2 receptionists working and we waited about 45 minutes just for them to let us know that the room is still being cleaned. The pool/ steam room is only opened till 9 pm. So much for relaxation when you really need it. I was travelling with my 12-month old baby and when I called for the reception/ customer service to ask where I can use a microwave to warm up my baby's milk, I was put on hold for 20 MINUTES only to be told that they charge a $10 rental fee for a microwave to be brought up to the room that I will use for 1 minute!!! And much to my disappointment, the lady at the reception told me to just boil the water from the coffe maker and said that it is the best suggestion that she has. Am I staying in a four-star hotel or somewhere else that is uber primitive? All I can say is that this hotel does NOT deserve a four-star hotel. I've been to 3-star hotels and their bathrooms have exhaust fans. This one DOES NOT have any in their rooms! It was bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Elegant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sharpay10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on top of the Via Rail train station making it a very convenient stay for those traveling by train. A quick walk and elevator ride from the train station brings you to the lobby of this grand hotel. The lobby is lovely and the staff very professional, friendly and welcoming. The room size is adequate and cleanliness is also good. The views from this hotel are spectacular and it is in a very good location. You can walk to St. Catherine Street and many other attractions from here. We had a lovely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful long weekend!”
Reviews.Author: CCButtons
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here on the August long weekend and had a wonderful time. We arrived by train and it was so easy walking from the train station right up into the hotel. It was nice not to have to walk outside. We requested a view of the Cathedral and it really was wonderful coming back to the room and seeing it right outside your window! The rooms, while on the smallish side, were clean and extremely comfortable. The beds and pillows were so inviting it was hard to leave the room to go sightseeing. The bathroom was small as well, but it didnâ€™t matter to us as it was still very modern. The rainfall shower head was a nice touch as well. All the service was speedy and everyone was super courteous to us. Check-in was a breeze! The only downfall I would have to note is that the walls are very thin and you could hear everyone coming in and out of their rooms within your little block of rooms. You could also hear people talking loudly and sneezing and coughing. Overall though, for the location and service, it was a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: doyledOttawa
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fairmont Queen E for 3 nights in July 2009 and had a fantastic time. We travelled by train, and it could not be any easier. You get off the train and you don't ever have to go outside as the hotel is accessible through the underground. The hotel lobby is beautiful, we had a room on the 16th floor with magnificent views of downtown, and the service was absolutely superb. We stayed in a 'Fairmont room', and no it is not huge, but it was certainly big enough for us to be comfortable. The bathroom is quaint and petite, but it has everything you need, including bathrobes, hairdryers, a clothesline, etc. The hotel location is fantastic, and the concierge desk will do anything they can to help you with your activities while in Montreal. They guide you to the proper metro/subway, they explain what the cab fares should be so you are well equipped, they get you to where you want to go in the appropriate/cost savings fashion. Excellent service. We used to pool every night we were at the Queen E, and it was a fantastic way to end a busy day...between the pool, the jacuzzi and work out room, you really cannot go wrong. Very accommodating for any age as there was also a wading pool for very young children. I would recommend the Queen E to anyone planning a stay in Montreal. I would strongly recommend signing up for a President's Club membership before your arrival as you will enjoy free internet access (otherwise $13.95 + tax per 24 hrs) and a morning newspaper every day of your stay. You also accumulate points which can be used towards a future stay. I will always return to the Queen E when travelling to Montreal...so easy, so friendly, and very nice accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Great city location”
Reviews.Author: svensktiger
Reviews.Content: The grand dame of Montreal is showing her age a bit, but she certainly has got charm. If you are looking for a centrally located hotel and get a good offer, this is a solid choice. Overall historically interesting! First, staying in the hotel feels like a journey back to the early 90s. Needs a restoration! Second, a series of celebrities over the years have here. If you get a chance, pop by suite 1742, that's where Lennon/Ono held their 2nd Bed-In "Give Peace a Chance" event. Booked via an offer from hotels.com. Although I have chosen to just give a 3 rate does not mean I am an unhappy camper in any sense. It's just to keep a fair balance to other hotels I have scored here at TA. Last time in town I stayed at the Sofitel (3 blocks away), which I grade close to a 5 -- but costs naturally more. Thanks ODtravelers from Wisconsin for the previous TA tips on the deli street, 2 floors down from lobby, at train station level. That was a great place to do breakfast! Got a standard room at 10th floor, which was all OK. Think the rooms are fairly tiny as per North American standards. Essentially the bathroom. But it worked out fine. I really missed a safe box in the room though to lock up my belongings securely. Another security related wish is a "lift key" so only people staying in the hotel have access to the floors. The room was unfortunately not so soundproof. Some noise during night from guests coming back and heard the neighbors TVs through, which was slightly annoying. Gym is OK, equipment a bit dated. They also have a nice pool.

Reviews.Title: “A stunning hotel with interesting history in a central location”
Reviews.Author: ForeverYoung50
Reviews.Content: This beautiful hotel is right on the main street of Montreal in the heart of the city. Many tourist attractions are within easy walking distance and transport (bus, metro and rail) are virtually at the door. The entrance and foyer are very grand and the staff are very welcoming (such friendly doormen!). Don't be deceived by the hotel's "Beaver Restaurant", it may look very expensive but it's really quite reasonable and offers a complete selection of fine food, from club sandwiches to gourmet meals. Our room was on the 13th floor and overlooked Mont Royal and McGill University ... absolutely breathtaking!
